story:
Fragrant harbour are many persons. It is their stories. It’s the places. Fragrant Harbour is about home, fragrant harbour is home. 

In A Nutshell

Hi, I'm Jonathan Chan, I write songs and I'm from Hong Kong! After more than a year's worth of songwriting, recording, mixing and mastering, I have finished my first ever full length album! This album revolves around the place I call home, the dreams and the memories, the images and experiences, struggles and triumphs. Amidst the darkening times, it hopes. Above is the lyric video of the lead single, Aroma. 

I wrote and produced this album myself, these songs represent a lot to me and I believe they will represent a lot to many others too. I'm incredibly critical of my own work, this is the best work I've done and for me to say that this is the best work I've done to date is a big deal to me. In this day and age where music is bought and sold at the click of a mouse, I believe that being able to hand someone a CD will bring deeper connection and meaning to the songs. And looking at the way vinyl records are nowadays, this CD will probably be an antique in about 10 years, it could be a good investment! Hence, by committing to this project, I hope my music will become much more tangible and valuable to the people it reaches. I want these songs to be heard and they deserve to be realised physically. Plus, this is also a really good excuse to pull out the old walkman and relive the 90's, there's no pretending here, you know you want to.

What I Need & What You Get

I need to print a minimum of 100 copies to get the album printed, printers will charge unreasonable amounts for any less or refuse to print at all. I think they're still slightly in denial about digital music. Printing is expensive and I'm a fresh grad, so you gotta help me out here. To help you make the decision, I've included a bonus track, you're welcome. Also, all backers will have their name down in the album booklet as supporters. I've even included an option for me recording you a cover song of your choice! If I don't reach the entire goal, I will cover the cost out of my own pocket and make sure my backers receive their albums and other perks, but McDonalds increased their special value meals from $21 to $22, so money is tight. Any extra after reaching the goal will go to the video production expense. Nowadays not even the MTR will leave alone on the train, so by supporting this campaign, you're not only supporting the local music scene, you're being miles better than the MTR (if that's saying much, but you guys are awesome anyway). 

The Impact

I think that people out there need to hear these songs, I think it will inspire listeners and give them a new perspective on things going on around them, and you will be one of the first to experience that! Getting this album printed will get the music further than I could ever do so by performing. I believe also that having these albums printed physically opens up a channel of communication between me and listeners that will allow the songs to come alive and reach greater depths. 

Risks & Challenges

If I don't reach the goal, I will have to pay the difference out of my own pocket and that will challenge my financial situation. Tell your friends about this campaign and come to my performances! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't back the campaign, you can still make some noise! Tell your friends about the album, invite your friends to performances, anything that gets the word out! The share buttons are just there ;)

Album info:

9 tracks + 1 bonus track

38 Minutes

38 Minutes

story:
South African based, singer songwriter Natalie Rungan, with 3 albums under belt, felt a need for a change in direction from Jazz/ RnB and started writing music for her first Gospel album in October 2014. Being involved in church music from as early as 5years old, this is a natural progression for her career. She is excited about this journey ahead and would love you to partner in on it in whatever way you can. This isn't charity in any way, not what this campaign is about. You can pre-order the album by selecting one of the "perks" options. As an ambassador of C.H.O.C Natalie has committed that a percentage of every cd sold will go to the organization as part of her social responsibility. 

Here's a little background on Natalie. She studied music at primary school, Secondary School and University where she excelled in vocal performance. Natalie attributes her love for music from her involvement in church at a very early age. She is a popular performer in Jazz and Gospel circles, listing her musician grandfather, and her father as her two earliest influences. Natalie’s vocal range now sits at three octaves having many sounds; from sultry, to folk, to husky, to a belting alto. 

Natalie graduated from the University of Natal with a Bachelor in Music. She taught jazz vocals at the University of Natal for seven years in the jazz studies programme. Natalie completed her Masters Degree in Jazz Performance, Composition and Arranging.Her smooth vocal styling honed by hours of tireless practice and superior knowledge of jazz saw her travel from Harare, Zimbabwe to Boston, New York, Germany, Scotland and Sweden as a student.

Natalie has performed at numerous local and national events including the reception dinner for Prince Albert of Monaco and Princess Charlene in July 2011. One of the greatest highlights of 2013 was Natalie being invited to sing at the official memorial service for our nations father, Nelson Mandela in Soweto in December, alongside the countries finest. She has performed with the KZN Philharmonic Orchestra, alongside Loyiso Bala, Toya Delazy and Melanie Lowe. Natalie is in the process of starting her Phd in Music Education, specializing in music therapy.

    www.choc.org.za

story:
Hello, and thank you for checking out my campaign! My name is Sean Francis, and I am currently the creative force behind my solo project, Pigasus. So far, I have recorded two albums independently since November 2015, and I am now at the stage where I would like to have them released on CD.

This funds from this campaign will be entirely devoted to having both of the currently existing Pigasus albums released on CD. Normally, this is something that I would just do gigs for, but at the moment there isn't really a "band" to take on the road since it has been a solo recording project. That's why I have turned to Indiegogo, and of course my fans and friends, old and new, for support in this mighty endeavor.

Releasing an album (in this case, two) isn't necessarily hard, but it takes some serious resources if you want to create a professional physical artifact that you can be proud of for many years to come. That is where you, my prospective contributors, come in. Your contributions will help to make this dream of mine a reality. Pigasus has been my passion project since August 2015, and this is some of the most genuine and powerful music I have ever had the privilege to make. This music is important to me because it is genuinely inspired by major events that have taken place in my life recently, and that is why I have decided to take these albums to the next level.

In total, I hope to raise $2,000 with this campaign. I've been gathering research and getting quotes since November, and it will cost about $1,000 to have each album manufactured right here in Wyoming. This would be a small release, probably about 250 copies or less of each album. By conventional record release standards, this is pretty small peanuts, but it's pretty typical for artists like myself who are independent and DIY.

There are a number of different perks available for funding this release, which I hope you will check out. Lots of good stuff in there, and chances to grab both albums at once which is nice! Other goodies include two exclusive podcasts talking about the making of both Mk I and Rebel Spirit, in terms of how I actually recorded everything and the events that inspired the music.

One of the most frequent questions you get when you're doing crowdfunding is "What if you don't make your goal," and it's a legitimate question, so here's the answer. If i don't make my goal, you still come out with all of the music that I have on offer, and the funds accumulated from my contributors will still go toward the release of both albums. Plain and simple. I'm not out to get rich off of my friends and fans, my goal is singular: get this music in your hands.

If you're still reading this, I'll assume that you're with me in this cause. There are a lot of good reasons that I have for seeing this campaign through to the end. I keep returning to the fact that this music is inspired by events in my life, and that is honestly the biggest reason that I am pushing this so hard. The first album, Mk I, was made in the wake of a very tumultuous time in my life. In the summer of 2015, my life took an unexpected turn when my sciatica went from manageable to miserable. I had been struggling with it for some time, and things finally got out of hand in June of 2015. The pain (which was being caused by some severely herniated discs impinging on my sciatic nerve) was unlike anything I had ever endured before, and it very effectively stopped me from being able to work or play music for a couple of months.

Eventually I was able to start getting treatment for it, which has turned the situation around significantly. Once I was strong enough to stand with a guitar again for more than a few minutes at a time, I started writing new material and reshaping material that I had written with some of my other bands in mind. The material came together very quickly, and I was inspired to record the guitar and vocal parts. The other instrument parts came together quickly, which was surprising since I hadn't been able to play much drums or bass over the summer.

Much of what emerged lyrically on Mk I is about meeting changes and challenges head on, as well as having the fortitude to push through the hard times into better days. During that summer, I connected with a number of people who were also suffering from chronic pain conditions. A common thread running through all of our lives was the need for a return to normalcy, but also a need for solace and hope through the recovery. I tried to reflect this struggle in the song "Living In The Ruin," which is about chronic pain and how exhausting it is both physically and psychologically.

The album Mk I was pre-released on Bandcamp in January 2016 to help fund the final stages of production, and it is currently being mixed and mastered by Patrick Hogg, (Sludge Studios). With that album all packed up, I started work on Rebel Spirit as a part of the 2016 RPM Challenge. The challenge was to write and record an album (minimum 10 songs/35 minutes) in the month of February. This album is a body of work that I'm very proud of. I was still recording even on the very last day of February and submitted the album to RPM at 5:36 a.m. on March 1, 2016 after spending most of the night doing the first mix of the album.

Rebel Spirit is a special project to me. Instead of using my Fostex VF160 and my computer to produce this album, I used a Tascam Porta One Mini Studio, which is an analog four-track tape recorder. I was able to make a very powerful sounding album with a tape machine, an old Allen & Heath GL2 Mixer, and a handful of microphones. The Fostex machine did come back into play for recording vocals, but all of the instrument recordings are 100% analog. Lyrically, Rebel Spirit is about a growing disenchantment that I have been feeling while watching events unfold in the media like some kind of circus. All the while, nothing significant changes, and people are numb to the chaos around them. Internally, I fight to resist this desensitized existence, and disavow the culture of prejudice and fear whose roots run deep. My friend and former bandmate Kaleb Richey has agreed to mix and master Rebel Spirit. As of today (March 18, 2016) I will be submitting the tracks to him so that the album will be produced while this campaign is running.

Indiegogo is a great tool for gathering support from people who believe in your project and your passion. In 2013 my former band Harpoon, the Whale raised funds for it's first album, We All Glow, We All Fade with Indiegogo. That campaign ended up meeting its goal and then some - enough to make an EP (Seeing Things In Green) while the full album was being mixed and mastered. This is my first time doing an Indiegogo campaign on my own, and I'm excited to watch this come to fruition. With your help, this can become a genuine DIY dual cd release. Even if you aren't able to contribute financially, you can still help by sharing this campaign on your social media.

story:
[For English Version]


Le festival d’été Passovah, c’est quoi?

C’est en 2012 que j’ai eu l’idée de fonder le Festival d’été Passovah (FEP) pour célébrer la musique locale. Lors de sa première édition, 24 artistes locaux se sont produits sur la scène du Il Motore pour de courtes performances. La programmation ambitieuse et la formule “payez selon vos moyens” du festival ont assuré son succès. La troisième édition du festival (2014) etait la plus audacieuse jusqu’à présent : 4 jours de spectacles avec plus de 60 artistes dans 6 salles, appuyé par une équipe d’employés et de bénévoles. Également au programme : un party d’ouverture et une soirée dansante, le tout couronné par une performance électrisante de Suuns. C’était fou, fou, fou!

Malgré les succès des années précédentes, festival dépend toujours de la bonne volonté et du travail acharné - et pour la plupart sous-rémunéré - de l’équipe. Bref, nous n’acceptons plus que nos artistes et notre équipe de production travaillent pour des pinottes. Alors voici ce que nous souhaitons pour la quatrième édition: un festival de plus grande envergure avec une ambiance plus professionnelle, mais surtout un festival qui reflète mieux les convictions de Passovah. Nous faisons donc appel à votre aide pour ramasser les quelques milliers de dollars qui permettront au festival de prendre son essor.

FEP est avant tout un festival de musique. Nous sommes fiers d’avoir présenté des centaines de groupes durant nos éditions précédentes.



Raison d’être du festival

  • Un festival montréalais conçu par des montréalais et complètement dévoué à la magie de la scène locale.
  • Une plateforme pour diffuser la musique émergente dans un contexte qui nous plaît (et qui plaît d’ailleurs aux artistes!)
  • Spectacles abordables où on invite les gens à découvrir des artistes de la scène locale.
  • Un lieu de rencontre pour les artistes locaux où ils peuvent d’ailleurs collaborer et faire mûrir leurs projets.
  • Un milieu où règnent la diversité et l’inclusion.
  • Salles de spectacles de premier plan.
  • Expérience de scène pour artistes émergents.
  • Équipe expérimentée et astucieuse à l’affût de la scène locale.
  • Un milieu sain et engageant où les musiciens peuvent acquérir les outils et l’expérience pour travailler dans une industrie internationale.
  • Nous reconnaissons et respectons les origines et les objectifs variés des artistes.

Pourquoi demandons-nous votre aide? Et quelques mots sur les retombées du festival.

Cette campagne de financement a pour but d’assurer la pérennité et la diversité du FEP pour les années à venir. Ce financement, en plus d’assurer le bon déroulement du festival, couvrira les cachets versés aux artistes, la location de salles et d’équipement, de même que les frais de publicité.


Si notre campagne Indiegogo réussit, nous allons...

  • Augmenter les sommes versées aux artistes et à l’équipe du festival.
  • Augmenter le nombre d’entrées en rejoignant un public de plus en plus large et diversifié.
  • Mettre l’accent sur les aspects professionnels du festival, au profit des artistes et des participants.
  • Améliorer la qualité sonore des spectacles grâce à la location d’équipement audio.
  • Engager une équipe de marketing pour accroître le rayonnement du festival à Montréal et dans ses environs

Nous avons plein de bonnes idées, mais nous voulons les mener à bien sans faire sauter la banque. Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’autres sources de financement; cependant, cette campagne de financement participatif nous aidera à décoller. Grâce à vos dons, nous aurons les moyens de réaliser un festival inclusif qui met les artistes ET les participants à l’avant-scène. Malgré les succès de l’an dernier, la situation financière du festival demeure précaire. Et voilà pourquoi nous demandons votre aide. Avec cette campagne, nous souhaitons également soutenir un dialogue sur la viabilité de l’industrie musicale. Alors n’hésitez pas de participer au forum de discussion de la campagne FEP!

Merci d’avance pour vos dons! Nous nous fixons un objectif de 5000 $ pour cette campagne, mais nous souhaitons bien le dépasser. Plus vous donnez, plus vous aidez! Si nous atteignons notre cible de 5000 $, nous établirons un cachet minimum pour tous les artistes. Certains artistes gagnerons plus que le minimum, mais aucun artiste ne tombera sous le seuil établi. D’ailleurs, chaque donateur recevra un remerciement sur notre site web. 

Si nous dépassons les 10 000 $, nous augmenterons encore le cachet minimum. DE PLUS, vous recevrez un article arborant le logo de Passovah pour vos dons de 20 $ ou plus!

Si nous ramassons 15 000 $ ou plus, le cachet minimum versé aux artistes passera à 150 $. Nous organiserons également une fête après le festival pour tous les artistes, l’équipe de production et tous ceux qui auront fait un don à la campagne de financement!

En donnant vos sous, vous assurez le succès de cette quatrième édition du festival ET la pérennité du festival pour les années à venir.  


L’équipe du FEP

Noah Bick - Directeur artistique, Philippe Manasseh - Design graphique et coordonnateur du contenu web, Melanie Turner - Marketing, Jesse Bernstein - Directeur des commandites et du développement, Boris Volfson - Coordonnateur de la campagne de financement participatif, Éric Lamoureux - Traduction, Sarah Shoucri - Relations de presse, Nick Maas - Adjoint administratif


Salles de spectacle du FEP

Bar Le Ritz PDB, Casa Del Popolo, La Sala Rossa, La Vitrola, Cafe Resonance, Théâtre Fairmount, La Maison Sociale et Nouveau Palais


RÉCOMPENSES!

Nous vous offrons toutes sortes de récompenses extraordinaires! Vous n’aurez qu’à parcourir la liste des récompenses pour voir que la scène montréalaise donne son appui au FEP!


Appendix

Le festival aura lieu du 26 au 30 août - notez-le sur vos calendriers!


English Version


What is Passovah Summer Fest?

In 2012, I came up with the idea for the Passovah Summer Fest (PSF), with the intention of celebrating local music. The first edition of the festival took place at Il Motore and featured 24 local acts performing short sets over two days. Despite the ambitious premise, the pay what you can mini-festival went off without a hitch. Last year (the 3rd edition) was the most ambitious to date: 4 days, more than 60 acts, and 6 fantastic venues. We had a staff, volunteers, an opening event, a dance party, and a blowout Suuns show. It was wild!

The previous years have been great. But the honest truth is that PSF runs on the good will and almost exclusively undervalued labour of the people who make the festival possible. We at Passovah are tired of paying musicians and our staff next to nothing for their effort. We seek to make the 4th edition of PSF bigger, better, more professional, and most importantly more consistent with the Passovah ethics. To make this possible we need your help to raise a few thousand dollars to get the festival off the ground.

Above all PSF is about the music. We're proud to have had hundreds of acts over the last few years.



Our festival matters because we provide :

  • A Montreal Festival by Montrealers that embraces the magic of the local music scene
  • Emerging music in the context that we love (and know artists prefer playing in :) )  
  • An affordable concert experience. We want to get people out to shows and check out some local bands
  • A place for local musicians to meet, collaborate and expand their projects
  • A diverse, and accepting creative environment
  • High quality performance venues
  • Performance experience for emerging bands
  • Experienced, and knowledgeable festival staff who are connected to the local scene
  • A safe and supportive space where musicians can gain the necessary tools and experience required to work in an international industry
  • We are aware that local artists come from different places and have different goals, and strive to respect this reality.

Why we need your help? And what you'll get in return?

PSF is focused on creating a more sustainable and diverse festival, and we need your help to secure seed funding. Having a proper budget for essentials such as guaranteed amount of money for artists, venue rental, gear backline and advertising would ensure that PSF runs smoothly.

If we achieve our Indiegogo Campaign goal we will:

  • Pay bands and festival staff a fair wage
  • Increase attendance by marketing to a larger and more diverse audience
  • Establish a more professional festival experience for musicians and attendees
  • Increase the production value of showcases by having backlines (shared rented gear)
  • Increase awareness and reach of the festival across the city and region by hiring a marketing staff

We have tons of good ideas but don’t want to get ourselves into financial trouble. :/  We are working on other ways of funding this festival, however the crowdfunding campaign will help us get us off the ground. By donating, you’ll be giving us the green light to produce an artist and fan friendly event with less financial limitations. Last year was great, but that model was unsustainable. We want you to help change that. 

1) If we reach our initial goal of $5,000 we will establish a minimum fee for all artist playing the festival. While some artist will still get paid more than others nobody will make less than the minimum rate. Everybody who donated to the campaign will receive a thank you on our website. 

2) If we hit $7,500 we will establish a minimum fee of $100 for all artist playing the festival.

3) If we raise $10,000 we will be able to raise the minimum fee even higher. PLUS everybody who donates over $20 to the campaign will receive a free piece of Passovah merch!

4) If we raise $15,000 we will be able to raise the minimum fee for all artists playing the fest to $150. We will also throw a party after the festival for all the artists, staff and everybody who contributed to the campaign! 

For every additional $5,000 we raise after the initial $5,000 will put away $1,000 for next year's PSF. By contributing to our campaign you are not only helping us make this year's festival a success, but are contributing the long term health of this thing.


The people behind PSF

Noah Bick - Creative Director, Philippe Manasseh  - Graphics and Online Content Coordinator, Melanie Turner - Marketing , Jesse Bernstein - Director of Sponsorship & Development, Boris Volfson -  Crowdfunding co-ordinator , Eric Lamoureux - Translation, Sarah Shoucri - Publicist, and Nick Maas - Administrative Assistant


What venues we plan to use

This year we're excited to have: Bar Le Ritz PDB, Casa Del Popolo, La Sala Rossa, La Vitrola, Cafe Resonance, Théâtre Fairmount, La Maison Sociale and Nouveau Palais as venues.


PERKS!

We have some incredible perks! Check em out! All sorts of great folks have contributed to this campaign, a sign that the local music community supports the PSF cause!


Appendix 

With this campaign we hope to create dialogue about sustainable ways of negotiating the current state of the music industry. Feel free to use the discussion board of this campaign to begin the conversation!

Please keep August 26th- 30th open on your calendars! :)
story_txt:
[For English Version]

Le festival d’été Passovah, c’est quoi?

C’est en 2012 que j’ai eu l’idée de fonder le Festival d’été Passovah (FEP) pour célébrer la musique locale. Lors de sa première édition, 24 artistes locaux se sont produits sur la scène du Il Motore pour de courtes performances. La programmation ambitieuse et la formule “payez selon vos moyens” du festival ont assuré son succès. La troisième édition du festival (2014) etait la plus audacieuse jusqu’à présent : 4 jours de spectacles avec plus de 60 artistes dans 6 salles, appuyé par une équipe d’employés et de bénévoles. Également au programme : un party d’ouverture et une soirée dansante, le tout couronné par une performance électrisante de Suuns. C’était fou, fou, fou!Malgré les succès des années précédentes, festival dépend toujours de la bonne volonté et du travail acharné - et pour la plupart sous-rémunéré - de l’équipe. Bref, nous n’acceptons plus que nos artistes et notre équipe de production travaillent pour des pinottes. Alors voici ce que nous souhaitons pour la quatrième édition: un festival de plus grande envergure avec une ambiance plus professionnelle, mais surtout un festival qui reflète mieux les convictions de Passovah. Nous faisons donc appel à votre aide pour ramasser les quelques milliers de dollars qui permettront au festival de prendre son essor.
FEP est avant tout un festival de musique. Nous sommes fiers d’avoir présenté des centaines de groupes durant nos éditions précédentes.



Raison d’être du festival


Un festival montréalais conçu
     par des montréalais et complètement dévoué à la magie de la scène locale.
Une plateforme pour diffuser la
     musique émergente dans un contexte qui nous plaît (et qui plaît d’ailleurs
     aux artistes!)
Spectacles abordables où on
     invite les gens à découvrir des artistes de la scène locale.
Un lieu de rencontre pour les
     artistes locaux où ils peuvent d’ailleurs collaborer et faire mûrir leurs
     projets.
Un milieu où règnent la
     diversité et l’inclusion.
Salles de spectacles de premier
     plan.
Expérience de scène pour
     artistes émergents.
Équipe expérimentée et
     astucieuse à l’affût de la scène locale.
Un milieu sain et engageant où
     les musiciens peuvent acquérir les outils et l’expérience pour travailler
     dans une industrie internationale.
Nous reconnaissons et
     respectons les origines et les objectifs variés des artistes.


Pourquoi demandons-nous votre aide? Et quelques mots sur
les retombées du festival.
Cette campagne de financement a pour
but d’assurer la pérennité et la diversité du FEP pour les années à venir. Ce
financement, en plus d’assurer le bon déroulement du festival, couvrira les
cachets versés aux artistes, la location de salles et d’équipement, de même que
les frais de publicité.

Si notre campagne Indiegogo réussit, nous allons...


Augmenter les sommes versées
     aux artistes et à l’équipe du festival.


Augmenter le nombre d’entrées
     en rejoignant un public de plus en plus large et diversifié.
Mettre l’accent sur les aspects
     professionnels du festival, au profit des artistes et des participants.
Améliorer la qualité sonore des
     spectacles grâce à la location d’équipement audio.
Engager une équipe de marketing
     pour accroître le rayonnement du festival à Montréal et dans ses environs


Nous avons plein de bonnes idées,
mais nous voulons les mener à bien sans faire sauter la banque. Nous sommes
présentement à la recherche d’autres sources de financement; cependant, cette
campagne de financement participatif nous aidera à décoller. Grâce à vos dons,
nous aurons les moyens de réaliser un festival inclusif qui met les artistes ET
les participants à l’avant-scène. Malgré les succès de l’an dernier, la
situation financière du festival demeure précaire. Et voilà pourquoi nous
demandons votre aide. Avec cette campagne, nous souhaitons également soutenir
un dialogue sur la viabilité de l’industrie musicale. Alors n’hésitez pas de
participer au forum de discussion de la campagne FEP!
Merci d’avance pour vos dons! Nous
nous fixons un objectif de 5000 $ pour cette campagne, mais nous souhaitons
bien le dépasser. Plus vous donnez, plus vous aidez! Si nous atteignons notre
cible de 5000 $, nous établirons un cachet minimum pour tous les artistes.
Certains artistes gagnerons plus que le minimum, mais aucun artiste ne tombera
sous le seuil établi. D’ailleurs, chaque donateur recevra un remerciement sur
notre site web. 
Si nous dépassons les 10 000 $, nous
augmenterons encore le cachet minimum. DE PLUS, vous recevrez un article
arborant le logo de Passovah pour vos dons de 20 $ ou plus!
Si nous ramassons 15 000 $ ou plus,
le cachet minimum versé aux artistes passera à 150 $. Nous organiserons
également une fête après le festival pour tous les artistes, l’équipe de
production et tous ceux qui auront fait un don à la campagne de financement!
En donnant vos sous, vous assurez le
succès de cette quatrième édition du festival ET la pérennité du festival pour
les années à venir.  


L’équipe du FEP
Noah Bick - Directeur artistique,
Philippe Manasseh - Design graphique et coordonnateur du contenu web, Melanie
Turner - Marketing, Jesse Bernstein - Directeur des commandites et du
développement, Boris Volfson - Coordonnateur de la campagne de financement
participatif, Éric Lamoureux - Traduction, Sarah Shoucri - Relations de presse,
Nick Maas - Adjoint administratif

Salles de spectacle du FEP
Bar Le Ritz PDB, Casa Del Popolo, La Sala Rossa, La
Vitrola, Cafe Resonance, Théâtre Fairmount, La Maison Sociale et Nouveau Palais

RÉCOMPENSES!
Nous vous offrons toutes sortes de
récompenses extraordinaires! Vous n’aurez qu’à parcourir la liste des récompenses
pour voir que la scène montréalaise donne son appui au FEP!AppendixLe festival aura lieu du 26 au 30 août - notez-le sur vos calendriers!

In 2012, I came up with the idea for the Passovah Summer Fest (PSF), with the
intention of celebrating local music. The first edition of the festival took
place at Il Motore and featured 24 local acts performing short sets over two
days. Despite the ambitious premise, the pay what you can mini-festival went
off without a hitch. Last year (the 3rd edition) was
the most ambitious to date: 4 days, more than 60 acts, and 6 fantastic venues.
We had a staff, volunteers, an opening event, a dance party, and a blowout
Suuns show. It was wild!
The previous years have been great. But the honest truth is that PSF runs on the good will and almost exclusively undervalued labour of the people who make the festival possible. We at Passovah are tired of paying musicians and our staff next to nothing for their effort. We seek to make the 4th edition of PSF bigger, better, more professional, and most importantly more consistent with the Passovah ethics. To make this
possible we need your help to raise a few thousand dollars to get the festival
off the ground.Above all PSF is about the music. We're proud to have had hundreds of acts over the last few years.

story:
We’re running a new campaign!

If you haven’t seen our emails, be sure to check it out: https://igg.me/at/keepMOROWalive/x/1761963

See you there!

Original 2013 Pitch below

MOROW needs you

MOROW is THE Progressive Rock Webradio available at www.morow.com

 

Morow is with you for years. With its recognizable sound and its programming, you rediscover your classic but also discover all the news from the world of Rock and Progressive Metal.

But today Morow is in danger...

Morow even accompany you on your Android or iOS mobile phone via a dedicated app for iPhone and iPod touch but also through various webradio applications on Android.

Behind Morow there is 2 people: Bruno and Arnaud.

Bruno founded MOROW in order to share his passion for progressive rock adding his skills : programming and sound worthy of the greatest FM radios.

Arnaud joined him in his passion while making what he does best: manage all the technical part, the website, the iPhone app and the servers that you do not see.

Obligations, but also go further!

From the beginning, Morow was a personal project, carried on the equity of Bruno and Arnaud. But today, we must fulfill contractual and legal obligations that do not permit us to continue this way

We need to fund our legal obligations for past years ( rights holders ) but also for the year 2014.

Without that, unfortunately, we can no longer provide this wonderful radio...

But we also want to go further ! Better sound quality apps for all your devices : iPhone, Android, Windows 8, A new website with social networking

Morow has always been free and will remain so for you ! Morow is how we love it : without advertising. Music, just music!

More than ever we need you to continue to share with you all our passion !

What we need

For this funding, we need 5000 €.

This money will be used to cover our costs of distribution contracts for the past years and 2014 to come. This includes :

remuneration of rights holders (~ € 4500 )

payment servers and bandwidth 2014 ( ~ 500 € )

In reward for your donations , we will give you a gift (depending on the amount of the donation).

If we reach some funding, we will guaranty you some functionnalities :

- 6000€ : new website with social abilities

- 7000€ : brand new iphone app

- 8000€ : android, windows phone 8 and windows 8 apps!

- and more... : we have ton of ideas!

Spread the word

Friends, spread the word ! Have you contributed or not, share on Facebook, Twitter, email. Talk to your loved ones. Help us to continue the adventure!

Thank you to everyone,

Bruno Dubois, CEO of To Be Prog, the Non-Profit Organization behind morow.com
Arnaud de Mouhy, treasurer of the organization

story:
Hello Everyone, and thank you for taking the time to read this. My name Is David, also know as Funeral Boy and Lydia Noir. I am a drag performer and aspiring musician. The reason why I am making this campaign is to help me raise money to get my first album produced by a really great producer that I am hoping to work with. I know that indiegogo's have been very helpful in the past with aspiring artists like myself, and I would love to finally put out the album i've been writing and working on for a couple of years now. All of the lyrics are ready to go. I just need to get equiptment for recording vocals and the funds to produce this album.

I have been working on this project for a while because it is something that I have put a lot of emotion into over the last few years. It is full of my heart and soul and tells the tale of personal struggles many people can relate to. I want this album to help others that might have gone through or are going through experiences that I know all too well. I overcame one of the darkest times in my entire life and I know that for a fact, I am stronger because of this. I am so excited for this to happen, and I really really hope to make this happen with the help from you guys and girls that understand that art is one way to save you from yourself when you just want to give up.
I will be making special packages for supporters to show my appreciation, so make sure to check them out and pick whichever one you'd like!

This album is one of the most important things to me. I am so proud of myself when it comes to this album and I feel like it has allowed me to finally follow my dreams.

Also make sure to check out my facebook page for updates and a little bit more about myself http://funeralboy.com

Much love to everyone that took the time to read this.
You all are great.
XO
Funeral Boy

story:
About Wienananda
 
Wienananda is a multicultural group of musicians from Vienna. We are all Sahaja Yogis and are writing and performing songs which are meant to elevate our audience to a level of oneness with the Spirit. Most compositions are built on ancient sanskrit mantras which are brought to life through beautiful melodic structures. The group has got enthusiastic responses at many concerts and music festivals around Europe. So far we recorded two studio albums: 'The Joy of Vienna' (2010) and 'Pure Joy'. (2012)
 
Why this campaign?
 
Many Sahaja Yogis have asked about the availability of 'The Joy of Vienna', the first Wienananda album. As it has been sold out for quite a while we would like to reprint it and have it available for you this summer.
 
How can you help us?
 
We would like to involve you in the funding of this reprint project. it is not a very small sum for us, so it would need to be crowd-funded at the moment.
 
Therefore we heartily ask everybody who would like to see the CD reprinted to support us:
 
Non-financially:
  • sharing this campaign in facebook and google+
  • send this campaign to your local and national email lists 
  • speak about it to your friends and family
  • use the indiegogo tools

and/or

Financially:

  • buy a perk for you and your friends
  • organise a collective order
 
The budget - 1900 Euro
 
  • 1300 Euro cost for the reprint.
  • Indigogo gets 4% if we reach the 1900 Euro, if not then it would be 9%. Another 3% goes to creditcard companies and paypal as for their financial service.
  • The rest of the money will be used to cover the shipment costs of the campaign perks to be sent around the world.

The perks

You can choose between:

  • - A small sum to support the project without anything but gratitude in return
  • - A free download of the CD
  • - Collective packages with CDs that we would send around the world

The music:

Listen to our music here:

https://www.facebook.com/wienananda.music

http://www.reverbnation.com/wienanandathejoyofvienna

 

THANK YOU for your help! Surely we will reach our goal with your love and support.

Lots of Love,

The Wienanandas

story:
In my life I want to bring together my musical abilities and my family responsibilities with this ptoject. Presently my wife and I look after our extraordinary 23 year son, who has a label of "profound & multiple learning disabilities" and is a wonderful joy to be with! So I need to create a musical pathwaywhich respects this vital part of my life and allows me to bring my singing a & songwriting abilities to people too: The Humanitarium Project!


    The Humanitarium Project (Phase 1 - THIS ONE!) starts in France, in Autumn 2013

    • 8 musician-songwriters from 5 continents are coming together for 6 days to share the endeavour of co-creating & playing 12 original song-pieces on 1 album – for you!
    • This Summer Recording & Songwriting project is organized and co-ordinated by Fergus & Gaia; here's a link to a video by them about it: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uy7gyVFjGNE&feature=share&list=UUyoW8NDbU6eG4XeUhs_4ENw
    • About themselves they say: "Round Flat Records was founded to help promote and distribute exciting blends of world and folk music.  We have a small recording studio in the south of France and promote gigs and events throughout Europe for our various acts."                             Here's a link to Round Flat Records:                              http://fjsm33.wix.com/roundflatrecords#!about-us

    We’ll generate synergy – we’ll incinerate energy – because you’re worth it!

    • To be involved with this is a great honour for me, so I’m delighted to invite you to join in! I’ve always wanted to do something like this (since I was 15 years old!) but have been aware, and wary, of the amount of exploitation in the music business.

     The Humanitarium Project is where you come in!

    1. Phase 1 (THIS ONE!) is the “live” studio album co created and played by 8 of us, is it in a nutshell.
    2. Phase 2 will be a solo album from myself, including songs around disability (Nov/Dec 2013) – “Reaching Out Inside”
    3. Phase 3 will be an inclusive double album with people with learning disabilities & musicians (& me!) -  a mixture of original live & studio tracks, (Jan/Mar 2014) –  “Musiclusion”

    How much you decide to give is up to you (see perks below): remember publicity is as valuable as money - if you can get someone like, say, Stephen Fry to re-tweet my Indiegogo pitch on Twitter ….! (Then what I could achieve increases exponentially & all my costs go up a thousandfold and it’s an album a month for the next 10 years!)(Also all our servers crash!)

    • A Little Life Refreshment:                                                                         I’ve been singing for 55 years, playing music for 45 years, writing songs for 40 years – and I’m ready! I was in the school choir from 11 years old (first soprano then tenor eventually bass) I was a drummer and vocalist in various bands (hippy then heavy rock then melodic rock then alternative then punk then commune then thrash rock duo then indie) between the ages of 16-34. Since then I’ve learnt melody instruments (!) : some guitar, some banjo, some tamboura, some ukulele (soprano) & some more ukulele (baritone this time!)              I’ve  written 200-300 songs over that time, the last 3 years have been really productive during which I’ve written about 100 of them, & more seem to be arriving each week!

    Along with all this I’ve been involved with people and learning disabilities (especially PMLD) for over 20 years now, including some wonderful music projects and performances!           

    I’m a hard worker, for music, for inclusion, for an alternative to competition & exploitation, nothing will be wasted in our shared endeavour of acceptance through creativity.    

    OK, so here’s where the money will go:

    • Travel - 5%
    • Recording costs (my share) - 20%
    • Accommodation - 2%
    • Producing 1,000 CD’s (& jewel cases & Performing Rights fees) – 40%
    • Producing cover (& artwork & contents) – 9%
    • Postage & packing 300CD’s – 11%
    • Indiegogo fees - 9%
    • PayPal fees - 4%

    Here’s my Humanitarium perk collator:

    For £9 -  you can get a digital download of the whole Humanitarium album

    + name on the credits
    + e-updates

    For just £17 - you will get a signed CD
    + a digital download of the Humanitarium album
    + name on credits
    + e-updates

    For only £25 - you will get a signed CD PLUS 2 extra tracks not on the album
    + a digital download of the Humanitarium album
    + name on credits
    + e-updates

    For the bargain amount of £35 -  you will get a signed CD PLUS 4, yes four, extra tracks not on the album
    + a digital download of the Humanitarium album
    + name on credits
    + e-updates

    For the princely sum of £45 - you can have a unique, unrepeatable one-off  Live concert on Skype in your very own living room!
    + a signed CD + 4 extra tracks not on the album
    + a digital download of the Humanitarium album
    + name on credits
    + e-updates

    Oh yes, £55 will obtain for you a verse of your very own, all about you, in an original song! I'll write play and record it & make it into a CD (+digital version too)
    + a  signed CD + 4 extra tracks not on the album
    + a digital download of the Humanitarium album
    + name on credits
    + e-updates

    For just a little more - £95 you can have a ukulele lesson from me PLUS a soprano ukulel of your very own! If you're in London, in person, if not by Skype and I'll post the uke to you- It'll about 30 min, we'll learn 3 or 4 chords and play at least 1 or 2 songs - any ability you have or haven't is fine!
    + a  signed CD + 4 extra tracks not on the album
    + a digital download of the Humanitarium album
    + name on credits

    For the princely/princessly sum of £99 you can get your own song!       Ta Dah!  I will compose, write, perform and record an original song all about you, just you! There'll be lead vocals, harmony vocals & acoustic instruments, percussion, etc PLUS an extra original song recorded by me
    + a  signed CD + 4 extra tracks not on the album
    + a digital download of the Humanitarium album
    + name on credits
    + e-updates

    For the jaw droppingly vast sum of £145 you can get an EP!                  Two for you and two from me - I will compose, write, perform and record two original songs all about you, or a family member, or a friend or on any theme you choose!
    There'll be lead vocals, harmony vocals & acoustic & electric instruments (EG bass and/or electric guitar and/or keyboards, etc PLUS 2 extra original songs recorded by me
    + a  signed CD + 4 extra tracks not on the album
    + a digital download of the Humanitarium album
    + name on credits
    + e-updates

    Thank you so much for reading this far, remember,

    there's no buy like a goodbye!
story_txt:
In my life I want to bring together my musical abilities and my family responsibilities with this ptoject. Presently my wife and I look after our extraordinary 23 year son, who has a label of "profound & multiple learning disabilities" and is a wonderful joy to be with! So I need to create a musical pathwaywhich respects this vital part of my life and allows me to bring my singing a & songwriting abilities to people too: The Humanitarium Project!

The Humanitarium Project (Phase 1 - THIS ONE!) starts in France, in Autumn 2013

8 musician-songwriters from 5 continents are coming together for 6 days to share the endeavour of co-creating & playing 12 original song-pieces on 1 album – for you!
This Summer Recording & Songwriting project is organized and co-ordinated by Fergus & Gaia; here's a link to a video by them about it: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uy7gyVFjGNE&feature=share&list=UUyoW8NDbU6eG4XeUhs_4ENw

About themselves they say: "Round Flat Records was founded to help promote and distribute exciting blends of world and folk music.  We have a small recording studio in the south of France and promote gigs and events throughout Europe for our various acts."                             Here's a link to Round Flat Records:                              http://fjsm33.wix.com/roundflatrecords#!about-us 

We’ll generate synergy – we’ll incinerate energy – because you’re worth it!

To be involved with this is a great honour for me, so I’m delighted to invite you to join in! I’ve always wanted to do something like this (since I was 15 years old!) but have been aware, and wary, of the amount of exploitation in the music business.

 The Humanitarium Project is where you come in!


Phase 1 (THIS ONE!) is the “live” studio album co created and played by 8 of us, is it in a nutshell.

Phase 2 will be a solo album from myself, including songs around disability (Nov/Dec 2013) – “Reaching Out Inside”

Along with all this I’ve been involved with people and learning disabilities (especially PMLD) for over 20 years now, including some wonderful music projects and performances!           
I’m a hard worker, for music, for inclusion, for an alternative to competition & exploitation, nothing will be wasted in our shared endeavour of acceptance through creativity.

story:
Hi! Hope you enjoyed our video that demonstrates why we are so very grateful to share this music with our global community. Below is a testimonial for our new CD that we finished in December.

                    

Click the arrow below to listen to one of our upbeat chants (with some great flute soloing):


   The rest of our music clips can be heard via this link: Door of the Heart Music YouTube Channel


   We need your help to recover our costs for duplication, graphics & have some left over for promotion. (We put close to $2000 on our credit card & $1000 is not a lot for promotion, especially these days when artists are doing it on their own and not through the big studios).


***We do have some great gifts or "perks" to offer for your donations! -- check them out on the side panels. We have just added some new ones. View pics in our Gallery.

     Here's our BHAKTI BLISS II musicians:

   Most of our group has been doing kirtan for a number of years.  I, personally, came onto the Spiritual Path way back in the late 70's.  One of my first chanting experiences was with Ram Dass & it literally changed my life.  (That will soon be posted on my website and our Door of the Heart Music Channel on YouTube).

   www.RobertKelaghan.com


   Since then, chanting has been a major emphasis in my sadhana or spiritual practice & I've started several other Kirtan groups,e.g., the "Crazy Karma Kirtan Band."

   Yoga itself has been the central facet of my adult life.  I still teach yoga for a living & draw great inspiration from the lives of Masters like Paramhansa Yogananda, Neem Karoli Baba & Ammachi (the "Hugging Saint"). 

   My favorite thing in the whole world is taking an extended period of time (day, weekend, or even week) to dive into all aspects of Yoga:  the postures, the breathwork, meditation, chanting, sacred song & dance, etc. 

  And nothing gives me greater satisfaction than helping others connect to the deepest part of their beings through the above practices ..... and always, always, the day ends with devotional music or chanting .....


   So, do check out our music & our gifts to you & help us get this music out to the growing number of people who are searching for greater understanding, peace & joy in their lives.  There is so much anxiety in our world today & Kirtan is a wonderful antidote to that! 

   Thanks for partnering with us in this sacred endeavor & may Great Karma fill all your days for your help & support !!!


(Note:  We originally raised $3500 via our website in our local area -- near Sacramento, CA. & now we feel this music should be offered to a wider audience so we are reaching out to the Global Family of Kirtan lovers. Your contribution will help our purpose which is stated in our logo:  "Music To Touch The Soul." )

(Note 2:  We will be tithing 10% of all funds received with 2 organizations that have been inspirational to us:  The Sierra Center for Spiritual Living in Grass Valley, CA & Polestar Gardens Yoga Community near Pahoa, HI.)   OM

story:
Short Summary


LINDA is ready to finish and release her debut albums, "Voice of the Children" and "Love Sessions".  I have 20 beautiful tracks to share with the world!

Linda Wallace needs your help in raising funds to get her debut album completed and in your hands, tour and perform these songs in your city. Her goal with the Album Voice of the Children is to help children who are affected by poverty and war and give them voice.  This project and your support and donations will also help to raise funds and awareness for children in need.  



What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking $60,000 for the following.  The funds will be used for:

  • Engineering
  • Studio Time
  • Editing
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Session Musicians
  • Manufacturing
  • Album Art
  • Cost of Band & Travel
  • Music Video
  • $5000 TO FREE THE CHILDREN CHARITY "BUILD A WELL"
  • $5000 TO EMMANUEL JAL'S "LOSE TO WIN" CHARITY


The Perks

Digital Download of the Albums

Signed Hard copy of the CDs

Cool Designed T-shirt for Voice of Children or Love Sessions

My New Music Video Download

SHOUT OUT!! Thank You-  Your Name in The Album Credits

Let's Chat!!! Talk to me via Skype :)

I'll Write You A Song

Join Me in the Studio

Let Me Show You Around T.O. & In the Studio

I'm Coming to See You and to Play For You and Your Friends



ALBUM: "VOICE OF THE CHILDREN" SONG: PARADISE

ALBUM: "LOVE SESSIONS" SONG: UNDONE





The Impact


LET ME TELL YOU ABOUT THIS AMAZING PROJECT

Let's build a well.  Once we meet our goal, $5000 will be donated to a community in KENYA, AFRICA.  Water for the community will help children in need.  Clean water is an essential need for all of us.  Free the Children's is great charity that is run by Marc and Craig Kielburger.




 




I am honored and blessed to have the support of Emmanuel Jal on this project.  He will sing on one of my songs on the Voice of the Children Album.  

Emmanuel Jal is a South Sudanese musician and former child soldier. He is a world recognized amazing hip-hop artist.  Emmamuel is also a humanitarian advocate for social justice and human rights.  

http://www.we-want-peace.com

Once we meet our goal $5000 will be donated to Emmanuel's "Lose to Win" that benfits 3 charites that Emmanuel supports: Gua Africa, My Start, and Africa Yoga Project.  Let's help Emmanuel spread his message of peace around the world and help those children in need though arts and education.

http://losetowin.net/about-lose-to-win



This Album will be professionally recorded by very talented musicians and recording engineers.  Oliver Pigott is a very talented musician and soulful singer and I am honoured to and blessed to have his support for this project.  He will be singing on one of the songs on my albums.

http://oliverpigott.com


I will be recording a music video to of one of the songs on my albums.  


Band and tour cost:  I would like to tour and perform for you in your city and bring a band with me. Help me spead the message for children in need that are effected by poverty and war.

Let's keep on giving.  After the albums are recorded the "Voice of the Children Album" will keep on giving.  $1.00 will be donated to "Free the Children" and $1.00 to Emmanuel Jal's Charities through "Lose to Win" for 3 years.




Other Ways You Can Help

Join my other social network and spread the word.


Facebook: www.facebook.com/linda.wallace.1029

Twitter: https://twitter.com/LindaWallace111

Myspace: https://myspace.com/linda.wallace

Youtube: http://www.youtube.com/user/Lindsmusic

My website: www.lindsmusic.com



THANK YOU EVERYONE FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

BIG HUGGS :)

Linda 

xo

Youtube: http://www.youtube.com/user/Lindsmusic

THANK YOU EVERYONE FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!
BIG HUGGS :)
Linda 
xo

story:
Philadelphia Composers' Ink was founded in summer 2013 to connect area composers with a performance space for their music. Once we left college for the big wide world, we discovered that it is darn difficult to get our music heard - the awesome big spaces are looking for awesome (already famous) composers. So we created a space for modern compositions of all genres to be heard - Philadelphia Composers' Ink. Philadelphia Composers' Ink hosts monthly composers salons where composers bring works in progress and get feedback from the audience. We've had three so far, and they've been a blast - plenty of great music, lots of ideas exchanged, and about three tons of food consumed afterwards.

So then we had this crazy idea: why don't we invite even more composers in by creating a collaborative piece of music connected by an intellectual theme? "The planets" quickly became our theme, and we invited composers across the Philadelphia area to submit a movement to the competition. The final collaborative piece, "Airs of Other Planets" has music by four competition winners, three founders, two guest artists - and it's all played a quartet of string players. But, to put this concert on, we need funds! Your money will be used to pay the string quartet, print programs, contribute to our performance space, pay for some advertising, and buy food for a reception. 

Philadelphia Composers' Ink promotes new artists, but it also promotes making new music accessible, interesting, fun, and something you want to come explore. We invite everyone to comment, and we value the insights that everyone from music novice to music afficionado give. Contributing helps us spread the musical word and keep doing projects like this that impact a wide range of Philadelphia composers and musicians.

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can't help!  Share our video on every social medium you can think of and help us spread the fundraising word! And, most importantly, come out and see the concert on December 8th! 7 pm at the First Baptist Church, 123 S. 17th St (intersection of Sansom and 17th), Philadelphia, PA.

Musical satisfaction guaranteed!


**Oh, and the music in the video? That was courtesy of the crazy haired dude (aka Beethoven) who started the movie montage. Symphony 7, last movement. Go listen, you'll love it!

story:
Project Summary

I have been involved in music for many years in many different ways. I have always been a songwriter and have recently been blessed with the opportunity to record a full album in a studio at Ball State University. This will be my first ever solo album of original music. I'm so excited to share it with you!

The funds will be used for the following expenses:

  • Printing physical copies of the album
  • Mastering the final mixes

Any funds raised over the goal will increase the production quality of the album through mixing, mastering and packaging.

The Impact

These songs have come from the last few years of my life. I have seen time and time again how music can have such a huge impact on people. I am excited to see where God can use this album to speak into the lives of the people that hear it.

The Perks

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute funds doesn't mean you can't help! Here are a couple of ways that you can support this project:

  • Share the campaign on social media (facebook, twitter, etc.)
  • Pray for the campaign and the people that will be impacted by the music

Thank you in advance for all of your support!

This will be my first ever solo album of original music. I'm so excited to share it with you!
The funds will be used for the following expenses:

Printing physical copies of the album
Mastering the final mixes

Any funds raised over the goal will increase the production quality of the album through mixing, mastering and packaging.The ImpactThese songs have come from the last few years of my life. I have seen time and time again how music can have such a huge impact on people. I am excited to see where God can use this album to speak into the lives of the people that hear it.The Perks


Other Ways You Can HelpJust because you can't contribute funds doesn't mean you can't help! Here are a couple of ways that you can support this project:

Share the campaign on social media (facebook, twitter, etc.)

Pray for the campaign and the people that will be impacted by the music



Thank you in advance for all of your support!

story:
Summary

I'm making the move to Europe for many reasons. Here are a few reasons why I believe Germany is the place to jumpstart my singing career. 

1. Germany has more opera houses per-capita than any other country, with operating budgets of over $10 million.

2. There are something called Festvertrags (Fest Contracts) which are year long contracts with opera houses that guarantee roles in the operas for that season. They include full-time pay, health insurance, sick pay, vacation pay, and pensions. In other words, a salary job for a singer (!). 

3. I can sing for government agents (artist agents, not the FBI), who are required to hear me, as well as private agents, to increase my chances of finding work. In the U.S. you are expected to have only one agency, there you are encouraged to have many.


What I Need 

I have my ticket, I have a place to stay, but Europe is an expensive place. I'm giving myself 81 days to audition and make connections (90 days is the max without a work visa). Here is an estimate of my expenses in U.S. Dollars, I've done the conversions.

FOOD: $50 a day = $4,050

TRAVEL BY TRAIN (for unlimited Eurail pass): $1,777

OUT OF CITY STAY (8 cities 2 days each): $640

5 - 6 COACHINGS: $500

= $6,967


(Indiegogo takes 4% if I make my goal and 9% if I don't... so I'm lowering the "goal" just a little with hopes to go over)

What You Get

See perks --------------------------------->


The Impact

The more money I have, the better chances I have of landing a job. 

If I can travel (and eat), I can sing for more people, get more opinions, and in the process have more people know my name and hopefully want to work with me. Agents and houses will not take the time to call me once I am back in the states so I need to stay there as long as possible.

This is my chance, I am of prime age, have finished my studies, and am not tied down to a job or family. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with anyone you think might be able to help. You can post to your Facebook page, Twitter, email, or verbally tell people (what?). Thanks for reading ;) 

Auf Wiedersehen!

story:
Our Story

The Brits Team is working with the award-winning UK charity Afghan Heroes to raise public awareness of who this charity is.The founder has adopted 'We Are The Brits' as their anthem, saying, "This is who we are and what we are doing"! This charity sent home comfort parcels to every front line UK service man and woman in Afghanistan for Armed Forces Day and we now want to get the song to as many soldiers on the front line as we can because it was written for them to let them know we care and they are never forgotten. To do this we need your help.

The Impact

The writers of 'We Are The Brits' Anton Lorien and John Simons are working with the founders to inspire people to get behind this charity so we can do more to help the servicemen and women on the front line. The writers could easily have given the song to a much larger military charity in the UK (not mentioning any names) who loved and wanted the song, and it would have been an instant 'hit' but they wanted to work with Afghan Heroes as they know that keeping the morale high of the boys on the front line is paramount to keeping them safe from harm.
 

It was founded by mothers whose sons died within the same 24 hours in what has been described as the blackest day in Helmand when 8 soldiers fell. The guys on the front line have direct email contact with the founder of the charity and whatever they need she does her utmost to provide to make their tour easier to bear. The charity also supports the families of the fallen and those who return from duty traumatised from what they have witnessed. To help the guys more the charity needs much more support, in the UK not many people know of Afghan Heroes despite being given an award by HRH Prince Harry at The Sun's (UK newspaper) Military Award event. HRH Prince William and HRH Prince Harry wear Afghan Heroes wristbands! By getting this out to the guys on the front line we hope to raise the public's awareness of the charity as we will gain major media coverage. :)

 

What We Need & What You Get

For every $5 donated a soldier will receive a CD of the song including the bonus dance track. If you give us your email we will email you an mp3 of We Are The Brits plus the exclusive Dance mix version which is not available anywhere else as well as the digital artwork. Please give generously, it's not just a song but a poignant and uplifting message for everyone (the video is very humorous too, after all we're Brits so that's a bit compulsory).

The founder of this charity is the most dedicated we've seen to any cause, her own son died and now she is every soldier's mum, working relentlessly day and night to get their message out. The Brits Team have given hundreds of hours free to help the charity, please help us do this for them.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you share the video on all your social media sites and email contacts we will be able to reach many more people and if you still want to do more please download the song from any good download store anywhere in the world including iTunes. All proceeds for downloads go directly to the charity. Help us help those who defend our freedom. Thank you very much.

story:
THE GIO LEVY PROJECT

Hi, I'm Gio Levy and I'm from Vancouver, Canada.
I've been writing songs for several years now and
I believe creating and sharing music is my purpose in life.

Two years ago, I released a series of songs that I spent a good chunk of my savings on. I had a sold out show, and it was one of the most amazing times of my life. There's a number of you who still have and listen to those songs, and I am extremely humbled.

I've learned a lot as an artist in the past couple years, and I'm finally ready to get back in the studio to show you what I've been up to.

I think you'll be surprised at how much I've grown as a writer, a performer, and as a person. It reflects all back into my music.

If we reach my goal of $5000, here's what I'll do:

✖ I'll record a 6-track EP in a professional studio.
✖ I'll record 1 music video.
✖ I'll host a show at a large venue in Vancouver.

So c'mon! Take my hand brothers & sisters!
Be a part of my dream.


» giolevy.com
» youtube.com/giolevymusic
» twitter.com/giolevy
» fb.com/giolevy

* Perks will be delivered individually upon project completion. (Project completion timeline TBA)
* Delivery charges included in donation amount. No additional fees will be charged.
* All donors will be notified of project completion and delivery timelines.
* Local and International perks are interchangeable depending upon preference. (So if you're Local, you can choose the International perks)
* Delivery timelines may vary. I will use the best mailing procedure possible.
* Donors receiving the VIP + Backstage pass will be notified of show logistics after the campaign.
* For any special requests or inquiries, please e-mail info@giolevy.com

story:
Who are we?

Fueled by the energy of a group of composers, performers, and music-lovers devoted to the limitless possibilities of new music, our concert series aims to present a wide array of inspiring concerts to the greater Boston musical community. We took shape in 2011, growing out of a desire to provide a forum for emerging local artists as well as for the discussions and connections that the experience of live performance fosters. We seek to enrich Boston’s music scene by presenting new local works and recent masterpieces.

We are diverse and flexible, we think outside the box, we welcome new friends, we explore and take risks, we love sounds that are strange, beautiful, eccentric, ear-twisting, lavish, and piquant!

 

What is new music?

“Use your ears like a man!” the pioneering American composer Charles Ives famously said. We believe that using your ears like a real man or woman is an active pursuit. Seek out new sounds, react, and share your thoughts with others. New music, rooted in the classical tradition, is a live process of creation and evolution: it’s being invented by today’s composers and interpreted by today’s performers.

Music-making is also a community activity. Music helps us understand ourselves and our changing world. It reaches its full potential when produced through collaboration and experienced in the moment. That’s why the composers and performers we feature work together to bring new works to life in an assortment of venues throughout the Boston area. We’re not restricted to the concert hall—we’ve performed in galleries, studios, and theaters. We’re always seeking out new audience members to share in this experience.

 

What are we planning?

This spring we’ve got our most ambitious season yet, with six truly unique offerings. Our two centerpiece concerts feature the music of Boston composers who deserve to be heard more frequently, performed by the Equilibrium Ensemble and special guests. Ensemble players will be featured in a program of chamber works by Chaya Czernowin, Marti Epstein, and Yu-Hui Chang that celebrate our ideals of community-based collaboration. The fabulous soprano Aliana de la Guardia will be the featured guest in an ensemble performance of works by Masaki Hasebe and Keeril Makan.

We also host up-and-coming groups devoted to expanding the horizons of sound in every direction. We’re welcoming our friends the innovative Iktus Percussion Quartet from NYC. And the local Modern Brass quintet will explore unknown corners of a genre usually known for fanfares and marches.

Two funky Composer on stage concerts will explore the nebulous path from inspiration to execution in casual, intimate settings. The first features guitarist and composer Clifton Ingram in semi-structured improvisations with classical/jazz bassist Max Judelson, and the second presents popular locals Marti Epstein, John McDonald, and Mischa Salkind-Pearl on the piano.

Take a look at our current season listing for more details.

 

What have we done so far?

Though we're only in our second year, we're proud of what we've accomplished so far in our young life! In 2012 we presented 8 concerts, gave life to 30 world premieres, and hosted 3 guest ensembles in 6 off-the-beaten-path venues. Our first season culminated in the first installment of the Hyman Bloom Project last May, two gallery shows featuring new chamber works composed in honor of the first posthumous solo exhibition of the abstract expressionist painter Hyman Bloom, performed alongside the paintings that inspired them.

We've had the pleasure of hosting the lovely Balletik Duo at Cambridge's Gallery 263, a set of wonderful soloists in a salon at SONiVOX studios in Somerville, the wildly creative duo Transient Canvas twice at the Davis Square Theatre, and percussionist Masako Kunimoto and friends at Inman Square's iconic Lilypad. We want to continue to bring new music to new corners of Boston, Cambridge, Somerville, and Brookline in our quest for concert experiences that are unusual, meaningful, and thought-provoking.

 

Why do we need help?

Getting a concert series off the ground is a huge undertaking—in organizational, philosophical, and financial ways. Because we're a presenting organization, we have to cover all of our production and operating costs ourselves--we're not sponsored or in residence at any institution. We’ve put countless hours of thought and effort into planning. But the bottom line is: to grow we need to do concerts! And concerts come with many expenses, chiefly the following:

  • Venue rental can range from $150 to $1200 per event, depending on the size and location of the space. A rental must often also include time for set-up, sound check, and packing up, talking, and unwinding after the concert.
  • Performers’ fees: we are incredibly lucky to work with players who are equally as generous as they are talented. Our players are devoted to performing new music, and we’re working towards compensating them a decent amount for the hours they contribute to learning, rehearsing, and performing our music. Just think: most performers have spent a good part of their lives learning their instruments' standared repertoires, but learning a world premiere requires starting at square one! We'll have over 30 talented young professional musicians performing with us this spring, and we want to help them be able to do what they do so well.
  • We must purchase or rent scores and parts for the published works we program; each piece can cost anywhere from $30 to $800.
  • Production costs can include piano tuning, transport of large instruments, and printing programs, among other tasks.
  • Publicity costs include maintaining our website and online presence, printing physical fliers, business cards, and other items.

And one of the most important reasons we need your help: we are dedicated to keeping our ticket prices low or free, so that no one is prevented from attending due to cost. Many of our patrons show their support in donations at the door, but we don't take in nearly enough to cover our costs.

 

Many ways to show your support!

If you believe that music is a living, evolving art, there are many ways to contribute! Even a small donation will help move our vision forward. If you're able to give a little more, we're pleased to offer a hodgepodge of thank-you perks!

But most importantly, if you're interested in or curious about what we do, please join us for a concert! Invite others! Or drop us a line with your musings, rants, or raves.

Check out our website here. Or write to equilibriumconcertseries@gmail.com.

story:
Hello Friends, Family, and Strangers!

 
Tape Deck Mountain is almost done with our 2nd full length record titled Sway! Unfortunately I (Travis) could use some extra cash to help put the finishing touches on this Masterpiece.  The hard part is over, all the songs are recorded and done!  We just need some help in getting the album released in proper fashion!  We are looking to raise 4000 to get the album produced in a physical format and some other loose ends (Mastering, Promotion, Etc.)
 

If we raised the full amount we will be print the album on Vinyl, CD, & Cassette! Along with giving it a proper mastering job and promotion campaign, bringing it to the masses!

At the very least we will be printing the album on CD! If you donate you will have access to a physical copy!
 

Here are some links to a couple tracks on the Album!

https://soundcloud.com/tapedeckmountain/mystics

Album background

Our 2nd LP is 11 songs proper and our strongest work to date!  Most of the album was written and rehearsed during my year long stint in Austin, TX. During that year I rehearsed and performed with John Momberg (whom played some amazing drums! and helped arrange the songs!) and Dan Alvarez (whom layed down some solid bass!).  The drums and bass were tracked to 2" tape by Matt Oliver at Big Orange Studios in Austin and sound beautiful! We bounced down what we had to a hard drive and took it back to my hometown in San Diego, CA to finish things up with Brandon Jenson of American Sound Studios.  I have since begun living in Queens, NY and working at the local coffee shop. I'm going to stop here and not give you typical starving artist story (we've all heard it!). But rest assured I live a very frugal lifestyle and the money raised from IndieGoGo will not be taken lightly!

 

Tape Deck Mountain Story

For those of you new to Tape Deck Mountain let me give a short timeline. I (Travis Trevisan) started the band in 2009 as vehicle for songs I write with the aide of a revolving cast of musicians helping out and contributing. Since then the band has released 1 Full Length Album & 3 EPs.  We have toured the West Coast numerous times and circled the US and pockets of Canada last summer for 35 days. Hitting up music festivals such as SXSW, NXNE, & CMJ over the years. Since our first full length we have worked with Lefse Records and garnered press from heavy weights such as Pitchfork Media, Filter Magazine, Vice, Stereogum, and Fader among others.  
 

Needless to say this next record could be the triumph of Tape Deck Mountain's career, if done right!  

 
Regardless I'm very proud of it artistically and believe it is the bands best and most focused work to date! I am very excited to share it with many amazing people in this world!
 

Please consider supporting Tape Deck Mountain and Myself on this artistic journey!

Sincerly, Travis & TDM

story:
Hello,

My name is Nathan Reed, I am a up and coming singer/songwriter in Seattle!

Music has been something I have been passionate about my whole life, whether it be. Playing music or just listening, It has always been a important part of my life! Last year I decided that music was what I wanted to do for the rest of my life, so I set out feeling driven and excited about what this path would bring. So here I am, ready to record my first EP of all my own music written in the last year. 

2,000 dollars is my goal, I have a studio picked out already, I have spoken with the owner was given a estimated price of 1,600 dollars for recording, mixing, and mastering. That leaves 400 for physical cd's and cases!

I've got some sweet perks in mind, such as physical copy's of the cd before it's released for donations of 20 dollars and above and a secret unplugged house show for donation of 100 and over!

If you just don't have the money to donate, don't worry because there are more ways to help, like using indiegogo's share tools to promote my campaign!

Cheers,

Nathan

story:
Girls Rock Jacksonville exists to cultivate self-empowerment and positive identity development in female-identified youth through music experimentation, DIY media and peer collaboration. Going into their third year, the organizers of Girls Rock Jacksonville have been working in the Florida heat preparing for their inaugural summer camp taking place at Waverly Academy from July 28 through August 1. And guess what? Camp this year is going to include around 60 campers! How exciting!

In order to sufficiently provide to these young rockers, Girls Rock Jacksonville is in need of a nicely stocked arsenal of gear. With such a great amount of campers, it means they'll need roughly 10 of each instrument—guitar, bass, drums, keyboard and microphone—to accommodate each camper. The gear utilized at camp and during the showcase has been loaned or donated through our community’s in-kind support since the organization’s start in Summer 2012. As one can imagine, coordinating and maintaining 60+ borrowed instruments and miscellaneous gear before, throughout and after the week of camp is intensive. Girls Rock believes that an inventory featuring 2-3 of each instrument would help to alleviate those stresses and allow for that energy to be placed in other important aspects of camp.

Girls Rock Jacksonville needs $5,000 to amp up their instrument arsenal, secure extra funds for camper scholarships so that all campers can attend, and cover other general camp costs. 

This is where you can help!


By supporting this effort, you'll receive exciting and one-of-a-kind perks from Girls Rock Jacksonville:

$10 // DIGITAL HIGH FIVES // A heartfelt THANK YOU & a shout-out on GRJ's website.

$30 // MAD GRJ LOVE! // UV safe vinyl GRJ sticker, a button, zine and mixed CD made by GRJ campers and volunteers + website shout-out

$35 // G’DAY GRJ! EARLIEST BIRD SPECIAL // GRJ mug, UV safe vinyl GRJ sticker, and button + website shout-out (limited to 10)

$40 // EARLY BIRDY SUPPORTER // Your name/company on a LIMITED ED. T-SHIRT + t-shirt + website shout-out! (limited to 25 backers)

$50 // BAND AID SUPPORTER // Your name/company in MEDIUM-ish size print on a LIMITED ED. T-SHIRT + t-shirt + shout-out on our website and showcase program! + GRJ “Kitten Tip” postcard

$100 // SUPER RAD SUPPORTER // Your name/company in SUPER-size print on a LIMITED ED. T-SHIRT + t-shirt + shoutout on our website and showcase program! + GRJ “Kitten Tip” postcard

$250 // GRJ SPONSOR & MEGA SUPPORTER // Your name/company in MEGA-size print on a LIMITED ED. T-SHIRT + t-shirt + shoutout on our website and showcase program! + GRJ “Kitten Tip” postcard [***this donation sponsors one camper during the week of GRCJ 2014***]


Please share this with your friends and family via social media to get the word out (you can use those IndieGoGo share tools!). Thank you for showing your support by pledging to this campaign! 

With love and \m/,
Girls Rock Jacksonville

More for information or to contact:
girlsrockjacksonville.org
girlsrockjacksonville@gmail.com
