story:
What is Groovetrail?

Groovetrail is a non-profit* organization designed to use the myriad of talented musicians who live in the Flathead Valley for concerts and workshops at schools, community centers, hospitals, and other institutions that would greatly benefit from their abilities and presence. Groovetrail will also draw upon talent from outside the Flathead Valley and invite artists to participate in outreach events and perform concerts that benefit the community.

Founder and educator Erica von Kleist has worked as a consultant and director at several outreach-based institutions including Jazz at Lincoln Center in New York. After moving to Whitefish last year, Erica saw that many of the musicians here want nothing more than to share their gifts with the community, especially with those who need it most. Groovetrail will provide:

  • Private lesson sponsorships for needy students
  • Outreach concert series at local hospitals, veteran's homes, schools, retirement communities, and shelters
  • Musical instruments for deserving and low-income students and musicians
  • Opportunities for special guest artists visiting the Flathead Valley to get involved in community outreach activities


Our Goal

Groovetrail will be officially launching into the community on March 23rd at a concert/workshop event featuring four-time GRAMMY Nominee Gerald Clayton on piano, and Erica von Kleist on flute. The performance will take place at the Performing Arts Center in Whitefish, MT at 6:00.

Erica and Gerald will also be recording four tracks for Erica's upcoming album. 20% of the proceeds of this album will go directly to Groovetrail's cause.

The concert on March 23rd will feature some local jazz students, and will demonstrate the impact that musical interaction can have on members of the community. Groovetrail is currently looking to raise $5000 to help with our startup costs, and to jumpstart some of our initiatives. If we meet this goal:

  • Groovetrail will be able to fund its first two Private Lesson Sponsorships to needy students (worth $500 each)
  • Groovetrail will be able to take care of some in-house costs (insurance, office supplies, start-up costs)
  • We will initiate our first outreach concerts
  • We will have a successful launch concert on March 23rd!


Other Ways You Can Help

Groovetrail is looking for volunteers to help with various aspects of its initiatives, from spreading the word about its services, to donating time to help manage outreach concerts, or light office help. If you'd like to volunteer your time or abilities, please contact us at contact@groovetrail.org


*PLEASE NOTE: Groovetrail has registered as a non-profit public charity with the State of Montana and has requested 501(c)3 status from the IRS. All donations will be tax-deductible pending the IRS approval of the application.

story:
About Our Band

Hailing from the Shenandoah Valley, our band The Travelin’ Hillbillies is comprised of four tightknit musicians and have developed a style that is uniquely our own.  Our soulful tunes that include hints of bluegrass, rock and roll, folk, blues, and country differentiate us from any other band on the scene.  We—Garst brothers Ryan, Shay, and Brandon along with vocal powerhouse and long-time friend Daniel Barnett—have been working endlessly to share music that is close to our hearts.  In just 2 short years, we have played over 200 shows as The Travelin’ Hillbillies while holding full-time jobs to fulfill our dreams of becoming one of the biggest bands to emerge on the southern rock scene from Virginia.

Our Campaign

We’ve decided that it’s time to get real!  Thanks to Chris Jackson and Chris Perez of Blue Sprocket Media, recording for our new studio EP is underway.  Touch and Go represents our growth into a true southern rock band.  All we need now is support from our fans to help this album make history.  By contributing to our campaign, you will be helping our band make our dreams come true by helping us create the opportunity always wish we had.

We plan on releasing Touch and Go by the end of July.  If we exceed our campaign goals, however, we would like to keep recording to finish the EP as an entire album.  Choosing only a few of our new songs has been intense, and we would love to release even more of our new material.

For this EP, we still have some expenses to cover.  Studio expenses remaining with Blue Sprocket Media are $2,400.  Video production and promotion costs with Lurid Pictures are $300.  Updating our website with Polytone Design will be about $300 as well.

Even if we don’t reach our goal, we will put every penny that we have received toward all the expenses we’ve encountered.  If we raise more, there are plenty of things we still need for the band:

  • PA System
  • More studio time
  • A band vehicle
  • Fuel
  • Guitar picks and strings
  • Promotional material
  • Everything any band ever needs

Our special perks are guaranteed to satisfy fans of our music, merchandise, and unique band members.  Simply peruse the list to get a better feel of what we want to give our loyal fans.  You could be the ONLY ONE that gets some of our gear!

By contributing to our campaign, you’ll be helping our dream of releasing a studio album even closer.  Help prove to the music industry that a homegrown band can be successful without a record label, tens of thousands of dollars, or hired songwriters.  We want YOUR help to spearhead the movement of keeping originality in the art in music.

Our band has come so far without ever having asked for money, so we know that we can accomplish so much more with just a little help from our fans.

Aside from the Campaign

Even if you can’t contribute, tell your friends to simply like us on Facebook and check out our Youtube channel.   We want people to know what we’re up to and for our fans to come see us at shows.  We also encourage you to use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about our campaign.

Finally, we want to thank you for viewing this page.  We are forever grateful for all the support all our incredible fans have given us.


Rock On,

Daniel, Ryan, Shay, and Brandon

story:
MEGA-UPDATE        6/5/14

We hit our initial goal in 3 days thanks to some truly amazing people.  

However, we set the bar WAY too low for a vinyl pressing.  To get records made we need another 1,000 and we're willing to do just about anything we can.  Use your imagination. Message us.  Please pre-order our new album. share it with your friends. Or just donate 5 bucks. We are SO thankful now we gotta dance. 



THE TAPE THAT KILLED: Ten Minute Turns

  • Ten Minute Turns falls somewhere between a rock band and a best friends' recording party.  Band members hail mostly from Brooklyn NY and Western Massachusetts. 
  • Instead of 100% home recording our new album, we'd like to track the band all together for 3 epic weekend studio sessions.
  • This will be the first time the entire band has hit the studio at the same time and it's only possible if we pre-sell the album now. 
  •  Yes the Internet, we need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

  • TMT needs some $$ for recording, mixing, mastering, gas money and snacks.  
  • 100% of pre-sales will go to our dear friends / production team. Strings arrangements by Musician Services and live recording at a secret studio in Greenpoint.  Mixing by Jon Altschuler and Mastering by West West Side, IF we can afford it. 
  • We've got bonus features!  From hand drawn art pieces to years worth of Top Secret Songs.  Everything must go to make room for the newness.  
  • If we make enough money, we'll have delicious scratchy vinyl made.  This will make our families very happy. 

New Remixes from Sad Animals

         >>> Listen Here Meow <<<

 

^ Stuffy the Sad Animal, hand-made by the band. 

We Love You Guys

  • The band has been friends for nearly two decades. We want to celebrate that insanity by making a really special record.
  • Some of the shows we've played defy description: Dreamaway Halloweens, The Burlington Bunny Suit Solstice, Party Barn Monsterjam, and Lit Lounge Animator Throw Downs. 
  • The friends and fans we've made have kept it super real over the years,     so selling 100 or so records in advance should be a breeze, right? 

Ways You Can Help

  • Click something! Please pre-order the record. 
  • Spread the word.  Wear out that share button.  Sharing is caring. 
  • Help us book some awesome release shows for the fall in                  Brooklyn and the Berkshires.  Let us know where to play!

The Ten Minute Turns Dream Team

  • Alan Foreman - Guitar / Words
  • Roger Paul Mason - Guitar / Noises / Words
  • Two Tree - Bass / Vox
  • Jayzinho Schultheis - Drums
  • Jason Miranda (Mercury Rev) - More Drums
  • Ian Edward Tucksmith - Percussion
  • Jacquee Novak - Accordion / Synth 
  • Chris Williams / Musician Services - Viola
  • Ansel Cohen - Cello
  • Kotono Sato (Gorillaz) - Violin
  • Adam Lekach - Horns
  • Casperelectronics.com - Hand Made Synths 
  • Peter P-Dog Forcucci - Trash Percussion
  • Abby Hollander - Vox
  • Anastasia Falcon - Vox 
  • Mai - Vox
  • Zack Bruce - Mandolin
  • Chroma Pixel NYC - Music Video
  • Peter P-Dog Forcucci - Trash Percussion


 Find Out More

  • Find out more about TMT here  and follow the action  http://tenminuteturns.tumblr.com/
  • Dont forget the olde facebook either. 
  • Listen to some TMT on Bandcamp.

THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU

<<<UPDATE>>> anyone who shares this link will get a collaborative drawing from Alan and Roger, even if we have to send them to Brazil, Europe, Russia.  Please share.

story:
Hi! We're 3union. Thanks for checking out our campaign!

We're a band of brothers (Brandon, Shaun, and Ryan Boyd). It's hard to believe we've been a band for 5 years now and it's been almost 3 years since we made our last recording!

We need you to help us create our GREATEST ALBUM YET! It's time to give you guys NEW MUSIC. Just us and the fans working TOGETHER to make more music that inspires and encourages people.

This has already been an amazing year for us and 2015 promises to have even more exciting opportunities and we want you to be a part of it! So, let's get into the studio and make some new music!

3union


What We Need & What You Get


In order to make a top notch recording, it costs a lot of money. And, because we want to maintain your trust, we have listed the expenses involved in making a quality album. You'll notice that the price is significantly more than the amount we're trying to raise, but if we go over our goal, we can use the money to help offset the extra costs, and we may even be able to add some more songs!

The unique thing about this campaign is that it is largely designed to create an exciting experience to get our album to you. It gives sweet deals to you, our dedicated fans, and in-turn helps us continue to create music that matters to you. 

So poke around our campaign and check out all of the amazing perks we've lined up for you. Every perk includes an early release digital copy of our recording, plus a digital copy of our new single "Unstoppable" that we recorded with Mark Lee Townsend (Relient K's producer) upon receiving payment. Don't forget to grab a pre-order of the album while you're at it.

In exchange for your contributions, here are some of the some cool perks:

  • Signed copy of the album + digital download
  • Limited edition t-shirt
  • Skype session
  • Handwritten lyrics
  • Instagram takeover
  • and more...
Keep checking back here for updates and new perks!!

Here's the pic for the new poster, it will have the 3union logo on it when it's done!



This is a big step for us as a band

By joining us in this adventure, you yourself are taking charge and helping us make great music. For the past 2 years we've been touring around the country in support of our last release "Our Mom Thinks We're Good" which we are still incredibly proud of. But it's time for us to make a new statement. We've grown and matured, and so has our sound. We're ready for you to hear the best material that we've ever written, and this is your chance to tell us you're ready to listen. 

Above all, our desire is that our music will encourage and inspire our fans to know they are loved and appreciated and that our music can make a difference in someone's life!

Here's to making our best album yet!


Other Ways You Can Help

More than half the battle is getting the word out to those who can contribute. As well as just helping us create a buzz about who we are and what we do!

Make sure to check out the Indiegogo share tools to help you post on social media!

You can connect on social media with us at:

https://www.facebook.com/3union 

https://www.threeunion.com 

https://soundcloud.com/3union

https://www.youtube.com/user/3unionband

https://twitter.com/3union

http://instagram.com/3union

Thanks for all your love and support! We're excited to take this next step alongside you.



Budget

Here's a projected budget we've prepared to give you an idea as to how we've planned to allocate the funds.

Recording Budget
  • Expenses
Studio Time/Producer Fee                           $14,500.00
Meals ($15 per person/day)                               $675.00
Transportation to Nashville (4 trips)               $1200.00
Housing (10 nights @ $65 a night)                     $650.00
  • After Recording
Mastering Fees                                                      $480.00
Photography for Album/Poster                         $500.00
Album artwork                                                       $500.00
Hard drive to store music                                     $175.00
  • Grand Total Cost                                     $16,180.00
Fundraising total                                              $10,000.00
Indiegogo fees (4%)                                            -$400.00
Credit card fees (3%)                                         -$300.00
Total goal  minus fees                                       $9,300.00
Cost for Perks (20%)                                        -$1,860.00
Funds left for recording                                     $7,440.00

Needless to say, we need more than $10,000 to cover our costs.                                   The real amount is closer to $20,000. If we don't reach $10,000, the                           Indiegogo fee increases to 9%. So, let's start by reaching $10,000                               and then see if we can make it to the $20,000 mark!!! If we get beyond                       that, we'll add more songs!
story_txt:
Hi! We're 3union. Thanks for checking out our campaign!
We're a band of brothers (Brandon, Shaun, and Ryan Boyd). It's hard to believe we've been a band for 5 years now and it's been almost 3 years since we made our last recording!
We need you to help us create our GREATEST ALBUM YET! It's time to give you guys NEW MUSIC. Just us and the fans working TOGETHER to make more music that inspires and encourages people.
This has already been an amazing year for us and 2015 promises to have even more exciting opportunities and we want you to be a part of it! So, let's get into the studio and make some new music!
3union


What We Need & What You Get

In order to make a top notch recording, it costs a lot of money. And, because we want to maintain your trust, we have listed the expenses involved in making a quality album. You'll notice that the price is significantly more than the amount we're trying to raise, but if we go over our goal, we can use the money to help offset the extra costs, and we may even be able to add some more songs!
The unique thing about this campaign is that it is largely designed to create an exciting experience to get our album to you. It gives sweet deals to you, our dedicated fans, and in-turn helps us continue to create music that matters to you. 
So poke around our campaign and check out all of the amazing perks we've lined up for you. Every perk includes an early release digital copy of our recording, plus a digital copy of our new single "Unstoppable" that we recorded with Mark Lee Townsend (Relient K's producer) upon receiving payment. Don't forget to grab a pre-order of the album while you're at it.
In exchange for your contributions, here are some of the some cool perks:


Signed copy of the album + digital download
Limited edition t-shirt
Skype session
Handwritten lyrics
Instagram takeover
and more...

Keep checking back here for updates and new perks!!


Here's the pic for the new poster, it will have the 3union logo on it when it's done!





This is a big step for us as a band


By joining us in this adventure, you yourself are taking charge and helping us make great music. For the past 2 years we've been touring around the country in support of our last release "Our Mom Thinks We're Good" which we are still incredibly proud of. But it's time for us to make a new statement. We've grown and matured, and so has our sound. We're ready for you to hear the best material that we've ever written, and this is your chance to tell us you're ready to listen. 
Above all, our desire is that our music will encourage and inspire our fans to know they are loved and appreciated and that our music can make a difference in someone's life!
Here's to making our best album yet!

Other Ways You Can Help

More than half the battle is getting the word out to those who can contribute. As well as just helping us create a buzz about who we are and what we do!
Make sure to check out the Indiegogo share tools to help you post on social media!
You can connect on social media with us at:
https://www.facebook.com/3union 
https://www.threeunion.com 
https://soundcloud.com/3union
https://www.youtube.com/user/3unionband
https://twitter.com/3union
http://instagram.com/3union
Thanks for all your love and support! We're excited to take this next step alongside you.



Budget
Here's a projected budget we've prepared to give you an idea as to how we've planned to allocate the funds.
Recording Budget

Expenses
Studio Time/Producer Fee                           $14,500.00
Meals ($15 per person/day)                               $675.00
Transportation to Nashville (4 trips)               $1200.00
Housing (10 nights @ $65 a night)                     $650.00

After Recording
Mastering Fees                                                      $480.00
Photography for Album/Poster                         $500.00
Album artwork                                                       $500.00
Hard drive to store music                                     $175.00


Grand Total Cost                                     $16,180.00
Fundraising total                                              $10,000.00

Indiegogo fees (4%)                                            -$400.00
Credit card fees (3%)                                         -$300.00
Total goal  minus fees                                       $9,300.00
Cost for Perks (20%)                                        -$1,860.00
Funds left for recording                                     $7,440.00


Needless to say, we need more than $10,000 to cover our costs.                                   The real amount is closer to $20,000. If we don't reach $10,000, the                           Indiegogo fee increases to 9%. So, let's start by reaching $10,000                               and then see if we can make it to the $20,000 mark!!! If we get beyond                       that, we'll add more songs!

story:
We are about to begin recording two songs at The Blasting Room in Fort Collins that represent our changes in style, sound, and ideas since becoming One Flew West.

Our hope is to release an A-B single, which includes two brand new songs, both of which we are incredibly proud of and excited to share with our fans. However, to make this product a reality, we are asking for the support of our fans, families, and friends. Without you, we never would have made it this far, and we're asking you to help us make it a little further.

Under the guidance of our new producer, Andy Rok Guerrero, we have been given the opportunity to make something really incredible, and we can't wait to share it with you guys. For those of you who aren't familiar with Andy Rok, he has produced Denver bands such as the Flobots and Air Dubai. He is also one of the founding members of the Flobots and Bop Skizzum.

We have truly sunk all of our time and effort into making these songs the best we can. We hope you enjoy listening to these tracks as much as we enjoyed putting them together. We welcome all new fans to the group, and we want to thank any and all fans that have been with us since the beginning.

Check our Facebook page for updates on how the recording process is going!

Details on the IndieGoGo Exclusive show will come later! The show will be in appreciation of our fans, free for all who want to come out! We know that you guys are the only reason we get to do what we do, and we thank you for that!

And remember, anything helps!

story:
A Wee Bit of Our Story

Hi! I'm Ann Niemann, the owner and Editor in Chief of The Desert Shamrock, which is celebrating 25 years. I have an MBA in Int'l. Management from Thunderbird (ranked #1 in the USA in its category). A long-time feature writer for the paper, I became the owner and started publishing January 2014. I am passionate in sharing Celtic culture, especially the music! 

We're hunting for the one million of Celtic descent in Arizona.  You may have an ancestor (you've heard the stories) who gives you that extra zest in life by being a little, or a lot, Irish, Scottish, Scotch-Irish, Welsh, some other groups that qualify, or any combination of the above.

The Desert Shamrock has BIG plans this next twelve months to sponsor events and to support nonprofits like the Irish Cultural Center and McClelland Irish Library (ICC) in Phoenix. [Photo: Bob Rink Photography]

The more successful the campaign, the more philanthropic we can be, going national and international.

Hey, we could even help restore castles! As the fundraiser moves along, we'll provide timely updates with what we can and will do! You can say...you were a part of that.

What We Need & What You Get

We've set a goal of $15,000 with the desire to blow right past it!  The funds will help ensure the legacy of this Celtic communication mainstay with articles and features of interest to a wide range of demographics and help us reach an even wider circulation. There are fascinating profiles, book and music reviews, history, art, culture, cooking, travel, news, sports, sister/twinned cities exchanges, photo gallery each issue, heritage contests, calendar of events, directories, and MORE of interest to everyone! 

We've pledged a minimum of 10% to the Irish Cultural Center, which serves all of the Celtic groups and general public. Say, isn't everyone Irish for St. Patrick's Day?

We're counting on YOU in more ways than one...in a million!

 Of Celtic ancestry. Born a full-blooded Celt. Friend of a Celt. Wanna be a Celt. 

Live in Arizona. Used to live in Arizona. Wanna live in Arizona.

 You get the picture. Everyone welcome!

Besides a very, very sincere thank you for helping out The Desert Shamrock, you can get some really cool stuff.

Really, Really Cool Stuff

Receive a print subscription conveniently mailed to your home or business

     

...with luggage tags for your next BIG trip. Hoping it's to Edinburgh Castle in Scotland; Caernarfon, an ancient royal city in Wales; the spectacular Cliffs of Moher on the western coast of Ireland; 

     or the Titanic Visitor Centre in Belfast, N. Ireland!

Choose among select Newbridge Silverware jewelry that is designed and crafted in Ireland. They are unique in the States and create a signature piece.

Or, select the Newbridge Romance of Ireland Shamrock Letter Opener.

         

You can have your name in print or experience the VIP St. Patrick's Day Parade Package for you and your entire immediate family (or include up to three friends).

Or get it all! It's up to you.

    The Impact

    Where would civilization be without Belfast-born C.S. Lewis and his Narnia Trilogy; Oscar Wilde's comedy, The Importance of being Earnest; the poetry of Robert Burns; the grace of Scottish Highlands' dancing; or the worldwide phenomenon of Riverdance?

     Doesn't that get your toes tapping?

    Your ancestry is a part of all this. Be counted! Be a part of the craic (Irish "crack" means "fun") and let's see how many of us there are. 

    Make your contribution and then send me your photo (individual or group) and I'll try to get as many posted on our website as possible. Be creative; you might be in an awesome place and/or wearing a kilt!

    The more successful the campaign, the more we can do.

    With additional sums, we'll post the progress and be able to do a whole lot of good! With your generosity, we'd like to sponsor heritage contests, faires and festivals, Scottish Highland games, and concerts. The Desert Shamrock would like to be visible as a partner in pitching in together to restore or even create key historical structures in Ireland or Scotland!

    I've served for years on several nonprofit Boards of Directors and understand the value of every dollar. Each $1 truly does make a difference. There's no risk here in that each contribution is appreciated, whatever the total raised.

                                   

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some folks just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.

    • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Banging a bodhrain (Irish drum) and charging with a caber (a roughly trimmed tree trunk used in the Scottish Highland sport of tossing the caber) to get some attention are very acceptable.
    • A reminder to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    And that's all there is to it. The count is on!

story:
Our Story

For those of you who may not know, we're End of an Era (www.endofanera.org ).  We're an alternative rock band from NJ and we've played a show or two in our day.  This campaign is a combination of two things: a fundraiser for the band and an album pre-sale!  Our new, full length album (entitled "End of an Era") will be released with a huge party on Feb. 26th.  Here is your opportunity to reserve a copy of the album, reserve your tickets (which are EXTREMELY limited) for the release party, and a whole bunch of other fun perks!  

What We Need & What You Get

Being in a band is the most expensive business you can be in with absolutely no return.  Believe it or not, no member of End of an Era has ever seen a dime of any money that we've made.  Recording, pressing cd's, printing merch, touring, promo materials, instruments, alcoholism....it all costs incredible amounts of money.  We're looking to go global...and go global on our own terms.  Sadly, that isn't cheap.  However, we're not looking for handouts either.  We've meticulously put together these packages so that they're a fundraiser AND the perks are worthwhile to you!   

Other Ways You Can Help

There's always so many ways to help that don't involve any money at all!  Show us to your friends, let them raid your iTunes for our music, post stuff up online, pass out flyers...anything!  The more we can get the name out there, the more opportunities there are!

story:
Our Story

We are D.F.T., A five piece Indie Rock/Folk, Irish band based in cork. We need your help to record an album. We have been together since late 2010, and have played live in many cork venues, as well as in belfast. We have appeared on "Balcony T.V." and "Red Fm". We have been planning to record an album for months, but a lack of money has stopped our efforts. We have a few studios in mind in which to record our album, and we will make our pick when we see how successful the campaign is. 


The Impact

With the success of this campaign, we would have enough funds to go into the studio and make an album. With your help, we can record, promote and advertise the album. 

What We Need & What You Get

Basically, we need around 1000 to record the album. That 1000 breaks down into: Paying the studio, for hostels (Don't worry, they're cheap) to sleep in when we are recoding this album, for advertising the album, and finally for making the artwork, cover, and case, and covering the publishing costs. We will also be funding this campaign ourselves, but we can't afford the entire cost of the venture, and we need your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to remind them about the share tools!)

Spread the word about this campaign, tell your friends, leave posts on facebook, link our videos to your friends. The more people who hear about us, the more chance of this album being made. Help us get our name out there

story:
Our Story

Im Rachel Chetti and 21 years old. I been singing for as long as I can remember and its only taken me 21 years to realize that's what I want to do! My goal is to raise money so I can try out for the upcoming season of The Voice(NBC),So, Im starting my journey next month and heading to Los Angelos for the auditions which will be held August 30-31.


The Impact


Music has been my life for as long I can remember, and I feel like I have this amazing opportunity to go after my dream.This is a once in a lifetime opportunity and you never know what can happen. If I dont make it, Im still going to keep trying. I'll probably take some music classes and keep looking for opportunities to get out there.


What We Need & What You Get



I was debating between either driving up there or flying. After doing some calculations, I realized it is cheaper to drive up there. So on August 27th Ill be driving from here(Oregon) to California. But it is going expensive and is probably going to be anywhere in between 500-600$.That is just a rough estimate. At the moment I am working at Starbucks but that is not sufficient enough.If you feel lead to support me financially I would greatly appreciate it.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant help financially, your prayers would be great appreciated! :)

story:
I am an opera singer - a bass - at the University of Maryland.

I have been invited to sing the role of Leporello in Don Giovanni in Orvieto, Italy. This program costs $3,200 plus airfare and living expenses for 4 weeks in Italy. Visit the program website. 

I have also been invited to sing the role of Seneca in Claudio Monteverdi's masterpiece, L'inoronazione di Poppea at the festival in Novafeltria, Italy- La Musica Lirica. This role is a once in a lifetime opportunity. As an artist, I am compelled to perform music that not only packs the house, but also inspires. Monteverdi's masterpiece was among the first operas ever written. The opportunity to perform such an historic work of art is the dream of any serious artist. Also at La Musica Lirica, I will be performing three roles in Puccini's La Behéme: Colline, Benoit and Alcindoro. Visit the program website. 

Please help me in this effort to raise money for my education. As you can see from both of these programs that I will need close to $10,000 USD to successfully complete these programs. 

Visit my website for more information about me and my current resume.

story:
My Story

I am thrilled to have been invited to perform at Canadian Music Week in Toronto in just a few weeks and then to be returning to the West Coast for a 10 stop tour! (my very first).  

 

Having been featured at the Vancouver jazz fest and some other pretty cool things like radio play across Canada and being put on a Women in Jazz compilation CD, I'm pretty stoked to bring my career to the next level.  This is done through touring and bringing the music to people outside of my own city.  Touring comes with lots of costs and I'm hoping to raise some funds to help me break even.  I'm not looking to make money or even to pay myself while on tour!  This is just to help cover some of the costs of the tour.


The Impact

If I reach my goal, you would be helping me realize a cross Canadian tour.  The funding I was hoping for did not come through, hence the creation of this initiative.  You would be helping me so much towards creating a viable tour where I would have to incur less out of pocket expenses.  You would also be helping me fulfill my dreams - (do you feel warm and fuzzy inside?)

 

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $2000 through this campaign.  $2000 will be used to cover transportations costs including flights, van rental and GAS!  Any funds raised beyond that will be going towards paying the musicians (the rest will be covered from show revenue and ticket sales), accommodations, advertising, printing etc.  Beyond that, money will go towards more future touring, more music making and more tracks for YOU!

 

If I don't reach my entire goal, the money pledged will go towards covering at least some of the costs of the tour, which would be super helpful, and I'd be super grateful.

 

 

I'm offering a number of perks in exchange for your help.  That's how much I want to say thank you!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support the campaign financially, that's totally cool.  For folks who can’t contribute cash, but would still like to help, the simplest thing you can do is help spread the word.  You can post a link about this campaign on your facebook, twitter or tumblr.  You could tell your friends and co-workers about the campaign or announce it on your radio show, column or blog.  You can share it with your email list.

There are a number of tools on this website that you can use to let others know about the campaign and about my upcoming shows.  I hope that you can take a moment and click around on a few things and consider contributing to the campaign. A million thanks to all the fans, friends and family. Your support means the world to me!

xoxo Super

story:
Hello dear friends, old ones and new!

With this campaign I‘m starting a co-creative project that has been a dream for a very long time.

By bringing incredible artists together from many corners of our wonderful planet, I´d like to experiment with the dimensions of Sound.

A foundation for this journey will be music that has no particular genre, yet has been influenced by countless travels around the globe, interactions with people from all over, representing all sorts of cultural flavors and backgrounds.

We will begin in a recording studio in Riga, Latvia, with the beautiful name: ‘We Love Sound‘‘. A starting point for a bigger vision to follow and to travel the world with a film and audio equipment capturing the essences our georgeous Planet Earth has to offer.

For the last 13 years I have been journeying with an instrument that became my spiritual guide and a teacher - a practice that could be more aligned with the concept of guitar yoga than skilled craftmanship.

All these years I didn‘ t have a home as a physical strucure anywhere, only from time to time I'm stopping by in places to share, to rest and being creative.

I have played in hundreds of cities, small villages, street corners and concert halls, in front of rich and poor, at festivals and small gatherings. And yet, there is to learn more, so much to let go of, so many roads to explore within.

In music as well as in life, I have been applying and observing the phenomena of structure (I know) and the uniqueness of improvisation (I dont know). This approach encompasses the foundation and freedom in the same time and is making these opposites inseparable.

We can dream the dream, and very often wait for some other force to come, embrace, recognize or discover our talants. And yet, this recognition first of all starts inside.

Many of us have heard this wonderful expression by Marianne Williamson, I wish to quote it once again as a great reminder to all of us of our unique and infinite beauty:

“Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness that most frightens us. We ask ourselves, Who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous? Actually, who are you not to be? You are a child of God. Your playing small does not serve the world. There is nothing enlightened about shrinking so that other people won't feel insecure around you. We are all meant to shine, as children do. We were born to make manifest the glory of God that is within us. It's not just in some of us; it's in everyone. And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others.”

During all these years compositions were formed and are giving birth to ever evolving and expanding ideas. I have never learned how to compose music by sitting in a room, though I’m experiencing it LIVE…

Every musical short story that comes through me is an interaction with others, feelings, memories, pain and transformation of it all and transcended by sound.

As an example I would take a piece with the title:

"The Song of the Golden Dragon"

It came out during intense 6 months of travelling on the roads of Mexico.

"All I‘ve had was a guitar, an amp and a car. I made a living by playing on the streets and villages, at times I was entering a town and getting on the village‘s stage right away when people had a recognition of a travelling Toubadour. Perhaps one day I can tell you more about that adventure."

Here you can see/listen to a version of 2007 captured in Amsterdam right after that experience:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hCjAMpAtIPk

This one in Landshut,Germany in 2011, that got the biggest attention on the web:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7gphiFVVtUI

And this version has been recorded in 2013 in Switzerland:

http://youtu.be/01AuyP7yeNE

What has been in between is a Musical Journey where all compositions started to form in one… The very result you can see here, it is a composition called “Internal Flight”

estastonne.bandcamp.com/

Since 2010 I have been involved in a film project called ’Time of the Sixth Sun.” It has been 9 years in the making and is currently at the final stages of its creation. Please have a look at it yourself:

http://www.timeofthesixthsun.com

Music has the incredible power to transcend pain, to release old habits, to transform realities and create worlds.

I feel it is time to share, to create, to inspire and be inspired. To reconnect with a true mystery of life that connects us all, that makes our heart sing the songs and dream the world a better place. Isn’t it nice to be in a world in which we can live openly with each other?! Supporting each other’s differences and sharing the wisdom of the ancient ones?!

I truly wish that these songs, melodies, symphonies and films will bring an inspiring message to all of us. As a wise master says: “We are all in this together.”

story:
ÄLYMYSTÖ is a Helsinki/Tampere based band established by messieurs Haapanen and Vuorensola (who is better known as the director of "Iron Sky") focusing on the darkest corners of music. Throughout their ten years of existence the band has released one full-length album ("Atomgrad", 2005), and a number of EPs and unofficial releases, as well as toured much of Baltic countries, Russia and Finland.

The band consists of Mr. Haapanen (machines), Mr. Vuorensola (vocals), Mr. Honkonen (theremin), Mr. Paalanen (guitar) and Mr. Eskola (bass).

The band has decided to lay the groundwork for their next album now, at the turn of the tide. The second album, carrying the project name MAGNUM OPUS, will dig deep into the murderous depths of dark, experimental industrial noise metal, unearthing the unspeakable and renewing the industrial music world once and for all.

The aim with the crowd funding campaign is to raise money for the recording process of the album, to deliver the MAGNUM OPUS in the best, highest quality to the audience. The release will happen simultaneously on CD and vinyl as well as a digital release via iTunes and Spotify.

As perks, we are offering a wide array of hands-on Älymystö regalia, ranging from album sets to T-shirts, even offering to record a song on a topic you choose. Your name will be engraved forever on the release.

Support your local industrial weirdness, join the Intelligentsia, become a better human being.


CLICK HERE TO LISTEN TO PREVIOUS ÄLYMYSTÖ RECORDINGS

So far, every release Älymystö has made has been also released online, and are available for purchase, or to listen for free. Head over here and get to know the music behind the campaign.

 

WHAT DO WE NEED THE MONEY FOR?

Very roughly, the breakdown of the budget is as follows:

* Studio: 2000€

* Travel costs: 500€

* Printing the album (CDs and Vinyls): 2000€

* Marketing and promotion: 500€

We are not looking for a traditional distributor because for an experimental band like ours, it makes no sense for any of the parties. Instead, we believe in the free distribution model to promote the album sales.

story:
Hi my name is Rickey(ThaKiddJopp) I am a young man 24 years of age seeking to Glorify Jesus exalting his name using the gift of rap that he has graciously blessed me with.

  This campaign is about reaching the culture through music in my local community and many others places and areas, God Willing. This is very important and special to me personally because during my teenage years I remember the music that I would listen to and how much of a influence it had on me negatively. Through much prayer and confirmation I am fully convinced that God is calling me in this area of ministry. My ultimate aim is  to create music that will point the hearers Closer to Jesus Christ in hopes that The Lord might grant them everlasting life according to his will. 

With your help together we can further the Gospel of Jesus Christ. My music alone is not sufficient enough nor will it convert the listener. The platform of my music is simply to convey the message of the Gospel using my personal experiences as well as scriptures pointing to Jesus and not me. You guys play a important role because your contribution will not only help me reach that Goal financially to be able to create such music but it will also help further the Gospel and advance God's Kingdom.

Your help will be greatly appreciated and I can certainly promise you that it will not be in vain. My only hope is that those who stumble across this may either hear the sincerity through what is written or possibly may share the same common passion in wanting to further God's kingdom through music or any other avenue. 

 

For the mixtape and album I need a total amount of $5,000 which includes the cost of Recording, mixing, mastering , duplicated CD's, marketing, promotion and Graphic artwork for album cover.

ANY amount is greatly appreicated and never overlooked.

$20 Or more and I will personally send you a thank you video or card as well as a free single from the Project. Thank you so much.

$50 or more I will give you the copy of the project before its release date included with a signed copy of the mixtape. Thank You so much.

$100 or more I will send you a perosnal signed copy of both the album and mixtape and will mention your name in the outro on the album. Thank you so much.

 

$250 or more you will get all of the above plus I will video chat you personally thanking you! Thank you so much.

 

$1,000 or more All of the above will be inlcuded and I will come to your local church and do a live show! Thank you so much.

 

If for some reason we are unable to reach this goal I will use the remaining funds and record as much music as the finances will permit me to and by faith will continue to press forward in Christ believing that he will make provison.

The Impact

Young teens and young adult's will be presented the Gospel through music in a way that they might have not been acustomed to hearing or in a way that they may have never heard before. My main target is the young, simply because the mainstream media/music has a tight grip on them. However the older are not cancelled out. Praise God if he allows older individuals or mayebe even parents of these young teens to hear the music also. I pray it all points to Christ and is Gospel Centered across the board.

I have made plenty songs but have not been afforded the oppurtunity to relase them to the public due to finances. However i do have a select few of songs/Videos on my "Youtube" page. you can check this out by simply going to youtube and searching "ThaKiddJopp". A variety of selections will appear. I hope it blessed you.

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone here plays a very important role even if you are unable to contribute in the are of finances. You can help me out ALOT by sharing the page frequently on all of your social networking sites(Twitter, Facebook, Email and etc).

 

We all play a important role in this life. Lets use our time wisely and share the Gospel of Jesus Christ through whatever avenue the lord may have for us. Its more than music its about the bigger picture. Eternal Life in Jesus Christ. Thank you all for your time. I appreciate it so Much!

Grace and Peace,

ThaKiddJopp.

story:
Short Summary

We're Montreal's Diamond Bones, an indie dream-pop trio just about to make our first full-length record! We've been together for a year and have been fortunate enough to play some incredible shows, with amazing bands, in awesome cities. We're finally ready to record the music that we've been working on this whole time; a sound that we've been cultivating into something we're truly proud of and excited for everyone to hear. 

We really want this record to be an honest and genuine expression of us as musicians, songwriters, and as people going through the motions of the every day. Each song has a relationship with the others, which we feel allows the album to be cohesive but also lets each song stand out in its own way. We hope people will enjoy and listen to this record from beginning to end!

We're so lucky to be working with such a supportive team, including our producer Patrick Krief (The Dears), our co-mixer, Jace Lasek (The Besnard Lakes), and our engineer, James Benjamin (The Breezes), over at the outstanding Breakglass Studios located here in Montreal's Mile End. We're very happy to be executing this project locally with the help of musicians that we so respect and admire. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding received from this campaign will go directly to the recording, mixing and mastering of this record. Absolutely any help, big or small, is so important and appreciated. We have the best fans any band could ask for!

Depending on how much you donate, you can get anything from a personalized thank-you shout out to having your own free private concert! What fun!

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, we understand! We don't have any money either, remember? 'Cause we're doing this!

So any way you can share this campaign with friends, family, strangers, pets - unleash the spammer in you. We know it's in there. Word of mouth is the best way to get people involved! 

A HUGE thank you for your support, we love you. Like, for real love.


Michelle, Isabelle & Lana

story:
Who am I?

 

I'm an independent singer/songwriter/musician from CT currently working on my third record. Music is not just an important thing to me… it's the one thing I couldn't live without. Music is my heart and soul - it's the core of my being. I can't imagine my life without it, because it's not what I do, it's who I am.

 

I have performed on stages all over theUnited   Statesworking with artists like Natalie Merchant, The Go-Go’s, R.E.O. Speedwagon and Antigone Rising. I have been blessed with a network of family, friends, and fans that support me and my career.

 

I gain inspiration from everything around me and am beyond excited to share the new songs that I have written for my third CD. The most difficult aspect of being an independent artist is lack of funding. Very early in my recording career I made a commitment to making high quality studio recordings that are comparable with what you would hear on the radio. I am reaching out to as many of my family, friends and fans who would be willing to assist me with finishing this record.

 

I have been working on the CD for over a year and need your financial assistance to finish it… I know together we can make this dream a reality!

 

 

Why $12,000?

 

I am fortunate enough to collaborate with an award winning producer and professional musicians who have lent their talent to music industry giants. They see something in me and my music and share my excitement about the songs on this CD.  However they don’t work for free… and that’s why I need your help. Major labels can afford to spend at least ten times this much on a record. I've become really good at stretching a dollar, though. $12,000 will not only cover the recording, producing, mixing and mastering of my CD, but will also cover artwork, photos, packaging and CD duplication.

 

How can you be a part of helping me reach my goal?

 

You can be a part by pledging money to the cause. Pledge as little or as much as you like, every dollar helps!

 

What am I willing to do to get your help?

 

To the right of the page you'll see a list of things I'd be more than happy to do for you for your pledge of support. If you would like to hear more of my music please visit www.reverbnation/carrieashtonmusic or www.facebook.com/thecarrieashtonband. You can also find me on iTunes.

 

Thanks in advance for your support, your pledges, and especially for your belief in me and what I do...

 

CARRIE :)
story_txt:
Who am I?
 
I'm an independent singer/songwriter/musician from CT currently working on my third record. Music is not just an important thing to me… it's the one thing I couldn't live without. Music is my heart and soul - it's the core of my being. I can't imagine my life without it, because it's not what I do, it's who I am.
 
I have performed on stages all over theUnited   Statesworking with artists like Natalie Merchant, The Go-Go’s, R.E.O. Speedwagon and Antigone Rising. I have been blessed with a network of family, friends, and fans that support me and my career.
 
I gain inspiration from everything around me and am beyond excited to share the new songs that I have written for my third CD. The most difficult aspect of being an independent artist is lack of funding. Very early in my recording career I made a commitment to making high quality studio recordings that are comparable with what you would hear on the radio. I am reaching out to as many of my family, friends and fans who would be willing to assist me with finishing this record.
 
I have been working on the CD for over a year and need your financial assistance to finish it… I know together we can make this dream a reality!
 
 
Why $12,000? 
 
I am fortunate enough to collaborate with an award winning producer and professional musicians who have lent their talent to music industry giants. They see something in me and my music and share my excitement about the songs on this CD.  However they don’t work for free… and that’s why I need your help. Major labels can afford to spend at least ten times this much on a record. I've become really good at stretching a dollar, though. $12,000 will not only cover the recording, producing, mixing and mastering of my CD, but will also cover artwork, photos, packaging and CD duplication.
 
How can you be a part of helping me reach my goal? 
 
You can be a part by pledging money to the cause. Pledge as little or as much as you like, every dollar helps!
 
What am I willing to do to get your help? 
 
To the right of the page you'll see a list of things I'd be more than happy to do for you for your pledge of support. If you would like to hear more of my music please visit www.reverbnation/carrieashtonmusic or www.facebook.com/thecarrieashtonband. You can also find me on iTunes.
 
Thanks in advance for your support, your pledges, and especially for your belief in me and what I do...
 
CARRIE :)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Peter Chung and I am following my dream. I quit my job on January 3rd, 2012 to pursue my lifelong goal of becoming a singer-songwriter and focusing 100% of my time on my original music. Currently my funds have ran out and I need your help.

I have a demo cd that is not bad, but it is what it is: a demo. I believe that my songs are good enough to be placed on TV, in movies, on commercials, for radio play, but the quality of the recordings are not there. A demo cd is great for playing local gigs, but a CD is great for EVERYTHING. 

I have been playing open mics and networking in the city of San Francisco for awhile now and I know recording a legitimate CD is my next step.

I know that without my friends and fans I could have never followed my dreams, and without their support I could have never played my music for the public. Please continue to support my dream and I will keep on making music for you, I promise. 

Thank you very much.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know of any non-profit events that may need music please refer me. I love supporting all types of causes and I will play for free. 

If you know of any restaurants/bars/events that may need music please refer me. I can play a million cover songs!

Please put this link on Facebook / Twitter! 

Thank you very much.

story:
Amplification: An Album By Dragonfly

I'm JW Corey Tamas, the lead guitarist/singer/composer for a rock band named Dragonfly.

I'm also the producer of our first album, Amplification: a 14-song original rock/jazz/blues/electronica songs which will become a professionally-made digital album. It represents the culmination of hundreds of live shows and decades of songwriting... and it rocks pretty damn hard, if I do say so myself.

And now... I need your help to make Amplification a reality.

What Do We Need? What Do You Get?

We're only looking for $4,000, which isn't much as far as this sort of thing goes. $1,412 goes towards the recording  and $2373 goes to the mastering. $280 is Indiegogo's cut of the total, and the remaining $65 will likely go into things like sandwiches and coffee for the band while they're at work. Possibly some breath mints.

We're going to give back as much as we can: Depending on the level of your contribution, you'll get your own copy of Amplification as a digital download (or on a USB drive if you like). But that's far from all: Electronica remixes and acoustic tracks that won't be available otherwise, T-shirts, signed cards and notes to say "thanks", and even an album credit as an executive producer. Whatever you contribute, we're gonna give you your money's worth and more. Promise.

If we don't make the goal, funds will cover as much of the recording and mastering fees as possible, but may result in a delay or cancelation of the project. Boo hiss.

Why Make Amplification?

The reason why this album matters became clear one night when I was talking with (drummer/composer) Aaron Ferrera about what I should do with the body of musical work I'd created. At the time I was unsure about pursuing an album project, and he responded to me simply: "Nobody else is doing music like this."

And he's right. The fusion of hard rock with jazz and blues and electronica with lyrics about spirit and philosophy break out of the radio-friendly zone in a big way. This world needs music that tries to do something new.

Though the scale of the project is daunting, I'm no stranger to independent album releases: I did two releases under my own name that paid for themselves in full, and I've been deeply involved in digital music recording and performance for over a decade. While Amplification is a big project compared to past efforts, it falls neatly into the range of my skill set and experience. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute cash to a project like this, but if you want to support Amplification and help get this album made, you can get the word out and make a lot of noise. 

There's a long list of great things you can do to help us out: Post our campaign URL (http://indiegogo.com/amplification) or the Dragonfly website (http://dragonfly-live.com) on your Facebook page, Blog, Twitter, Tumblr, Google+ or whatever you happen to be grooving on. Follow us on Twitter (@DragonflyLive) and like us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/DragonflyLive). 

Best of all, tell a friend "Hey, have you heard of this band?" and let them listen to a bit of the music on the Dragonfly website. 

And if you can't manage any of that, just cross your fingers... say your prayer... keep a good thought... and be sure to check back for news on Amplification and where you can get it. 

Thank you, everyone, for helping me make my dreams come true.

story:
Hi everyone, we're The Leeway!

We're a brand new band from Brooklyn, NY. We are jump starting this project, and we're asking for your support to get it done!

The Leeway are Mike Robinson(guitar/vocals), Pedro Barquinha(mandolin/vocals), Bennett Sullivan(banjo/vocals), Matt Rousseau(bass), and Dominick Mekky(piano).

We are very excited about this band, and cannot wait to finally share our music with people!

What We Need

The funding for this project, will go towards four essential areas:
  • Recording our EP at a professional recording studio in New York. That includes, studio time, soundman, mixing, mastering at a separate location, and design for the EP cover.
  • Making a professional website for the band.
  • Getting promotional materials including, photos of the band, and EPK video.
  • Hiring a publicist to help promote the band and get the music as far out there as possible.

The Impact

This project means a lot to all of us. We're ready to put the work in to make this an amazing band. All we need is your support to make this happen. 

We feel unbound by genre or style, and we're not following a conventional format or compositional devices. This isn't your "usual" instrumentation. By using instruments such as banjo, and mandolin, mixed with piano and arranging them in our own way, we believe we're creating a unique and personal sound.
 
We truly believe that a lot of people would enjoy this music we've been working so hard on, and there's so much we want to accomplish.

In the next two years, we hope to be able to tour the US, and Europe, and play large venues and festivals such as Bowery Ballroom, Bonaroo, Merlefest, and many more.

We're so excited about this, please join us in making this happen!

Other Ways You Can Help...

Even if you can't contribute funds, there are other great ways you can help!

  • Get the word out and make some noise on Facebook and Twitter! 
  • Forward our emails to your friends!

story:
Who we are and what we're doing.

We are Reasons, we are Christian deathcore band from Columbia Tennessee just trying to make it in music and do the work of The Kingdom. We are currently a four piece with Logan Hayworth on vocals, Josh Owens on guitar, Miika Weimann on bass, and Wyatt Irwin on drums.
Here's what we're trying to do:
  • Raise money to cover part of our touring expense this summer
  • Order merchandise to sell online and at shows
  • Build relationships with people who support us and our mission

Help us help you!

Long story short, our goal is 800$ 

  • This 800$ will help us go to different parts of the country to get our name out and to spread the Gospel. All of the money will go to the aforementioned expenses (i.e. merch, gas, and food).
  • We've got all kinds of cool perks from buttons, to tee shirts, skype calls, and even a potential show in your hometown! 
  • If for some reason{s} (see what we did there) we don't reach our goal we're simply gonna take the money we do raise and just make it go as far as it can towards our expenses and trust the Lord to provide the rest. 

The Impact

Ultimately, by helping fund this campaign you're helping a few guys follow their dreams and The Lord's will for their lives as well as helping kids in the underground music scene hear The Gospel in a way that is relevant to their lives. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you simply can not financially support this cause at the moment, we understand, you can still be a part of all this simply by:

  • Spreading the word about this campaign to your friends, family, church, or local music scene
  • Prayer, we need all the prayer we can get as we prepare to go out and do this for the Kingdom.
Be blessed,
Reasons

story:
Medicine Calf consists of Sprit Bear and Zooanzoo.  Two fellows that have been creating music together since grade school.  Starting out originally as a garage rock band, they've now evolved into a more eclectic sound spanning from jazz to freak-folk and right back to their more chaotic roots.  After spending 7 years on the majority of songs from the album, they've decided to record these jams with Brian from Waveland Productions.  Now that they are produced to their liking, they would like to put tangible albums in your hands!  From the funds they receive, they'll be able to finally print these onto a hard case CD.  

This would be a dream come true if it comes to fruition. Anything is appreciated, even a hug. Thank you all.

-Zooanzoo & SpritBear

story:
Short Summary

The City On A Hill Project was first conceived from brainstorming ideas on how to raise funds for a group from Jericho Road Church to be able to go and minister to our sister church in Chiang Mai, Thailand. Out of that discussion, the church leadership decided to host a benefit, worship concert that accepted donations at the door to go directly towards this cause. The idea was then birthed to film the night of worship and release it as a DVD, with all of the proceeds from sales going towards future trips, supporting the City On A Hill in Chiang Mai, putting their pastor through Bible school and training, and any other needs that may arise in the future. Several weeks before this was put into motion, Eric Wagenmaker and JRoad’s worship team were already in the planning stages of recording a studio worship album comprised of all original material and fresh arrangements with all of those proceeds going towards the same cause. It was quickly decided that both of these efforts would be packaged together to create a double disc feature that would then be called “The City On A Hill Project.”

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2500 for the packaging of this product. There have been literally dozens of people who have generously given time to make this project happen up until this point, but the packaging is a cost we can't get past without your support!

If you pledge towards this project, there are some great perks! You will get an exclusive, pre-release digital copy of the studio album and also have the opportunity to pre-order the physical, double disc feature!

There is a chance that we will NOT reach this goal. If this is the case, your money will still be used for a GREAT cause. The music project will be delayed in it's PHYSICAL release, but your money will still go directly towards sending a team to Chian Mai this coming fall.

The Impact

Thailand is primarily a Buddhist nation and the enemy is at work in a powerful way, enslaving people’s minds and bodies. Jericho Road Church has a very unique and specific calling to reach out to this people group in Chiang Mai.

We are honored by your support! In helping us raise funds, the big picture is this:

-You are helping rescue at-risk children stay out of human trafficking.

-You are helping advance the gospel to an under-churched region of the world.

-You are supporting a campaign that wages war against Satan in an evil-plagued nation.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support this cause financially, there's good news! You can still help!!! Please share this link with as many people as you can! Share the video, share our website! The more awareness we can spread, the bigger the impact will be!

story:
My Story

 If you got this then you know me personally,impersonally or have heard me play...So I've been dragging my feet and have gotten it together to record songs I've been working on for several years. I've tried to record some of these on my own but with poor results. So I want to give them a chance and record them properly as an e.p.
 Along to record with me will be Parker Kindred( Jeff Buckley, Antony and the Johnsons , Joan as Police woman)
and Tyler Wood ( Luke Temple/Here we go magic, Joan as Police woman,glass ghost) and hopefully a few more guests!
So this won't happen for free. I have to raise money to record this e.p. Would you like to participate in helping me make this record?
I'm doing my fundraising on indiegogo. here below; give it a glance and watch a small video I made.

Here's a bit about me;


Christian Carbat Carana... thought for a moment to have been the nephew of Philip strauss kahn has in fact no other relation other than being part French...CC Carana was born in 1972 in a sort of Basket in France..
Visited by a chimp while still in that basket, the chimp was chased away... That same year, a very young Carana was introduced to Jazz by the clarinetist Mezz Mezzrow in Paris, although not directly since he died the year of Carana's birth....Direct re-incarnation? According to Carana's mother, she had Mezzrow's  drums in her basement... ??Maybe he dabbled in drums too...Carana's Mother later sold this rare drum set to an obscure British new wave producer...Twelve years later Carana relocated to NEW York where he grew dreadlocks and wanted to be a Rastafarian. He did not want to be a white man. It was around this time that he discovered his roots in Guadeloupe as well as more recently in Haiti. Carana also traveled extensively to Jamaica and later met up with Ras Michael In Los Angleles a few months prior to the 1992 Los Angeles riots. In 1994 He got yelled at in a now defunct New York city reggae record shop by the late Singer Joseph Hill for his ignorance. Joseph Hill who had been the founder of the legendary group Culture,lost his temper at the young Carana for not knowing he had toured throughout Africa for many years. Later that year, Carana recorded his first solo record onto cassette entitled; me, myself and I./ Lonesome rider... The origins of this music might be akin to folk... To this day, CC Carana plays a form of flock music...Flak , Folk, Flock...whatever...

What I Need & What You Get

All the money goes towards recording,mixing and paying musicians and pressing copies of this e.p.
What you get is a copy of the e.p. and your name on the Jacket! see the perks below...

Other Ways You Can Help;

Pass this link on to other people who you think would want to contribute. There are also tools on this site provided to make it easy to pass on.
