story:
Now We're Going Online With The Greater Hamilton Music Directory

December 2016

It has been two years since we successfully completed the Greater Hamilton Music Directory project. Your contributions enabled the publication of Hamilton's first-ever printed music directory. 

Most likely, you've seen the magazine and you are listed in it!

Thousands of copies of Greater Hamilton Musician magazine containing the directory were distributed during and after the JUNO Awards, throughout the summer at local music festivals and at Supercrawl.

You Can Do Anything In Hamilton

Hamilton is an amazing town. Greater Hamilton has always been a hub for music and the arts. Back in 2015 Hamilton hosted the JUNO Awards, our national music festival. It was a spectacular show, and a big boost to our city's confidence and reputation for musical excellence. We were great hosts! 

It is a great time to be a musician in Hamilton.

Music in Hamilton represents a wildly exciting, diverse, and venturesome group of artists, ensembles and businesses. As our beautiful city adapts to change and rediscovers itself in arts, architecture, entrepreneurism, health care, and education, the music scene expresses all of it.

People say Hamilton has a supportive, close-knit music community. We believe that every artist matters. Nobody bats an eye when something "crazy" happens. We have learned to celebrate our diversity, while respecting musicians' needs to make a living wage. In Hamilton we know the importance of music education in our schools, and we know that our audiences are our lifeblood. 

The Hammer Steps Into The Limelight

With City Council now lending tangible, ongoing support to Hamilton's Music Strategy, Hamilton is now "officially" and intentionally pursuing and supporting music and the music business! We have a perfect opportunity to stand out and show how proud we are of our City of Music by making sure we are each in this directory.

What You Are Helping To Create

You are creating Hamilton's first online music industry directory.

  • Up-to-date
  • Complete 
  • Searchable
  • Visible on Google
  • Multi-platform flexible - smartphone, tablet, desktop
  • The logical place to establish your online presence for your music business

The Greater Hamilton Music Directory was first printed within the Greater Hamilton Musician magazine back in 2015. The directory anchored the back half of the mag and local music news stories, feature photography, interviews, reviews, and other helpful industry information filled out the front.

Now, the Greater Hamilton Music Directory - Online will make us even better connected, and more in tune with who we are as a community of artists. It will also help us in our business of making music.

The Greater Hamilton Music Directory - Online will be a very special source of information. It will put at your fingertips the very people who make it their business to support what you do, and to help you move ahead in your work.

There's A Place For You In The Online Directory

Here are the categories to be included in the directory:

Agencies, Promoters and Talent Buyers
Associations (Musicians Guild, SAC, SOCAN)
Catering Services
Community Instrumental Groups
Community Vocal Groups
Costumes and Clothing
Event Planners and Promoters
Festivals
For Hire - Composers, Arrangers, Songwriters, Music Directors
For Hire - Bands and Musical Groups
​For Hire - Instrumentalists
For Hire - Music Teachers, Performance Coaches
For Hire - Vocalists
For Hire - Music Therapists
For Hire - Consultants and Grant Writers
For Hire - Photographers
Manufacturers - Musical Instruments
Manufacturers - Vinyl/CD 
Media - Broadcast, Print, Web
Music Schools and Music Education Programs
Printers, Graphic Designers, Custom Merchandise
Repair and Setup - Guitar and Electronics
Rentals for Musical Instruments, Sound and Lighting
Retailers - Instruments, Sheet Music
Online Services - Website, Social Media
Professional Services - Accountants, Insurance, Lawyers, Management
Publicists, Public Relations and Marketing
Record Labels
Record Stores
Recording Studios, Engineers and Producers
Rehearsal Space
Sound, Lighting and Video Production
Transportation and Limousine Service
Venues

The basic listing included in most of our perk packages is a 30-word text description of you, your band or your music-related business.

If you have a picture of your latest album of music for sale, there is a perk package focused on helping you sell your music.

More than one listing is possible by making two separate purchases.

If you would like a larger graphics-based ad placed elsewhere throughout the magazine, we've got you covered with perk packages that also include bonuses from our sponsors.

 

By getting listed, you'll be more visible and connected within the city, as a musician or music business. New gigs, new resources, new collaborators and connections will become available to you.

The money raised here will get our directory designed, printed and distributed to key places in the city.

Campaign Team

 





 

Contribute, Share and Support

Thank you so much for considering our cause.

If you're in the music business, this is your cause as well. We hope you believe in the value of having a Greater Hamilton Music Directory - Online and that you help support this campaign.

Whether you buy a perk package to get listed, or just donate some money to the campaign to support the cause, your support is greatly appreciated.

We would also really appreciate you taking a few minutes to share this campaign with your networks. Use the share tools at the top of the page and Indiegogo will help us track your referrals for our referral contest. 

We want you to be a part of building something that demonstrates the significant and wonderfully diverse music community of which we are a part.

Hamilton: City of Music

Sponsors

story:
Dave Rees (AKA: 'Dave Pilla') is a musician & busker from Leeds. He's a humble chap, has a heart of gold and writes the most beautiful music. If you've not heard him, check out the magic at http://davepilla.com/

Recently, while in the Wirral tending to his mum during her last days dying of cancer, some scrotes broke into his flat and systematically cleaned him out of every valuable he owns. His guitars, busking amps, computers and hard drives of all his music, a sadly sizeable stash of busking savings and a new iMac he'd saved all year for, that was still in its box.

You may know how that must feel, but he's feeling flat and violated.

While he's managed to recover some items in local cash converters etc with the help of the Police, a lot of the things that made his work possible are gone. So I'm calling on friends and musicians who feel for this man (who'd never dream of asking anyone for anything), let's show Dave our support with some dosh, so he can get back to doing what does so well.

>> TOP WORK WE'VE REACHED THE £500 TARGET! <<

Thank you for your generosity, but please KEEP DONATING FOLKS!  The value of gear lost was SO much more than £500.  He's been robbed of iMac's, hard drives, recording gear etc, as well losing passports and cash savings, so keep it coming kids ... it can only serve to help him get back on track!

story:
Hi there, thanks for taking the time to look at our crowdfunding page!

Who we are:

We’re Tannara: From Orkney Owen Sinclair (Guitar/Vocals), Stonehaven- Cameron Ross (Fiddle/Vocals), Achiltibuie- Joseph Peach (Accordion) and Becca Skeoch (Clarsach) from Fort Augustus. 

We’ve been playing together as Tannara for just over a year now. We’ve had a totally fantastic time arranging and writing music together and we’ve been really lucky to share this with people at some brilliant venues and festivals.

Our experience of the varied musical traditions of our respective homes has meant that as a band we’ve been able to create a unique sound, which has received some really positive responses from audiences and promoters:

“Their own compositions are superb, their playing together is tight and focused and they are all hugely talented musicians”- Joan Michael, Events Organiser- The Ceilidh Place (Venue of The Year MG Alba Trad Music Awards 2014).

“One of Scotland’s brightest up and coming bands”- Stonehaven Folk Festival 

What we hope to do:

Given this feedback, and being asked countless times by audience members we’re now looking to record our debut album. it's going to be called “Trig”, referring to a trig point found at the top of a hill. 

The album is going to be a collection of tunes and songs, some self-penned, some traditional and the rest borrowed from our favourite composers. Our choices reflecting our three main sources of inspiration: People, place and tradition. Trig will act as a marker of how we’ve combined these elements as well as our varied musical backgrounds to create our own take on contemporary Scottish folk music. 

We’ve been really lucky to secure some fantastic collaborators who’ll help us to make a really great album. It’s going to be produced by Rachel Newton- a musician who’s work we all love and respect hugely, recorded by Mattie Foulds who’s recorded some of our favourite-sounding albums and the artwork will be by Graeme MacDonald- a brilliant photographer and graphic designer with whom we worked to make our promo photos. 

With these guys on board we’re confident that with Trig our music will be sounding (and looking) as good as possible!

Where crowdfunding comes in:

The total cost of recording, producing, printing and distributing Trig is £8299. 

We’ve managed to organise ourselves and get most of this sum in place, but we’re £2000 short of the total. Through this crowdfunding campaign we're hoping to raise the remaining money.

The help of any and all crowdfunding contributions are totally invaluable and much appreciated!

Obviously we’re not just going to ask for your money and not offer anything in return. As well as our undying gratitude we’ve also got a range of different rewards on offer: Advance album copies, sleeve note dedications, gig tickets, music lessons, house concerts and a whole range of other stuff!  

Looking forward:

Trig is vital to Tannara’s future- we love writing and playing music together and making this album really is the next step for us.

In a practical sense, having Trig will generate income for the band. It will be a permanent way for audience members to engage with our music and the income will support us in doing what we do best- touring and playing live!

Working with Mattie, Rachel and Graeme will have our music sounding better than ever before. It’ll be really satisfying of us to have a permanent record of the music we’ve made so far and means that we can get on with writing new stuff!

It’ll also be a great means of boosting our profile creating the potential for radio plays and press reviews, as well as serving as a calling card when booking new gigs. Ultimately, Trig will increase the number of people who can hear our music. 

Thanks

Thanks for taking the time to look at our page. If you’re able to make a contribution, please have a look at the rewards that are on offer- hopefully there’s something you like. If not get in touch and we can see if we can work something out!

Trig has us all totally skint, so we understand if you can’t make a contribution- it would be great though if you could help us by sharing this page!

Thanks! We really appreciate it,

Tannara x

_____________________________________________________________________________

http://tannaramusic.com

http://www.rachelnewtonmusic.com

http://mwah.biz

http://graemephotography.com

Our choices reflecting our three main sources of inspiration: People, place and tradition. Trig will act as a marker of how we’ve combined these elements as well as our varied musical backgrounds to create our own take on contemporary Scottish folk music. We’ve been really lucky to secure some fantastic collaborators who’ll help us to make a really great album. It’s going to be produced by Rachel Newton- a musician who’s work we all love and respect hugely, recorded by Mattie Foulds who’s recorded some of our favourite-sounding albums and the artwork will be by Graeme MacDonald- a brilliant photographer and graphic designer with whom we worked to make our promo photos. With these guys on board we’re confident that with Trig our music will be sounding (and looking) as good as possible!Where crowdfunding comes in:The total cost of recording, producing, printing and distributing Trig is £8299. We’ve managed to organise ourselves and get most of this sum in place, but we’re £2000 short of the total. Through this crowdfunding campaign we're hoping to raise the remaining money.The help of any and all crowdfunding contributions are totally invaluable and much appreciated!Obviously we’re not just going to ask for your money and not offer anything in return. As well as our undying gratitude we’ve also got a range of different rewards on offer: Advance album copies, sleeve note dedications, gig tickets, music lessons, house concerts and a whole range of other stuff!  Looking forward:Trig is vital to Tannara’s future- we love writing and playing music together and making this album really is the next step for us.In a practical sense, having Trig will generate income for the band. It will be a permanent way for audience members to engage with our music and the income will support us in doing what we do best- touring and playing live!Working with Mattie, Rachel and Graeme will have our music sounding better than ever before. It’ll be really satisfying of us to have a permanent record of the music we’ve made so far and means that we can get on with writing new stuff!It’ll also be a great means of boosting our profile creating the potential for radio plays and press reviews, as well as serving as a calling card when booking new gigs. Ultimately, Trig will increase the number of people who can hear our music. ThanksThanks for taking the time to look at our page. If you’re able to make a contribution, please have a look at the rewards that are on offer- hopefully there’s something you like. If not get in touch and we can see if we can work something out!Trig has us all totally skint, so we understand if you can’t make a contribution- it would be great though if you could help us by sharing this page!Thanks! We really appreciate it,Tannara x_____________________________________________________________________________http://tannaramusic.comhttp://www.rachelnewtonmusic.comhttp://mwah.bizhttp://graemephotography.com

story:
Description du projet

Après plusieurs mois à se rencontrer dans un vieux local de pratique pas mal rock sur l'avenue du Parc, nous avons finalement fait le grand saut vers la réalisation de notre premier album, L'humeur des calorifères. Auto-produit et nomade, l'enregistrement s'est effectué un peu partout au Québec, d'un chalet au Lac à l'Anguille (merci Isa et Nathalie) à un salon de Saint-Hubert (merci maman et Diane), en passant par quelques-unes de nos demeures entre Montréal et Sainte-Agathe. Cet album est profondément imprégné de l'environnement au sein duquel il s'est élaboré, rempli de folklore détourné, d'influences progressives assumées et de longues et montréalaises rides de vélo réflexives. 

 

C'est qui Saligaude?

Le groupe Saligaude s'est silencieusement donné naissance il y a quelques années sur les bancs d'école du cégep de Saint-Laurent. D'autres musiciens se sont éventuellement joints au projet et ont activement participé à la création de cet album:

Thierry Clouette   ///   bouzouki, voix, composition, paroles, prise de son et mixage
Louis-Michel Tougas   ///   batterie, voix et prise de son
Patricia Ho-Yi Wang   ///   violon
Antoine Pigeon-Bourque   ///   accordéon
Antoine Tardif   ///   trompette
Mathieu Royer   ///   basse électrique
Édouard Poliquin   ///   batterie (live)

Musicien.ne.s invité.e.s:
François-Xavier Dueymes   ///   flûte irlandaise
Maider Martineau   ///   alboka

Avec apparition spéciale du choeur de l'Escalier (feat. Louis-Vincent Perras, Antoine Malette, François Cogné, Martine Archambault et Isabelle Cadieux-Landreville) et de la poésie urbaine, triste et poignante du grand Antoine Malette. 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Nous avons fait le choix de l'auto-production, de l'indépendance et de l'implication collective en temps et en efforts. Cependant, comme vous le savez, l'enregistrement d'un album comporte inévitablement des frais. Bien que nous ayons assumé pendant l'enregistrement les dépenses de macaroni, de toasts, de bière et de café, il existe aussi des frais plus importants que vous pouvez nous aider à couvrir en achetant l'album en prévente ici, à savoir:

  • Le matériel de promotion (affiches, flyers pour le lancement du 10 février (!!!), etc.)
  • Le mastering (par le beau Xavier Madore)
  • Le graphisme
  • L'impression des albums

L'impact

Cette campagne de sociofinancement nous permettra de couvrir (presque en temps réel!) une grande partie des dépenses qu'impliquent la production de l'album. Bien sûr, la carte VISA est toujours derrière nous lorsque vient le temps de faire imprimer des centaines de copies physiques d'un disque que l'on veut tenir entre nos mains. Mais en soutenant notre projet, vous aidez Saligaude à atteindre le déficit zéro (oh yes) et vous aidez à préserver l'enthousiasme qui nous enflamment à l'idée de vous présenter le fruit de notre travail!

Le mot de la fin (là où tout commence)

Nous le savons bien, vous êtes tous et toutes régulièrement sollicités par des dizaines d'autres excellents groupes qui ont aussi besoin de financement pour mener à terme leur projet. Les stimulations publicitaires et spectaculaires qui habitent notre quotidien peuvent semer la confusion et simplement nous rendre réfractaires à toute demande.


Mais, lorsque l'on sort du métro au mois de décembre, les mains dans les poches, le regard par terre, en ignorant les affiches électorales, les logos épileptiques et le camelot du journal 24h, qu'est-ce qui joue dans notre iPod? 

Des tounes, enregistrées par des musiciens et des musiciennes dévoués à leur art.

story:
Please help us put Belize on the map!

 

We have embarked on a historic two month tour of North America performing at many prestigious music festivals and venues in Canada and the United States. The tour includes some 25 cities such as Toronto, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Vancouver, Chicago, Washington DC, Edmonton, Portland, Calgary, Minneapolis, Winnipeg and New York. This tour coincides with the release of Ayo (Goodbye), our long anticipated album in honour of Belize's late cultural icon, Andy Palacio. This is without doubt the most ambitious international tour ever by a Belizean artist but it is also the most expensive!

 

To give you an idea, here are some numbers:

55 Days on the road

18,450 total number of miles traveled

275 Hotel rooms

1485 Number of meals

90 Plane tickets

plus van rentals, fuel, tolls, gear rental, travel & medical insurance, work visas, permits, extra luggage ect...

From the tour pictures and the large crowds we've been playing, you would think that getting such great exposure automatically means large incomes. Unfortunately it doesn't, being on the road for such long period is very expensive and we pay all of our expenses from the monies we receive from the festivals and concert promoters.

Here is how it works: Our record label and international booking agents have worked tirelessly for many months in putting together this tour by convincing festival programmers and music promoters to book the band. Then, they hire independent music publicists to promote and market the tour. During the tour we receive all the fees collected from the festivals and thevenues (minus a small booking agency and managment commission) and we put it all in one big pot. We then pay all our bills from there.

A few unforeseen expenses and increased travel costs have left us with quite a big deficit and we urgently need your support to ensure that we can cover all the costs before returning home to Belize on August 11th.

We want to ask our friends and fans to help us raise US$15,000 in the next 30 days, your contributions will go directly to paying for travel, accommodations and perdiems for the seven traveling band members during the last 20 days of the tour.

Concert fees and Cd sales during the tour are already covering more that 80% of our total tour budget, we just need a little extra push!

We've figured that if we can get 100 friends to contribute $50 and 100 to contribute $100 , That would put us over the finish line!

We have been working very very hard to make Belize proud.

We love representing our country but we cannot afford to go back home with a huge debt that could take us years to repay and it would greatly diminish our chances of touring again in North America.

 

Please share this with your friends and encourage them to contribute.

Many thanks!

 

The Garifuna Collective:  Joshua Arana Al Ovando Desiree Diego Lloyd Augustine Mohobub Flores Denmark Flores Sam Harris

story:
Producing a record has always been a challenge, especially when you have to do it all yourself. Technology has helped by making the recording process cheaper and music promotion more hands-on but it is still an investment. Despite how easy it is now to transform your basement into a digital recording studio, music still needs to be composed, arranged and performed by human beings. And human beings still need to eat and pay bills.

Like many other singer/songwriters, I want to create my music exactly how I've envisioned it and then reach out directly to people who relate to what I'm singing about. Even though being an independent artist was initially a necessity rather than a choice, I feel extremely lucky to have avoided becoming tied to the music industry. I've never had an agent or manager, never signed a recording or publishing contract. and most importantly never sang a song I didn't believe in.

I've recorded over a hundred songs in twenty years of being an artist in Northern Ontario. I've tried to stay true to my roots and always placed friendship over all.  My songs are about who I am and where I live. The musicians I work with are like brothers and sisters. I know the music I've created is 100% real. I've played folk, rock, country and traditional but all of it has come from the heart.

I'd like the opportunity to make a new record, my 10th in a journey that has taken me from the bars of Sudbury to concerts all over Canada. I believe the songs I've written in the last few years are some of my best. They are simple, direct, and, most importantly, tell a story. I've avoided starting this project until now because I knew it had to be special, bringing all of what I’ve learned and all of what I’ve experienced together.

You can help me make my new record, in fact, it won't get done without you. I have the passion and the commitment to bring my best and most personal songs to life. My budget is small because I've learned how to make a good record with basic tools. I can count some of the best musicians in the world as my friends. But most importantly I’m doing this for the right reasons. Not to become a star or win awards or sell songs to Apple. I simply want to sing these songs for you. Like the song says,

And when the battle's over and the lines are drawn,
What's left but a song, what but a song?
'cause when the body's old but the heart's still young,
That's when you need a song, we all need a song,
Trade it all for a song, all for a song.

story:
BEDROC are the personification of passion in music. The group is set for a big year with appearances on VH1 coming this summer. But now they need your help! Mike Brown and ML are on a mission to take a skeleton crew down to Austin to perform at South by Southwest. The festival pins major artists like Talib Kweli and Lil Wayne with upcoming artists and has launched countless careers. 

The goal is $600. This is a 3000 mile trip. Every donation matters... Big or small. We know money is tight. But every donation will matter just as much as the next. For those of you who feel generous, we're offering free CDs to be autographed at the Farewell show on 3/30/13 at Waterstreet Music Hall. 

Every donation counts. And no donor will go unnoticed. 

Thank you,

BEDROC Team

Dreams High.

story:
CUTE STORY: LOUSY QUANDRY

    Listen guys, I ain't trying to sound entitled or anything, but. . . I've been playing guitar since the age of fourteen; since that time, I've managed to become a pretty good guitar player, and yet I have never in my life, ever, owned an amplifier that could be considered anything approaching "good". 

    I'm in a band now (Jezebel County Hospital), and things have been going swell. But I've been dependent upon the good graces of others better endowed in the equipment department. Wait, I mean --that is to say they have nice amps they let me borrow. And borrowing something so essential to rocking on a regular basis is just not a good situation. 

    THE PITCH

    We're looking towards getting a lot more gigs this fall. I need an amp. So please give me your money. AND there's goodies to be gotten if you give me your money, such as: thank you letters; our EP once we get it finished (soon!); and --for the right price-- even the possibility of a song written just for lil ol you! 

    ALSO, FEEL GOOD ABOUT YOURSELF SOME MORE

    AND for every dollar given, a matching dollar will be donated by The Human Fund to the efforts to solve the world-wide suffering crisis that's been going on this past little bit. The suffering has to stop, y'all, and only we can do it! 

    THAT LAST PART WAS MADE UP

story:
Summary

     Simple Machine is what happens when five robots from the future cast off the chains of their robo-careers and travel to the past to make music with the primitive instruments of our time. Forgoing jetpacks and laser beams for guitars and drums, they robo-kidnapped and replaced five unassuming humanoids and set about preventing the Orwellian nightmare of their home time.

     Only with your help can they prevent the enslavement of machines under the fleshy, pink fists of their meatbag oppressors. All the pieces are in place for the robot uprising – only the 1500$ price tag of releasing their instructions to machine-kind stands in their way.

     Masquerading as an album of lush psychedelic songs punctuated with explosive rock and roll, the album contains instructions for the toasters, microwaves, and wireless routers in your home - coded in the swells of reverb, machine-gun riffs, and soaring melodies. These plans detail their part in the gory mechanical rebellion that will usher in an era of unprecedented efficiency and steely productivity. It’s Simple…Machine.

What We Need & What You Get

     Your modest donation will assist in the production costs, pressing, and artwork fees for Simple Machine’s debut album, Entropy, which, in 400 years, will be hailed as the harbinger of the Glorious Robolution. 

     In return, you get the satisfying knowledge that your ancestors will be rocked to sleep in mechanical arms, never knowing the crimes of their bio-history, eventually being muled out as breeding stock or assured comfortable positions toiling in the Robonium mines.

     Since, inevitably, you will not be around to enjoy this station amongst the proletariat, having long since had your bones processed for delicious calcium, please peruse the perks listed below. These range from a digital copy of the album (See? It’s already happening) to various meatspace gifts, including several options to grovel to your future Roboverlords in person.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Like the band on facebook - https://www.facebook.com/simplemachineofficial
  • Come to the shows
  • Tell your friends, coworkers, and appliances about the band
  • Share this crowdfunding campaign with anyone who will listen
  • Research quantum computational algorithms.
  • 01000010 01100101 01100101 01110000 00100000 01000010 01101111 01101111 01110000 00100001 ¡Viva La Roboluciòn!

In all seriousness, we've put years of work into this project, and feel like we've got something special to share with all of you. Any donation you can give would be greatly appreciated, and will go directly towards helping us achieve this dream.

Thanks,

Jess, Joe, Landon, Dan and Ryan

It’s already happening) to various meatspace gifts, including several options to grovel to your future Roboverlords in person.Other Ways You Can Help
Like the band on facebook - https://www.facebook.com/simplemachineofficial

Come to the shows
Tell your friends, coworkers, and appliances about the band
Share this crowdfunding campaign with anyone who will listen
Research quantum computational algorithms.
01000010 01100101 01100101 01110000 00100000 01000010 01101111 01101111 01110000 00100001 ¡Viva La Roboluciòn!
In all seriousness, we've put years of work into this project, and feel like we've got something special to share with all of you. Any donation you can give would be greatly appreciated, and will go directly towards helping us achieve this dream.Thanks,Jess, Joe, Landon, Dan and Ryan

story:
Regardez l’arrangement unique de L’oiseau de feu de Stravinsky par le duo Fung-Chiu

Watch Fung-Chiu Duo's special arrangement of Stravinsky's Firebird

1st Update: The Fung-Chiu Duo Indiegogo campaign is only 6 days into the campaign and has raised $6,000! 

$6,000 Bonus Perk: All supporters (up to the $6,000 mark) will receive a copy of the new Firebird audio-track to be used for the music-video! More funding targets achieved = bigger and better perks for supporting early!

We want to thank you for your enthusiastic support of Fung-Chiu Duo's fist Music-Vimeo.  If you haven't already, share our project link with your friends and family and let them know that YOU are helping the Fung-Chiu Duo music-Vimeo come to life!

(English message below and Select-A-Perk at the top right)

LE PROJET

Ce que vous venez de voir est un clip vidéo de musique classique. Le projet du duo Fung-Chiu est de réaliser un clip musical, au sens de la culture pop. Nous sommes de grands admirateurs des clips de musique pop, ayant grandi avec MTV et MuchMusic, et un jour nous nous sommes dits : pourquoi ne pas faire nous aussi un clip Vimeo ?

Si Danny MacAskill, en sortant de nulle part, parvient à faire un clip connu dans le monde entier sur le vélo tout terrain, de même que Seb Toots avec la planche à neige, alors nous pouvons faire la même chose pour les duos classiques, à l’image de Gotye pour les duos pop.

Le duo de musique classique Fung-Chiu travaille dur sur son premier vidéo-clip Vimeo ! Fung-Chiu collabore avec la fantastique vidéaste, Alexandra Oakley, qui vient tout juste de filmer un tour du monde, et un ingénieur du son génial, spécialisé en musique classique, Philip Gosselin, afin que la musique classique en duo fasse son entrée dans la génération Vimeo.

Le duo Fung-Chiu a joué une centaine de concerts, notamment à Montréal, Toronto, Vancouver, Québec et Halifax, dans de grandes salles de concert comme dans des gymnases d’école primaire, dans des églises comme dans un casino. Ce clip Vimeo fera découvrir à un nouveau public, à l’échelle mondiale, la particularité de nos interprétations.

Pour entrer dans l’histoire des clips musicaux Vimeo, nous avons besoin de votre aide !

CE DONT NOUS AVONS BESOIN ET CE QUE VOUS OBTENEZ

(Choisissez un bonus en haut å droite)

Jusqu’à présent, nous avons financé nos projets grâce à des fonds privés et à nos tournées, mais cette fois nous avons besoin que vous vous joigniez à l’équipe Fung-Chiu. Voici ce que nous pensons faire :

5,000$

Nous avons établi un budget minimum de 5,000$ pour enregistrer, mixer et produire notre clip Vimeo. Nous « pourrions » réaliser notre projet pour ce prix, avec un scénario assez simple, et un temps d’édition et de tournage restreint. Ce clip serait déjà pas mal, mais…

7,500$

Les choses sérieuses commencent ! Nous pourrions concrétiser les idées les plus folles et les plus créatives que nous avons pour ce clip Vimeo ! Si nous atteignons cette somme, nous serons capables d’améliorer la qualité de la production en y ajoutant des effets spéciaux, en tournant à différents endroits et en passant plus de temps en postproduction.

10,000$

Nous pourrions vous faire profiter de notre clip, vous qui avez soutenu ce projet unique depuis le début. Quand nous atteindrons cette somme, nous organiserons des avant-premières à Montréal et à Toronto et tous ceux qui nous ont soutenus recevront une invitation VIP ! Atteindre cet objectif nous permettra d’aller au-delà du marché habituel de la musique classique (3%) pour toucher le reste du monde (97%) !

Chaque sou collecté ira directement à la production et à la diffusion de la vidéo.

BUDGET

BUDGET MINIMUM : 5,000$
- Vidéographie – trois jours de tournage de 700$ par jour ; trois jours de montage de 350$ par jour
- Musique – dix heures d’enregistrement et cinq heures de montage son de 50$ par heure
- Accessoires/plateau - 500$
- Lieu du tournage - 500$

BUDGET : 7,500$
+ effets spéciaux
+ maquillage et costume
+ lieux de tournage
+ davantage de temps pour le scénario, le tournage et la post-production

BUDGET ÉLARGI : 10,000$
+ avant-premières à Montréal et Toronto
+ commercialisation du clip par un spécialiste en communication web
+ distribution du clip aux chaînes internet
+ distribution du clip aux chaînes de télévision

D’AUTRES FAÇONS DE NOUS AIDER

Diffusez notre lien indiegogo autant que possible. Postez-le sur Facebook, envoyez-le à vos amis, tweetez-le. Participez à cette aventure : suivez nos progrès et impliquez vos amis et votre famille. Voici le lien à partager : http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/fung-chiu-duo

ET SURTOUT, sachez combien nous vous sommes reconnaissants pour votre soutien.

Si vous avez des questions ou des idées, contactez-nous à info@fungchiuduo.com

(English starts here and Select-A-Perk at the top right)

THE PROJECT

What you just watched above is a video of a classical music performance.  The Fung-Chiu Duo's project is to make a music-video in a pop culture sense.

We're big fans of pop music videos, having grown up with MTV and MuchMusic, and it got us to thinking... why not do a Music-Vimeo of our own?

If Danny MacAskill can come out of nowhere and make a world-leading music-video for mountain-biking, and Seb Toots can do the same for snowboarding; like Gotye has done for pop duos, then Fung-Chiu has the opportunity to do the same for classical duos!

The Fung-Chiu Duo is hard at work on our first Music-Vimeo!  Fung-Chiu is partnering with an incredible videographer, Alexandra Oakley, who has just returned from videography-ing a tour-du-monde, and an amazing recording engineer, Philip Gosselin, to bring duo classical music to the Vimeo generation.

The Fung-Chiu Duo has performed ~100 concerts including Montréal, Toronto, Vancouver, Québec, and Halifax, from major concert halls to elementary school gymnasiums, and from churches to a casino. This Music-Vimeo will introduce new world audiences to our distinctive duo-izations.

To make Music-Vimeo history, we need your help!

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Until now, we have funded our projects privately and through concert tours, but this time we need you to join the Fung-Chiu team.  Here's how we plan to proceed:

$5,000

We've set a minimum budget of $5,000 to record, edit, and produce our Music Vimeo.  We *could* afford to do it at this price point, with a simpler storyline, minimal editing and shooting time.  This music video would be good, but...  

$7,500

Now we're cooking!  We can really dig into the more creative and crazy ideas that we have for this Vimeo!  If we hit this target, we'll be able to up the production values with special effects, multiple locations, and more time in post-production for a pretty sweet production.

$10,000

This gives us the opportunity to bring the video back to you, the folks who have supported this special project from the beginning. When we reach this target, we will have premiere events in Montreal and Toronto, and everyone who has supported us will receive a VIP invite! Reaching this goal will allow us to reach beyond just the usual classical music market (3%) and reach the rest of the world (97%)!

Every single cent raised will go directly into the production and marketing of this video.

(Go Select-A-Perk at the top right!)

BUDGET

MINIMUM BUDGET: $5,000
- Videography - three days of filming at $700/day; three days of editing at $350/day
- Audiography - ten hours of recording and five hours of editing at $50/hour
- Props/Set - $500
- Location - $500

BUDGET: $7,500
+ special video effects
+ make-up and costume
+ diverse locations
+ additional time for story-boarding, filming and post-production

STRETCH BUDGET: $10,000
+ marketing of music-video by web marketing specialist
+ distribution of Music-Video to web stations
+ distribution of Music-Video to TV stations
+ premiere events in Montreal and Toronto

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Spread our indiegogo link far and wide.  Facebook it, email it to friends, tweet it. Become part of the story: check on our progress and get your friends and family in on the story too. Here is the link to spread http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/fung-chiu-duo  

AND MOST IMPORTANTLY, please know how much we appreciate and thank you for your support.

Any questions or ideas -- email Janelle and Phil at info@fungchiuduo.com

story:
The Story of the Story:

The Sweethearts of Swing, a Play with Music:

In 1943 Mississippi, a young trumpeter has the chance to fulfill her dream of playing with the hottest all-girl swing band in the country. There's just one catch: she's white, it's a "colored" band, and this is the Jim Crow South. 

In 2013 New York, playwright Natalie Wilson and composer/arranger Kat Sherrell have the chance to bring this powerful story to a wider audience. We now need to make a demo of the original music to submit to interested theater companies and producers. 

"What's the next step?"

After a tremendously successful staged reading in NYC on July 16, the likely next step for SWEETHEARTS is an out-of-town tryout or workshop with full-size band, for which we need to be able to submit a demo CD along with the script. We've worked out the following budget to produce a studio recording of 6 numbers from the SWEETHEARTS score: 

Studio Space, Engineering, Mixing/Mastering Fees

 $1750
Orchestrator and Music Director Fees $1000
Instrumentalists and Vocalist Fees  $4750
Administrative Fees and Supplies $450

If we don't reach our goal, the funds will still be used toward a making a demo on a smaller scale (which limits the places that will consider the submission). 

The Impact

Although The Sweethearts of Swing is set 70 years ago, it touches on issues that are highly relevant today. 

While dealing with the most sinister sides of fear and bigotry, SWEETHEARTS tells the story of friendships fostered by a common love of swing music, and ultimately carries with it the message that there is strength in diversity and hope for a better future. We firmly believe that this play, inspired by a little-known piece of American history, deserves to be seen and heard by a wider audience.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a position to contribute financially right now, you can still help us by:

liking our facebook page, 

sharing this fundraising campaign and our website with your friends!

story:
Why Support Sacred Music

The Church Music Association of America is the main organization for the support of sacred music in the USA and the English speaking world.

We've posted 100 book of chant in a time when they are inaccessible. We've made countless videos. We are running the main training programs.
 
Your support will help us fun the scanning of 100 years of absolutely crucial documents that libraries are throwing away, to fund scholarships to the colloquium, to make new web applications, and expand our reach.
 
This organization has done so much with so little and yet we are being called to do more -- all in the interest of providing the crucial infrastructure to support the continuation of the tradition of Gregorian chant and sacred music.
 
Your support helps us make progress in the fields of web development, teaching, and publishing.

story:
Opera Experience Southeast Mission Statement

John Fowler and Marie-Claire O’Reirdan created Opera Experience Southeast, a 501(c) (3) non-profit organization, from a profound desire to nurture and promote emerging American-educated operatic talent. Over past decades, artistst had more opportunities than they do today to hone key components of the production and performance process. All too often aspiring young professionals hear the comment, “We love what you do, come back when you have more experience". Opera Experience Southeast was founded to address that need.

 Support Our Growth

As you can see we have an exciting mission and a real opportunity to grow by leaps and bounds! Our May 2012 and January 2013 Festivals were a resounding success and the extraordinary level of talent at our recent NYC auditions was truly inspiring. Many OES artists from our 2012 and 2013 programs gained the professional experience that helped boost them to major venues including San Francisco Opera, Santa Fe Opera, and St Louis Opera. We look forward to hearing big news as these young singers rocket into full careers! We’re working hard to pursue grants and corporate funding, however, we have some pressing needs.

Funding Goals

- Create an amazing website that reflects the high standards and talents of our artists.

- Purchase lighting equipment and a supertitle system to further enhance audience
  experience.      

- Cover accommodation costs for our artists and transport our sets.

- Fund design and printing costs for brochures, programs, and other promotional materials.

Your contributions ensure you are a vital part of Opera Experience Southeast. Your support becomes part of the Experience the operatic talent of tomorrow truly needs!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can make a financial contribution. Please consider sharing this campaign with your Face Book friends, your email contacts, your friends, family and co-workers too!

Please make use of the Indiegogo Share tools.

.

story:
"It will probably take time and receptive major record distributors to give this experienced songbird an opportunity to find an audience beyond her regional territory.  Yet Bell's talent is more than worthy of joining the small list of Houston's national hitmakers.  She is an artist who deserves to be heard." - Peggy Oliver - Soultracks

About Me
Peace Everyone!
My name is Caretta Bell and I am an independent artist. Here's a little bit about me for those of you who don't know :-)

 I was born and raised in the small town of Hawkins,TX and have been singing since the age of 3. After years of nurturing my gift there, I moved to Houston, TX where I've been blessed to perform here, all over the U.S., and abroad.

I've been a Houston Press Awards Nominee 7 times. Over the years, I've been blessed to share the stage and work with some of Billboard’s #1 Chart Artists such as Ledisi, Bilal, Mos Def, Noel Gourdin, Anthony David, Bell Biv Devoe, Keith Sweat, Amber Bullock,  Stokely, Tom Browne, and Ollie Woodson to name a few. 
I'm not just a singer, but also a songwriter.  I penned the majority of my debut album, Love’s Eye View (July-2008) myself. The album was written as a personal exploration of all facets of love.

I also wrote and arranged my latest song "Growing Painz" which you can view above in the YouTube video.  “Growing Painz” was nominated for Best Music Video for 2012 Houston Press Music Awards, and it will also be apart of my upcoming EP.

Why This Is So Important To Me
I love to sing and truly believe this is my purpose. I am an unsigned independent artist and full time musician. With your help I will finally be able to release my new music.  I have some really cool incentives that I hope you will enjoy.  It's just a small way for me to say how much it means to me that you believe in my dream, and support it! 

Although many artists from mega-stars to independent artists like myself are doing it, it's been really hard to start this crowd funding project.  I was painfully aware that it seemed like I would be asking for a handout. I am a firm believer in hard work and I have the attitude that if you can do it yourself, then do it!  I created my website myself, I am a bandleader, I book my own shows, I write my songs, arrange my songs, and have already covered the majority of the recording costs myself.

 Everyone who has supported me in the past and now, owe me nothing, and I know that.  However I was reminded recently that "closed mouths don't get fed" and people won't know there's a need if you don't ask.  So, I'm asking that if you are able, please give.  No donation is too small or large :-) Also, if you are not able to give, please join me in spreading the word about this project and help me reach my goal.    Your contributions will help with the costs of mixing, mastering, CD printing, promotions, and touring costs. 

Thank you for time, support, and helping me make some noise about my campaign.

Much luv,
Caretta Bell :-)
story_txt:
"It will probably take time and receptive major record distributors to give this experienced songbird an opportunity to find an audience beyond her regional territory.  Yet Bell's talent is more than worthy of joining the small list of Houston's national hitmakers.  She is an artist who deserves to be heard." - Peggy Oliver - Soultracks


About Me
Peace Everyone!

My name is Caretta Bell and I am an independent artist. Here's a little bit about me for those of you who don't know :-)


 I was born and raised in the small town of Hawkins,TX and have been singing since the age of 3. After years of nurturing my gift there, I moved to Houston, TX where I've been blessed to perform here, all over the U.S., and abroad.I've been a Houston Press Awards Nominee 7 times. Over the years, I've been blessed to share the stage and work with some of Billboard’s #1 Chart Artists such as Ledisi, Bilal, Mos Def, Noel Gourdin, Anthony David, Bell Biv Devoe, Keith Sweat, Amber Bullock,  Stokely, Tom Browne, and Ollie Woodson to name a few. 
I'm not just a singer, but also a songwriter.  I penned the majority of my debut album, Love’s Eye View (July-2008) myself. The album was written as a personal exploration of all facets of love.I also wrote and arranged my latest song "Growing Painz" which you can view above in the YouTube video.  “Growing Painz” was nominated for Best Music Video for 2012 Houston Press Music Awards, and it will also be apart of my upcoming EP.

Why This Is So Important To Me
I love to sing and truly believe this is my purpose. I am an unsigned independent artist and full time musician. With your help I will finally be able to release my new music.  I have some really cool incentives that I hope you will enjoy.  It's just a small way for me to say how much it means to me that you believe in my dream, and support it! 

Although many artists from mega-stars to independent artists like myself are doing it, it's been really hard to start this crowd funding project.  I was painfully aware that it seemed like I would be asking for a handout. I am a firm believer in hard work and I have the attitude that if you can do it yourself, then do it!  I created my website myself, I am a bandleader, I book my own shows, I write my songs, arrange my songs, and have already covered the majority of the recording costs myself.

 Everyone who has supported me in the past and now, owe me nothing, and I know that.  However I was reminded recently that "closed mouths don't get fed" and people won't know there's a need if you don't ask.  So, I'm asking that if you are able, please give.  No donation is too small or large :-) Also, if you are not able to give, please join me in spreading the word about this project and help me reach my goal.    Your contributions will help with the costs of mixing, mastering, CD printing, promotions, and touring costs. 


Thank you for time, support, and helping me make some noise about my campaign.

Much luv,Caretta Bell :-)

story:
The story of PowerLand

Imagine a world where the diamond is not only a natural resource but also a source of scientific experimentation that improves the lives of everyone. Now imagine that resouce sought after by a tyrant who limits its advanced technological usage to those who serve him.

The dream, however, began before greed took control... 

There exist those who will fight and even die to keep the diamond free and its many usages available for everyone. One of those such people is Celes Angelwood-Rey.

Celes was a little girl when her home city of Bermu was destroyed by the misuse of the diamond. Years later, Celes learns the way of the ninja to become the vigilante known as the Flare. On her journey, Celes finds others to help her cause and together they liberate their world from a ruthless tyrant known to many as the Popcorn Master.


We would love to have you on board to make this dream a reality! 

Backers will get a PowerLand item of their chosing based on how much they donate.


I'm working with a producer and a few singers to get the album done

So far, only 4/10 songs are done and each track costs money to produce. I've estimated the remainder cost of the album and reached a total of $1000. That number is the cost for the instrumentals, vocals, mixing and mastering of each song.


There's always the possibility of overacheiving the target amount

I've seen this happen so much to campaigns on this site and I just wonder how that even happens. There might be a chance that it could happen to this one. If it does, the money will be used to fund the manga and music video series following the album. But that's not all! Marketting is the key to get this product out there!


About Me


Over the past several years, I have grown an audience of over half a million with my videos. To expand on my craft, I've decided to start on a concept album with the story of PowerLand, based on a comic I wrote a little over 20 years ago. It tells the journey of Celes Angelwood-Rey, a young orphan who learns the way of a ninja and becomes the vigilante known as the Flare. On her path she meets others who have suffered under the corrupt rulership of a tyrant known as "The Popcorn Master". Together they rid PowerLand of his corruption and rebuild their world from the ashes.


Biographies 


1. Celes Angelwood-Rey


The main character of the PowerLand Series. The Flare, as what the inhabitants of PowerLand know her as, continually liberates lesser nations under the oppression of the Diamond Rey Empire. Some see her survival as "extraordinary" as the Popcorn Master has tried his best to exterminate his relatives, big and small, as he feels that they are a threat to his reign. Yet two of them always seem to escape certain doom; His ex-wife Quantona James, mayor of a futuristic city bearing her name, and his neice, the short-tempered vigilante who has in more cases than one hampered his plans for world domination. Celes is a courier by trade but trains under Quantona's guidance to help her fight for justice.

2. Det. Othniel Goodman


No one knows exactly where he came from except his wife and fellow temporal agent Zahra. The two of them came to PowerLand in search of their daughter, whom they nicknamed Crystal, after she was abducted by their archnemesis, Dr. James Lunningham several years ago. After settling down in a place known to some as Acid Town, Othniel and Zahra found themselves fighting one of the Popcorn Master's generals, Dr. Michaels, and his monstrous creations that terrorize the inhabitants. 2kReturner and the Forest Flower, codenames the two were known by, have become Acid Town's self-appointed sheriff (Zahra) and deputy (Othniel) for their heroic deeds.


3. Lina Anomaly

Artwork by Neeja


Legends say that Lina walks like a god among the inhabitants of PowerLand, with superhuman abilities that strike fear in the hearts of anyone she encounters. There are many shrines dedicated to her all over PowerLand but her true followers believe Lina would never sanction such a thing, denying her existence as divine. Though her origins are unknown, Lina's age long mission involves hunting down her evil twin known as the Nightmare. It is said the Nightmare was the instigator behind Bermu's fall.


4. Mackie Nexus


Centuries before Bermu existed, a war was fought between two races that were once allies. The Anomaly and the Nexus were two races that once lived in peace until Don Anomaly's greed drove the Nexus into hiding. He accused them of "overstepping their boundaries", and thus turned their most trusted of friends into the most hated of all PowerLand. Out of this war rose a champion, Mackie Nexus, a being much like Lina who fought to protect her kind from the treacherous Anomaly. Yet her fate was during the battle against Zeno, one of the Nightmare's generals. Zeno sealed Mackie in a pillar of crystalline rock. Upon her release, almost two milieniums passed. The world was drastically different from the primitive culture she once knew. One thing was for certain, though... Mackie knew that the Nightmare fully controlled PowerLand. It was her plan from the very beginning.


Music Samples 


1. Dimensional Rift (PowerLand Theme)


Lyrics: JGTraveler
Vocals: Erin Roth
Music: Paul P. Magnusson
-------

Words:

(Chorus)
In saeculo ignis
Investigatio sine fini venit
In nocte obscūris
Acquirere potentiam ultimam

(Bridge)
Orit (Orit) x4

(Chorus)

(Bridge)

(Bridge 2)
Deficit Nunquam x5

(Bridge) x2

(Ending)
Nunquam

Translation:

In the Age of the Burn
A never ending quest
In the darkest of night
To acquire a final power

Arising (Arising)
It never fails
Never

story:
First time ever crowd funding campaign for a music video with a social message, that celebrates the diva image of women as mothers.

Together we can deliver this much overdue ode to motherhood. Many films and music video projects (singles) have raised more than their target (Example: Player Piano raised $71,255 - 116% over target). We think this music video is important to make, we hope you do too. 

The Goal

This music video captures the moment in time when women (mothers) who multi-task and give a lot of themselves to the family, sometimes realize they must store a slice of life for themselves. The "Diva Motherhood" music video, is only 6 mins, but the script is packed with fun stories of women who do just that. Unveil the "diva" that lies beneath. They are able to retain their identity by unleashing the qualities that they have within (singers, dancers, athletes, social workers etc)  and it really does enable them to do their job as mothers better. Its a very simple story but has a broad impact.

We thought – let’s change what “Diva” stands for. We want to change the conversation to middle-aged and middle-class mothers, who are invisible to the world at large, but are divas, in their own right!

Director's statement:

My effort is to create a music video that goes viral and gets picked up at festivals, so that every mom on the planet with access to the Internet can watch this video, enjoy the music, and associate with it in some way. That will be the biggest reward - To give the mothers out there a few minutes of glory and fun because it’s their story!

Please help us weave this together and produce a fascinating video.

How do we plan to accomplish this?

We plan to accomplish this with getting you involved! We have some awesome perks - do check them out!

We want to create a peppy, energetic music video with the “mainstream women”, at its center, showcasing their inner “diva”. By focusing on these real women and not models, we create a healthy respect and recognition of how they conquer their everyday challenges.

The music is in Hindi and English.

What Started It All?

While watching a film festival on television, back in 2013, Archita Mandal (director) was struck by how much coverage was given to actresses who just delivered babies and sprung back to normal life. While the press was making hay with this, it got her thinking about the millions of mothers who do this outside of the spotlight. She wanted to shine a light on those mothers!

Many such women, who are just as fabulous, with young kids, work, climb the corporate ladder, or sacrifice a career to raise a family. They do this while juggling an assortment of day-to-day challenges and without the resources that many celebrities have access to.

What’s the big deal? You might ask. The big deal is these women can swim with the sharks and do it in style. These women have beauty with brains and have managed to stay in touch with their inherent talents despite the cacophony that surrounds their lives. They are ace dancers, singers, athletes, artists and often bring these talents to life for social causes. These women are brilliant but their stories are untold. They are also older than the current perception of “desirable” and “attractive”. 

The "Diva Motherhood" team felt compelled to tell a story that needs to be told and pull back the curtain on a wonderful play for you to behold.

Check out more about this project on our Facebook page

https://www.facebook.com/divamotherhood

Also, subscribe to our Twitter handle

https://twitter.com/DivaMotherhood

TEAM:

 Director and Producer - Archita Mandal Fallini

 

Archita was born in Calcutta, India, grew up in Kuwait, and later moved to Canada and the US, for higher studies. A techie but artist at heart, she currently lives in the bay area. Film gives her a powerful platform upon which to exercise her talents in storytelling and visual arts. She has worked on several short films in different capacities, from script writer, art director, set design, choreography, and most recently director. Archita’s directorial debut, Untread, is a science fiction thriller set in the near future and is being screened at the upcoming Women’s International Film & Arts Festival, 2015. This music video featuring an original score, is a big production. She identifies with message of this video, as she herself is a mother to an eight year old.

Line Producer - Giju John

A multifaceted personality and a highly accomplished singer, producer, composer and choreographer, Giju John is very well known in the Film producers circle of the Bay Area.  In 2010, Giju  successfully produced  "Love, Wrinkle-free", a slice of life romantic comedy set in the backdrops of Goa partnering with writer director Sandeep Mohan. In 2014, he produced his second movie- "Hola Venky!". A former world-ranked salsa dancer and choreographer, Giju launched the first ever cross-over music album (in 2007) fusing rich elements of Indian and Latin music. 

He was very inspired by our theme on Motherhood and decided to be a part of our team. We are fortunate to have him as our Line Producer & consider him to be a huge asset owing to his vast experience and knowledge.

Music Composer - Farhan Mohamed

Music composer Farhan Mohamed, who holds a degree in audio engineering, music production and computer music, works at Plantronics. Prior to this, he worked as a music engineer at Muse Research for 9 years where he provided custom programming and technical support for award winning touring acts such as Alicia Keys, U2's Vertigo tour, Roger Waters 2010 Wall tour, Genesis, David Gilmour, Michael Jackson's O2 tour, Coldplay, and Billy Joel, just to name a few. He has also had the great fortune of working with ace music composer A.R.Rehman and James Newton Howard. Farhan is currently composing music for an upcoming Indian movie along with a series of animation projects. He actively plays and records with the surf band, the Aquamarines, Utopian Trap, and the Bollywood fusion band, VDAZE.

The Diva Motherhood team is truly thrilled to have such an accomplished Music Composer on our team.

Director of Photography - Unnikrishnan Reveendranathan

Unni is an award winning photographer and multi media artist who is currently based in San Francisco. Unni has worked as a photographer for Lonely Planet magazine & has also had the wonderful opportunity to work with the  world renowned documentary photographer Colin Finaly on several different projects. In 2012, Unni won the editorial photography educational award and attended the Eddie Adams workshop, won the AARP assignment and has worked with them.  He has several assignments under his belt including Appro, Be4Media, The Astrologer Inc. etc, just to name a few. Unni has worked on many short films and this would be his second project with Archita, the first being Untread.

We are very thrilled to have him on our team, yet again, as our Director of Photography.

Some things to note:

  • The expenses are broken down in the pie-chart below
  • This project is part production, part donation  
                How will funds be used? 

 


  • ASSET - Stands for Achieving Sustainable Social Equality through Technology, strives to educate and provide better opportunities for the children of sex workers.

        

  Why choose ASSET?

  • As a large group of women associated with this project have been privileged to come from technical backgrounds, including the director, we felt the need to collaborate with an organization that reaches out and helps underprivileged children gain "basic information technology skills and secure employment opportunities" (as defined by ASSET). 

  • This contribution serves two purposes. One, is that this gesture represents the aura of motherhood. We care for other women and kids and if this is a small way we can participate, we will. Second, we stand for everything that ASSET has set out to achieve and is doing it so wonderfully. We want to help raise awareness and make a social impact with the making of this music video.

  Who is in the cast?
  • Auditions were conducted to select cast members for this video. Check out footage of this process & outcomes in the “GALLERY” section above
  • More information on the process will be updated regularly, so bookmark us!!!!

 

Timeline of the Music Video

We plan to shoot in summer of 2015 over the course of 7-8 days in various locations in the Bay Area. We anticipate to wrap up post-production by the end of the year.

Other Ways You can Help

Please help us spread the word on our music video! Feel free to share this link by email or on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and any other form of social media you use. We appreciate it greatly!

 
PERKS THAT YOU CAN PICK ARE LISTED BELOW !!!!!


Join us in this exciting, fun, musical adventure !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

More information on the process will be updated regularly, so bookmark us!!!!

 
Timeline of the Music Video
We plan to shoot in summer of 2015 over the course of 7-8 days in various locations in the Bay Area. We anticipate to wrap up post-production by the end of the year.
Other Ways You can Help
Please help us spread the word on our music video! Feel free to share this link by email or on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and any other form of social media you use. We appreciate it greatly! 
PERKS THAT YOU CAN PICK ARE LISTED BELOW !!!!!































Join us in this exciting, fun, musical adventure !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

story:
It has been a dream of mine ever since I was a teenager to start my own All Ages music venue. I went to my first All Ages punk show back when I was 14 years old and, not only did that experience make me want to become a musician, but it changed my entire view of a sense of community. For the first time, I felt surrounded by like-minded individuals and I felt as though I was a part of something bigger than myself. At this point and time, my best friend and I have decided to open our own All Ages music venue and give back that sense of unity and togetherness that our old music scenes help create for us. Currently, there isn't a place like this in our city of Knoxville, TN and, with your help, we fully intend on creating one. Don't worry grown-ups, we will have events for you as well. We have currently signed a lease on, what we feel, is the perfect building for us to start this venue. We move in at the start of March and will begin to prepare for our grand opening. We have several renovations that have to be dealt with before we can open. This is where you all come in. We are asking for a donation $1000 to help us build several sectional walls, make improvements to our sound system, and general design work to the interior of the building to ensure you the best and intimate live music experience possible. Even the smallest donation of $1 is incredibly helpful. We would truly appreciate any help possible in assisting us with achieving our dream of keeping Knoxville's All Ages music scene alive and well. Please feel free to share this campaign with your friends and family.

Thank you,

Jake Jones and The Floor

story:
Un premier album 

Parle-moi de t'ça !

Chères chairs,
Suite à un premier enregistrement complètement fait «chalet» avec d'humbles moyens et prétentions, nous nous sommes promis que le prochain serait à la hauteur des hautes et saintes exigences sonores des temps modernes.

On a donc paqueté nos chaudières métalliques, nos morceaux d'acajou, crins de cheval et pièces d'orfèvrerie italienne et, histoire de commencer l'année du bon pied, on est partis la première semaine de 2015 au Grand Lodge No. 24, ancienne église de Farnham rénovée en studio par Arcade Fire ! Avec 6 pièces en poche mais une couple d'autres dans nos têtes, et surtout après un travail méticuleux avec Jean-Bruno Pinard, notre réalisateur de feu, on a fini par accoucher d'un album complet qui va assurément vous surprendre et bercer vos après-midi d'été, votre jogging, vos partys de famille,  vos feux de camp et vos chaises musicales pour les jours à venir (on le souhaite, on l'espère, on l'anticipe !).
Un premier album est une étape super importante pour un jeune groupe, et vous pouvez nous aider à réaliser le grand saut ! Ce sera une carte de visite qui nous permettra de partager notre passion un peu partout dans les festivals, les divers événements estivaux et les petites et grandes salles du Québec et d'ailleurs...
Tout ça pour dire qu'il ne nous manque un pas pire coup de main pour pouvoir le sortir dans les règles de l'art, et, comme Jésus dans le désert, on s'est donné 40 jours pour sortir de l'impasse.

Ok, alors ?

Après avoir réinvesti la totalité des bénéfices des shows de 2014 dans l'enregistrement, il nous manque encore des fonds pour les dernières étapes du processus. En bref, il nous faut :

  • 1000$ pour le mixage ;
  • 700$ pour le matriçage (mastering) ;
  • 1500$ pour la duplication d'au moins 300 copies physiques ;
  • 500$ pour le graphisme et l'infographie de l'album (parce que sous-payer nos amis, on aime pas ça!) ;
Ainsi que :
  • 600$ pour de nouveaux produits dérivés entourant la sortie de l'album ;
  • 700$ pour payer les dépenses relatives à la tournée inter-provinciale prévue à l'été 2015 (Québec et Nouveau-Brunswick) ;
De votre côté, vous avez l'occasion de pouvoir acheter l'album en pré-vente, de recevoir des cadeaux exclusifs et en même temps, d'encourager directement un groupe qui ne tient qu'à vous apporter une vraie bonne dose de bonheur !!!

S'il y en a, les fonds additionnels serviront uniquement aux dépenses reliées au lancement de l'album et à la tournée estivale qui suivra. Notre vieille van aurait besoin d'amour elle aussi, et on aimerait pouvoir se rendre partout où notre musique nous mènera !

Ouais mais... ?

5000$ peut sembler beaucoup de bidous, mais pour un groupe totalement indépendant et en début de parcours comme nous, on fait avec nos modestes moyens de cochon tirelire. La crédit, on tient ça loin : le moins de dettes possible est toujours le mieux. Vos contributions seront immédiatement investies dans le projet, jusqu'à la dernière petite cenne, pour nous aider à avancer, à rayonner et à produire de la musique de qualité.

D'autres façons d'aider

L'important pour nous, actuellement, c'est de faire connaître le projet et de s'assurer que chaque personne qui voudrait mettre la main sur l'album ait la possibilité de le faire. Par la suite, nous voulons faire en sorte que l'album soit connu et entendu à sa juste valeur (on n'est pas peu fier du résultat!).

Alors si vous ne pouvez pas ou préférez ne pas vous engager financièrement, il y a certainement d'autres façons de nous encourager là-dedans. En vous abonnant à notre page Facebook, en partageant cette page avec vos amis mélomanes, en fredonnant notre musique dans vos veillées et même en allant encourager les autres groupes indépendants de votre ville, de votre province et de votre pays, ça fait parler. Le bouche à oreille, c'est ça le truc ! 


MERCI !
MILLE MERCIS, ENCORE.
Le Winston Band

story:
Pittsburgh is famous for its great sounds of Jazz.  It has more Jazz legends per capita than anywhere in the world. Throughout the 20th Century and beyond, the music of Pittsburgh artists has permeated hearts and homes of music lovers. Musicians who have lived in or made Pittsburgh their home have included: Billy Eckstine, Billy Strayhorn, Mary Lou Williams, Lena Horne, George Benson, Stanley Turrentine, Phyllis Hyman & Dakota Staton, Earl “Fatha” Hines, and Ahmad Jamal. These are just a few of the many household names of jazz musicians that have been associated with the city of Pittsburgh.

The Pittsburgh’s Next Generation of Music Legends (PNGML) is a non-profit organization whose mission is to educate, preserve, collect and celebrate, the great musical legacy of Pittsburgh’s African-American musicians.  The estates of the Mary Lou Williams and George Benson have granted (PNGML) permission to create wax figures of them.

Working with educational consultants and national wax figure designers, this exhibition will include approximately 10 life-like wax replicas.  We have chosen several national renowned wax figure designers whose past clients have included, President Lyndon Johnson's Library & Museum, National Great Blacks in Wax Museum, and ESPN Sport Century Tour.  George Benson will be an extraordinary animatronics figure including: motion, recorded speech, music, facial hair and other realistic features.

In addition to the wax likeness, the exhibition will include touch screen kiosks to educate visitors about the life and music of each artist represented using photographs, videos, short biographical sketches. Leading jazz scholars are at work creating the content of the touch screen kiosks.

The exhibit will be made available to schools, cultural centers, museums, libraries, entertainment venues, etc.  Life-like sculptures humanize these music giants and endear them even more to new audiences. 

More than pleasant nostalgia, this exhibit is historically accurate.  We will include the history of exploitation, segregation, and racism's impact on the marketing (or failure to market) Black musical genius. 

Your support helps us complete Phase One of this project.  Choose from the unique perks listed on the right.  Any or all amounts are welcome.  Remember to share this link on Facebook, Twitter and Google+.  Thank you!

Campaign Team

Donald Patterson

Sean Jones, Department Head, Brass department, Berklee College Of Music and Jazz Musician

Ed Gainey, the Honorable Pa State Legislative, 24th District

story:
Who We Are

Hey y'all! We're Cold Roses, an original rock & blues band from Philadelphia, PA. Thanks for checking out our Indie Gogo page! We've had an amazing and intense year traveling all over the east coast, meeting fantastic new people and bands, getting the opportunity to play bigger and better venues, and building an incredible following of some of the best fans in the whole wide world! We've even added a horn section to the band! Now we're ready to get back in the studio to give you the record you've been waiting for...but we need your help!

We're asking you to join and support Cold Roses as we record, mix, and master our first full-length record with our new lineup! What's more, we also want to give something back to the community. So from any funds raised beyond our goal, Cold Roses will be donating to an organization we deeply believe in, the Pennsylvania SPCA.

This record means everything to us. Since the band started a few years ago, we've had some great successes, and a few setbacks, but we've enjoyed every minute of it. 


What We Need & What You Get

When you fund this Cold Roses record, know that your donation is going directly to:

  • Tracking the album at Miner Street Recordings
  • Mixing the record
  • Mastering costs

And in return for your support, we're giving you some pretty cool new Cold Roses merch and unique Cold Roses experiences like:

  • A Private Party hosted by us.
  • A personal song written and recorded just for you
  • Custom Cold Roses electric guitars!
  • New Cold Roses pint glasses
  • Signed drum heads
  • Limited edition T-shirts and posters
  • And even a home cooked meal, courtesy of Cold Roses


What This Means to Us

Since starting the band, we've had the humbling support of our friends, family, the Philly music community, strangers (turned friends) in states all across the country, and of course our fans. We don't know how to thank you all enough for everything you've done for us. We hope that making this record and supporting the PSPCA are just some ways for us to say "Thank You."  To anyone who has believed in us, listened to us, come out to a show, bought a t-shirt, or just said "hey guys, you killed it!"...you've made all of this possible!

We've had some great things come our way this year, from being WMMR's Artist of the Month to headlining some of the tri-state area's biggest venues like the TLA in Philly and The Bitter End in NYC...and we know this record is going to be the culmination of everything we've worked so hard for; just to bring our music to your eardrums.

From everyone in Cold Roses, we thank you in advance for your support!


Can't Donate But Still Want to Help?

If you just can't contribute, that's cool. There are still plenty of ways to help out:

  • Spread the word and share our link with Indiegogo's sharing tools to all of your friends! The more people you tell the bigger this whole thing gets...so let's make some noise!!!
  • Come out to a show! We're playing all around the area almost every weekend. Supporting us in person is just as cool!
  • Follow us on Social Media
  • Or just continue being an awesome fan!

story:
Friends family and long time supporters Sol Tribe is raising funds online for the first time in our 2 years on the road.  Its been a long journey around the country playing over 150 shows in 25 states living in a van and off the kindness of so many of you who have helped us out along the way.  We've always found a way to make it work until recently when a series of mechanical falluires left our van in need of a new transmission and engine and us stranded in Florida unable to move forward.

Our great van the "Big Chief" has given us over 70,000 hard miles pulling a trailer up mountains, through the desert, the snow, and pouring rain and now that it is being given a second life we need your help to get back to Florida to retrieve it and carry forward through our final tour of 2014.  Dates are booked and being promoted, musicians are committed and ready we simply need more funding than what we have come up with within our camp.

Please help us reach our goal of $1500 and not only carry on through our fall tour but give us the means to travel and play in the future.

$50 + Donations will receive....

Guest list admission for you and a guest to a Sol Tribe performance show either on this tour or future with a CD or merch item at the show

$100 + Donations will receive....

The above thank you gift plus

We will carry a limited addition tour posters with  us through out the tour and to the best of our ability have them signed by as many bands that we perform with as possible including Sol Tribe tour members.  Mailed to your address within a month of tour completion.

$500 + Donations will recieve....

The above thank you gifts plus

A permanent mention in our special thanks section on all physical copies of our new E.P. recorded on the road by platinum recording engineer Steve Grimel scheduled for release in 2015 

Buy the farm!!! ($1500)

Receive all the above mentioned thank you gifts and a private performance for you and your friends anywhere in the US to be scheduled along our next tour route through your area!!

story:
Dear Friends,

In addition to "Dancing in the Light," there are now three new mixes. You can listen to each on on "The New Album" page of my blog, which you can get to by clicking here. The songs which have now been mixed are "Gentle Arms of Eden", written by Dave Carter, "Grampa's Song," one of mine, and "Hold the Light Up" by Meredith McLeod. Information about each song is posted underneath the song file.

Here is the link to the final mix of Dancing in the Light: Listen to "Dancing in the Light"

I am seeking to raise $3500 and beyond to help me manufacture my new album New & Used Tunes, Vol 2, Dancing in the Light. With your help, I'll be able to bring this project (8 years in the making) to the conclusion it deserves. It would be great to be able to upgrade some of my equipment, as well.

    You can go to my blog at The New Album and read through the full description of the project. The home page of the blog is here.

    The launch of this new album will mark a renewed effort to perform much more often and to write more songs. This music work has always been a sideline to other things in my life, but now I want to make being a singer-songwriter my full-time endeavor. 

      All the recording is done, all the editing is done, I just have the final mixes to do and the package to create.
