story:
About Me

  My name is Kira Plumer and I live in a small town called Yellow Springs, Ohio.  I am the third of four children and live in a house with two dogs and two cats.  I am a full time student and also work a job at a frozen custard and coffee shop.  I study commercial photography at Scripps College of Communications at Ohio University in Athens, Ohio.  

  Why did I choose commercial photography?  I have loved photography ever since I was a little child.  I recieved my first camera when I was eleven years old and have been taking photos ever since.  I also have been collecting vintage cameras from Polaroids to 35 millimeters.  I remember going into my living room when I was young and grabbing my favorite photography book:  Annie Leibovitz Photographs.  As I looked at her photography, I would think to myself, I am going to be like her some day.

What I Shoot

  What I love to shoot are portraits, self portraits, and still life.  I love being able to imagine what I want to take a photo of, set it up, shoot, and see my vision become  real.  I also love taking photos of people, because I enjoy working with them.  Working with people remains one of y strengths.  Whenever I work with someone  in my photo shoot, the experience is always different.  It is always artistically satisfying to work with someone and then watch their reactions to the finished photograph.  I love to see people's reactions to my work.  It's always thrilling.

About My Campaign

  I am trying to raise money for a Canon DLSR (Canon 5D Mark III) camera as required to finish my college education.  So far I have received a generous match for half the dollar amount from my aunt.  If I can raise the second half for this camera, it will  help me reach my goal to become a commercial photographer. 

Goal

  My  goal in this campaign is to reach $2500.  (Matched by my aunt, this brings the total to $5,000 for the camera and the required lens. )  Why $2500?  The required cameras that I need are extremely expensive.  The cameras I am required to have (by my program), range between $2500 and $4000.  Including lenses, the entire package is very expensive.  At school I am competing with many students who already have a camera and though I borrowed cameras from OU's photo checkout system, these cameras are only available for 24 hours at a time.  If I am able to reach $2500, that will be the first step to my dream.  But I need your help to reach it. 

Please look at some work that I have up on my Bluecanvas page! 

http://www.bluecanvas.com/thesweetside
story_txt:
About Me  My
name is Kira Plumer and I live in a small town called Yellow Springs, Ohio.  I am the third of four children and live
in a house with two dogs and two cats.  I am
a full time student and also work a job at a frozen custard and coffee shop.  I study commercial photography at Scripps
College of Communications at Ohio University in Athens, Ohio.    Why did I choose commercial photography?  I have loved photography ever since
I was a little child.  I recieved my first camera when I was eleven years old and have been taking photos ever since.  I also have been collecting vintage cameras from Polaroids to 35 millimeters.  I remember going
into my living room when I was young and grabbing my favorite photography book:  Annie Leibovitz Photographs.  As I looked at her photography, I would think
to myself, I am going to be like her some day.What I Shoot  What I love to shoot are portraits, self portraits, and still life.  I love being able to imagine what I want to take a photo of, set it up, shoot, and see my vision become  real.  I also love taking photos of people, because I enjoy working with them.  Working with people remains one of y strengths.  Whenever I work with someone  in my photo shoot, the experience is always different.  It is always artistically satisfying to work with someone and then watch their reactions to the finished photograph.  I love to see people's reactions to my work.  It's always thrilling.About My Campaign  I am trying to raise money for a Canon DLSR (Canon 5D Mark III) camera as required to finish my college

story:
Breve reseña

Hola a todos mi nombre es Raul Ortiz Guillin fundador y director de la Fundación Criar, nosotros somos un colectivo de profesionales que realizamos programas de rehabilitación integral a personas con problemas de alcohol y drogas; hace un par de semanas recibí dos jóvenes con dificultades con las drogas y el alcohol, la niña tiene apenas 14 años y desde los 11 años ha consumido bazuco, marihuana, pegante, pepas y alcohol, también se ha escapado de casa por estos inconvenientes, su señora madre cabeza de familia no tiene los recursos económicos para pagar el tratamiento, pese a su económica, nosotros la recibimos con mucho amor y en este momento adelanta su rehabilitación con éxito en nuestra fundación; así pasa con el joven de 22 años el cual tiene un consumo de drogas y alcohol pero de forma mas crónica, a el se le recibió ya que estaba en una institución de caridad pero allí le maltrataban física y patológicamente, razón por la cual los recibí; actualmente los dos están con nosotros por un periodo de 5 meses cada uno.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Rehabilitar esta niña y este joven tiene un costo económico de $18.000.000 millones donde se incluyen los servicios de alimentación, vivienda, terapias, exámenes, recreación, desintoxicación, deshabituacion, proyecto de vida, plan de inclusión socio familiar, servicios de psiquiatra, psicología y especialista en adicciones por un tiempo de 5 meses para cada. 

Queremos a través de esta campaña recaudar el 70% de los costos del tratamiento en lo posible, del resto nos encargaremos nosotros.

El impacto

La mejor manera de ayudar a los demás, es  con propuestas directas, es importante que sepan que estas dos personas que necesitan ayuda ya están con nosotros, no hay riesgo alguno de la campaña de ayuda, ya ellos están rebahilitandose y van bien, nuestro programa ofrece un porcentaje de recuperación del 86% de éxito ya que trabajamos bajo un modelo personalizado, en una bella institución dotada de todos los elementos para que los jóvenes estén cómodos y seguros mientras realizan su rehabilitación, visita nuestra pagina web para que conozcan lo que hacemos www.fundacioncriar.com


Entre todos podemos ayudar, colabora y difunde esta noble causa.

story:
SappyForever: Rescue Mission as Coffee Table Book

In early 2006 SappyFest was just an idea. 250 people showed up for that idea and those 250 people made SappyFest a reality. Now we are looking for 250 people to come together and support the idea of SappyFest again. This time by helping to create SappyForever, a unique and beautiful coffee table book of memories and dreams that came true.

In many ways SappyFest 8 was the best festival yet, but it was not a financial success. This was due in part to our aversion to corporate sponsorship and our commitment to our vision of a creative and inclusive space. Unfortunately we were about 100 people short of breaking even, we are $15,000 in debt. Our black dot is a reality but we have not given up hope.

We have a plan. It is called SappyForever. We are asking 250 people to buy a beautiful, hardcover archive of SappyFest for $100. We hope to raise $25,000 to pay off our debt from the great festival we just put on, with the additional $10,000 covering the production and publication of SappyForever. This 160 page collection will include photos, essays, memories and a visual history of the art and design that has come to define the best days of summer for us all. We will also be donating a copy to a library in every province and territory in Canada.

We are inviting each donor to contribute a photo of themselves or their friends at SappyFest to be included in a 'Presented by' section. This book is for all of us who were there, or wanted to be there and who believed Swamp Magic could happen.

This has been an incredibly difficult year for our organization. It may take time for SappyFest to rebuild, but we are committed to do so. This will also mark the last year that co-founders Paul Henderson and Jon Claytor will serve as artistic and creative directors. They will assist in the transition, passing on the torch to an amazing group of young people ready and willing to bring SappyFest into the future.

SappyFest has been a labour of love and a privilege for all who have been involved. So many of you have already given so much blood, sweat, tears and time to making the festival a success. The future is ambiguous and exciting and it depends on you.

Are there 250 people out there ready to support this beautiful idea, this indelible memory and this ambiguous future? We hope so. We have our hopes up. We believe and we hope you do too.

story:
Update 6/16/14

4:42 am

The Indiegogo campaign has officially ended, however If you missed the chance to be part of it, YOU CAN STILL HELP HERE (vis Square) or use HERE (via PayPal castrosmusic@yahoo.com ) - ALL PERKS ARE BACK!!!

We want to THANK absolutely everybody that donated and shared the page. We made it to 55% and that's huge for us, THANK YOU!!!

Links to the Campaign Part 2!: Square: http://mkt.com/the-castros-2 or PayPal: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xc... / castrosmusic@yahoo.com - Spread the word!



Who are we? What exactly are we doing?

We are Marco and Sara Castro. We make music together and we'd love to share with all of you what we've been up to for the past 3 years. In 2011 we released our first effort, "The Tiny Airplane EP", which was basically a humble demo but with lots and lots of heart. Although we've been "enhancing" it thorough the years by adding a couple of songs here and there, we feel the time has come for us to release a new album.

We are also embarking on a huge adventure throughout Europe this summer to perform the 25 day Songs & Whispers circuit based in Bremen, Germany and we are currently working on setting up a small European tour before and after (we still can't believe it!). We're beyond excited to make this new album and share it with all of you and our friends in Europe.

Our goal is to raise $5500 which will help us cover part of the costs of both projects.  We hope you can partner with us to raise the funds to help make them happen.


Of perks and tiers

We have a lot of perks to give back to you in exchange of your help!
For example, if you are able to donate $30, you will get a physical copy of our album + deluxe digital download before it's released as well as a full download of our first EP! If you are able to donate more, we have other perks for you including backers-only limited edition artwork, tee-shirts and more! Take a look to the right and see what you'd like as a thank you from us for your help.
We tried to create an easy-to-use structure so most gifts are bundled. If you'd like get just one of the perks without bundling please let us know and we'll work it out.

All the original artwork is made by Sara. For the perks that include an art print of your choice, please visit to the following links and find the name(s) of the piece(s) you want! Then just include it at the time you make your pledge.

http://cuteculture.wordpress.com   /Facebook.com/MadeWithLoveBySara  

If your generosity helps us reach our initial goal and we still have time left, we will add stretch targets. A stretch target is a milestone beyond our minimum goal which would unlock more perks and more possibilities. If we could raise $10,000 we could make something really incredible. It's up to you! :D

Cute Starry Night by Sara Castro

The "CD Release show" and the "Listening Party" admissions are included in all perks $40 and up! The dates are TBD but they will be in Columbus OH.

How you make a difference

With your help we will be able to create something really nice. Something that we - and you - can be proud of. The goal of our music is to express love and touch the hearts of those who hear it. We're so excited to have something professional to share with our you and to take it to other parts of the world. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your participation in this adventure. We couldn't do this without you guys.


Can't donate, but still want to help?

If you just simply cannot donate money but still want to help, you can! Help us make noise about our campaign. Share, Tweet, Instagram, Myspace and Facebook the beans out of it! (You could also have actual conversations with people :D) By getting the word out, you're helping a lot. And if you have a specific talent other than social networking (photography, merch production, ideas for other perks, etc.) that you know would help, get a hold of us and share the love. 


Share, share, share!

Additionally, Indiegogo has a referral program in which you get points every time you share this campaign and people click and donate! If you get the most points we'll get you bumped up to the next perk level. Meaning, if you donated $50 and have the most points from sharing, we'll bump you up to the $75 perk level and so on (Up to the $700 perk).
They make it easy with share tools that are simple to use on all of your social networking faves.

THANKS SO MUCH FOR YOUR HELP PALS!!!

story:
Hello there!

My name is Catlindt Landrum. Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign page! 

Every since I can remember music has always been a part of my life. My family is comprised of musicians and singers and all my life they have pushed me to strive for excellence in all that I do.

With that being said, it is time to record my very first solo record. I have been trying to get this project off of the ground for many years now. Being able to say I kept going and am proud to say I have a team to pull this project off in excellence. 

There's nothing more uplifting to me then to have support of my friends, family, loved one's and even strangers who just enjoy and support my music. All of my past hurts, frustrations, joy's, and experiences will put into this project. With your financial support and prayers the gift that God has given me will be shared with the world. Thank you so much for your help!





What We Need? $7,000.00

I have to use an exceptional team of trained and industry connected professionals.  I'll be using every dollar raised for:

  • Album Production: From studio recordings of the music to mixing and mastering my materials by industry-certified engineers.
  • Manufacturing: The pressing and packaging of physical CDs to be sold at concerts, online and brick and mortar retailers, and shipped internationally for sales and promotion.
  • Promotional Materials: Printed media, posters, photography, fliers, digital campaigns and advertising to herald my existence.
  • Videos: I'd like to hire quality filmmakers to create inspiring, relevant videos to extend my reach as an artist.

Why should you help?

My ultimate goal is for people to have a unforgettable musical experience after listening to my music. I am a firm believer that giving unlocks the door for things to happen in your own life. For 15 years, I have sown my time, talent and treasure to multiple people and causes. Never hoping to gain anything in return. My mom just taught me that it's nice to be nice! I truly believe that 2014 is my year to birth what's inside. With your support, my dream can (and will) become a reality!  

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that everyone may not have the ability to contribute financially. However, I decree and declare that this WILL BE the very last year that your situation will be like this. 

For those of you who can and will, please:  

  • Spread the word about my efforts and get other folks that you know excited about supporting my dream. 
  • There are also some amazing Indiegogo share tools that you can use on all of your social media outlets.
  • Cover my vision with prayer!

story:
What's Up?

Edmonton band The Wet Secrets have teamed up with the Chimo Youth Retreat Centre to establish a new initiative: The Chimo Arts & Music Programs & Studios (CH.A.M.P.S.) Fund. This fund will provide artistic mentorship and support for youth who would not otherwise have these opportunities. Money raised will be used to establish a bank of musical instruments and equipment that youth may borrow, to cover costs of music lessons, recording studio time, art supplies, workshops, and tickets to attend art and music events. Proceeds will also support the development of CH.A.M.P.S. Music Camps.

The Chimo Youth Retreat Centre was founded as a private, non-profit society in 1970 to reintegrate youth experiencing a range of challenges back into the community through a variety of supportive programs. It is their goal to provide an environment that fosters personal growth and are committed to ensuring quality services to every youth in their care. 

What We Need & What You Get

Help us reach our goal of $5000 to jump start CH.A.M.P.S. 

Donations at every level will make a difference. $5 buys a pack of guitar strings. $1000 buys an electronic drum kit for the musical instrument lending library. See the donation levels listed to the right. Along with our thanks, we'll send you advance digital downloads of new music, limited edition photo books and even a set of exclusive pillowcases!

    The Impact

    Lyle and Emma from The Wet Secrets have been volunteering at the Chimo music night for the past two years and have seen first-hand the magic that happens when you put musical instruments in kids' hands and encourage them to find their voices and express themselves. The CH.A.M.P.S. Fund will give these youth better resources, a lending bank of instruments, mentorship, recording time, and more.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Join The Wet Secrets at the CH.A.M.P.S. Fundraiser Party on Thursday, October 23! 

    WHERE:

    Latitude 53 (10242 - 106 St, Edmonton) 

    WHEN:

    6:30pm: Doors open, cocktails, art show by Alice Bos, silent auction opens (items include a guitar donated by Acoustic Music Shop and signed by Corb Lund.)

    8:00pm: Performance by The Wet Secrets

    10:00pm: Silent auction closes 

    Please help us to get the word out! Use the Indiegogo share tools above to help spread the news of this campaign.

    Thanks for your support!

  The Impact Lyle and Emma from The Wet Secrets have been volunteering at the Chimo music night for the past two years and have seen first-hand the magic that happens when you put musical instruments in kids' hands and encourage them to find their voices and express themselves. The CH.A.M.P.S. Fund will give these youth better resources, a lending bank of instruments, mentorship, recording time, and more.



Other Ways You Can Help Join The Wet Secrets at the CH.A.M.P.S. Fundraiser Party on Thursday, October 23! 
WHERE:
Latitude 53 (10242 - 106 St, Edmonton) 
WHEN:
6:30pm: Doors open, cocktails, art show by Alice Bos, silent auction opens (items include a guitar donated by Acoustic Music Shop and signed by Corb Lund.)
8:00pm: Performance by The Wet Secrets
10:00pm: Silent auction closes 
Please help us to get the word out! Use the Indiegogo share tools above to help spread the news of this campaign.
Thanks for your support!

story:
A Short Overview

Hi to all those who are reading this : ). This is now the second year of the Shuttle Shuffle Music and Arts Festival and after the first one going so well and with such great feedback, we are exited for this years!

Factory Street Studios is where the festival is held and where the Piece Project is also based. Along side these two organisations, we have The Yorkshire Gig Guide, Eclectic Rhythm and The Topic Folk Club all working together on a voluntary basis to not only support and promote grass roots music and artiest's in our local area, but to also do this to try an raise awareness and funds for the Peace Project. 

"The Piece Project is run by a committee made up of people with interests in music; DJ's, youth workers, mental health/disabilities professionals and representatives from community based grass roots organisations. All are interested in community development/regeneration"



This campaign is aimed at raising enough funds to implement the basic structure to the festival and provide the best possible experience to all those who attend.

We invite you to get in touch, get involved, get donating and help us produce a music and arts festival to be remembered!


What We Need & What You Get

OK, so overall we need around £5000 to pay for the full festival. We hope the festival will be self-financing and to also raise a surplus of funds in support of the valuable work of the Piece Project. 

This donation appeal is aimed at ensuring we have enough working funds to finance the festival in its early stages and will include:

  • Equipment costs,
  • Stage hire,
  • Production Costs,
  • Toilets, 
  • And more...

Please remember – none of the festival organisers get paid and the performers and artists appearing have donated their time for free, so your donations will go straight into covering the overall costs of this unique weekend event. Any surplus over costs will go to The Piece Project, 

In return of your generous donations, we have on offer; your name on the donation wall of fame (on-line), a chosen print of one of Eclectic Rhythms t-shirt designs, a free unique/hand screen printed/limited edition t-shirt designed by Eclectic Rhythm, day and weekend tickets, logo design work and a responsive businesses card website.



The Impact

The Shuttle Shuffle festival brings together various Yorkshire musical communities and artists. It is an opportunity to share and participate in, as well as to support the Piece Project's work. Your contributions will make a big difference in ensuring the festivals future and enabling the Piece Project to involve people from disadvantaged communities to participate in self expression, creativity and music.

The Piece Project is a company limited by guarantee: 8006878 It is a Not For Profit Organisation. Community Interest Company: Registration in Progress. Registered Office: 9 Factory Street, Bradford, Dudley Hill, Bradford, BD4 9NW.

Its mission is to encourage music to be made and shared for all to enjoy with a particular emphasis on involving people from disadvantaged communities.

The Piece Project has been established to help develop music and arts related activities that support social, creative and economic development. The organisation aims to create life enhancing music experiences  within the community and widen participation amongst the most disadvantaged communities.

The Piece Project is a regional music and arts educational CIC providing subsidised rehearsal space for musicians, offering training, educational support packages, mentoring, industry workshops, work placements, advice and guidance and providing exciting educational music projects for all.

Recent successful piece project events have included;

  • Band Club for people on the Autism Spectrum in particular those with Aspergers and Social Emotional Delays who have an interest in musical activities
  • These musical sessions include work on emotional literacy and supporting the participants with the management of social situations.
  • These sessions help build trust, confidence and new self awareness


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us out by spreading this page on social media sites such as your Blogspots, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit, forums etc. as well as donating to help.

  • Tell everyone you know to club together and donate whatever they can!
  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Post our plea to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram & anywhere else you can think of!
  • Ask a local business or work partners to sponsor us or donate.
  • Actions speak louder than words and we really need your help to actively spread the word of the festival so the community can thrive. 
  • Contribute to the programme, do what you're good at! Storytelling, juggling, yoga, music, dancing or anything else; we are open to your ideas!
  • You can always volunteer and join our festival family if you can’t afford a ticket or want to be more involved.

  • USE THE INDIEGOGO SHARING LINKS TO HELP SPREAD THE WORD!

Help us continue to be the first ever crowd funded multi-arts festival in Bradford! Get involved, make it happen and ensure that all can benefit from being involved in creativity!!

story:
What is Summer Bash?

Summer Bash 2014 is the 6th year we have put on a show in the town square here in Bath NY. In 2009 there were a few bands on a Saturday and a few people. Since then it has grown by leaps and bounds every year! 

Last year was the first year we had a pro stage and production, the headline show brought 1100 community members out to the park. People were inspired and entertained. The community talked about it for a long time to come. 

The goal for us at Revolution Music is to give back to the community that has done so much for us, and to inspire people of all ages to want to learn to play music. Music is a great tool to have for stress relief, fun around a campfire or even the experience of playing in a band,

 Why do we need your help?

The cost of the stage we provide is around $3000, insurance is another $1000, security, porta-potties, tents, production and more all costs money unfortunately. The minimum budget of this show is close to $8000

Last year we started raising money through local business sponsors, while we continue to do that we need to reach out to the community too in order to continue to make this grow. People have come to expect a great show out of this and we want to continue to be able to provide it. 

All money raised will go directly towards Summer Bash Expenses. If we raise more then needed it will be an even better show. No matter how much we raise our own Music Store, a small business on Liberty St in Bath NY will still fund a large portion of this event. 

What will You get for helping?

Keepsakes that will make memories last a lifetime! An exclusive promotional ID badge will go to every supporter. Shirts that are normally only thrown from the stage will be guaranteed for the next level of supporters and the most money we are asking for will also include an exclusive keepsake flash drive with songs from many of the bands that will play at Summer Bash 2014!

story:
Short Summary

We are a pop punk band from London, Ohio trying to fund our first full length album. Being in a band can be expensive, and trying to make your own CD is even harder. This campaign will also help us get new merch.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $500.  This will help us get our CD's printed and packaged, as well as getting some new merch!  By helping us out we will be giving out several different rewards depending on how much you donate. We understand not everyone can donate, but anything that you can gives helps us out more than you know!

    The Impact

    This album is something we have dreamed of for a long time. By donating, you are helping 4 small town teens expand their dreams. We want the world to be able to hear our music.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Spread the word! If you can't donate maybe one of your friends can!  Also you can check us out on social media!  www.facebook.com/secondstoryanthem or on twitter @the_real_ssa.

story:
Since we published our Colombia book/CD we have been thinking about where to go next. In truth, there was always just one destination... Brazil!

We love Brazil. We love the music, the culture, the people, the amazing landscapes. We love everything about it, so this summer we'll be focusing on Brazil for our second ever publication. Sounds and Colours Brazil will be a 200 page book of articles, photos and illustrations presenting the impossibly vibrant music and culture of Brazil, complete with a compilation album of new Brazilian music so you can hear exactly what we're talking about.

From Rio to Recife, from São Paulo to São Luiz, from the Southern plains of Porto Alegre to the pumping soundsystems of Amazonian Belém, we'll be covering every inch of Brazil, bringing its music, film, art and literature to life. With a team of expert writers, photographers and artists, S&C Brazil will be a passionate, in-depth, authoritative and thoroughly enjoyable journey into the Brazilian way of life.

We will be going in-depth on the diverse music scenes of South America's biggest country, looking at both Brazil's classic genres (samba, choro, forró, sertaneja) and the new, cutting-edge sounds surging in its cities today. We will be interviewing film directors, looking for the next "City of God" and writing about classics from the Cinema Novo movement. There will be articles about Brazilian literature, society and visual arts, in addition to artwork and illustrations from Brazilian artists.

Front and Back Cover of S&C Brazil

The Team

Sounds and Colours Brazil will be led by Marlon Bishop (MTV Iggy, Afro-Pop Worldwide) and Russell Slater (Sounds and Colours, Songlines). Our contributors will include S&C regulars as well as established experts on Brazilian music, film, art and culture. They will hail from both inside and outside Brazil, a mixture of academics, rock stars, and ordinary music lovers that will allow us to show a wide range of viewpoints.

These are the contributors currently lined-up for the project (with many more to be confirmed before the end of the fundraising campaign):

Lulina Abduzida, Alicia Bastos (Braziliality), Zach Bezold, Marlon Bishop, Rodrigo Brandão, Rob Curto, Arthur D'Araujo (illustrations), Christopher Dunn, Greg Scruggs, Sam Fraser, Amaya Garcia, Carlos A Gutiérrez, Ed Hart, Henrik Moltke (photos), Leo Nikolaidis, Raul Luna (illustrations), Robin Perkins, Tulipa Ruiz (illustrations), Lucas Santtana, Ed Siegle, Russell Slater, Gina Vergel, Kamille Viola, Zansky (cover design).

The Contents

This is a working draft of the contents for the book. Currently it's very music-centric as this is an area we've been working on a lot. As more articles are confirmed we'll be sure to keep these contents up-to-date.

New Music Section
- The New Sounds of Sao-Paulo
- Brazil's New Musical Renegades
- Rise of the Amazon
- Post Mangue Bit
- Fora do Eixo
- New Brazilian Artists To Watch
- Tecno Brega
- Baile Funk
- Brazil's New Electro Pioneers

Top 20 Most Influential Albums Of All Time (complete Top 20 TBC)
this will include the following albums:
- Milton Nascimento e Lo Borges "Clube Da Esquina"
- Joao Gilberto "Chega Da Saudade"
- Various Artists "Tropicalia: Ou Panis Et Circenses"
- Tim Maia "Racional Vol. 1"
- Jorge Ben "Africa Brasil"
- Os Novos Baianos "Acabou Chorare"
- Chico Buarque"Construção"
- Os Mutantes "Mutantes"
- Chico Science & Nação Zumbi "Da Lama ao Caos"
- Baden Powell, Quarteto em Cy e Vinícius de Moraes "Os Afro-Sambas"

The Rhythms of Brazil
- The Lapa Revival
- Sounding Out the Swamp: Recife, Pernambuco, and The Cultural Rise of Northeastern Brazil
- Serteneja: The Story Behind Brazil's Most Popular Style
- Forró For All
- Black Power In Salvador
- Reggae In Brazil
- The Story of Brazilian Hip-Hop
- Goiania Rock City
- Tropi-Psychedelia

Arts & Theatre
- Introduction to Brazilian Arts & Theatre by Alicia Bastos
- Focus on Contemporary Art Collectives in Sao Paulo & Rio de Janeiro
- Street Art in Sao Paulo
- Art Showcase

Film
- The Current State of Brazilian Cinema
- Recife: Brazil's New Capital of Cinema by Carlos A Gutierrez
- Joining The Dots from São Paulo S/A to O Som Ao Redor by Lucas Santtana

Illustrations by:
- Arthur D'Araujo
- Raul Luna
- Tulipa Ruiz

PLUS LOTS MORE TO BE CONFIRMED

The Music

We are yet to confirm the music for the accompanying CD but you can be sure that it will be a fine selection of some of the most interesting new artists coming out of Brazil. We will update this campaign as more artists are confirmed. For an idea of what kind of music we like just check out our compilations of music from São Paulo and Pernambuco. You can also listen to some of our favourite music at soundcloud.com/soundsandcolours.

What We Need

Quite simply we are aiming to raise enough money to print 1,000 copies of the book. Each book will have a full colour cover, a combination of black & white and colour pages internally and a compilation CD inserted in the back cover.

The entire cost of this print run comes to $5,300. As we are a small independent publisher and are trying to do this project without having to bow to advertisers (we feel our time is better spent researching Brazilian culture than arranging meetings with sponsors!) any money we can raise towards these costs would be hugely appreciated.

What You Get

You can see all of the perks on the right-hand side. These include combinations of S&C Brazil books, CD, downloads, t-shirts and tote bags, as well as copies of our first print edition S&C Colombia. If you're interested in Brazilian culture there really must be something for you!

When you get any perk you will also receive a huge thank you inside in the book as well as invites to any launch events (we are working on events in London, New York and Brazil at the moment).

Below is one of the designs for our t-shirts/tote bags. We're also looking at printing some of our specially-commissioned artwork onto these so there will be options available for those who buy one of these.

Some of the perks

Why Get Involved?

If you're familiar with the Sounds and Colours website or bought a copy of our first publication S&C Colombia you'll know that we do everything with real passion for South America, constantly looking beyond stereotypes and bringing you right up-to-date with what's happening culturally on our favourite continent.

When you buy a copy of Sounds and Colours in print, you help to cover the cost of printing the book and CD, a big undertaking for a small enterprise like ourselves. You are also supporting the writers in showcasing their talent, the independent Brazilian artists who have supplied artwork, the Brazilian musicians who have contributed to the CD, and the creation of a wider audience for Brazilian culture. Not to mention the fact that you will get a passionately-written, well-researched limited edition book that you will want to keep for years to come.

Brazil vs Colombia

For S&C Brazil we've been listening to all the feedback received from our first publication and will be making a number of changes. We'll therefore be bringing you wider margins, nicer fonts, more colour and will also be welcoming Marlon Bishop to our editorial team to ensure that the book is ready on time and of the highest quality!

A couple of sample pages

story:
Our Story

Hey there, we are Summerhill! We are passionate about Jesus and our heart is to lift Him high through our music. 

Over the past 5 years we have been so incredibly blessed with opportunity after opportunity to lead people in worship through music. For the first few years of our ministry we were singing great worship songs written by other artists. In 2012, we felt like the next step for our ministry was to begin writing songs that flowed from our own hearts and experiences and with the encouraging help of great friends, family and supporters we were able to go into the studio to record our debut album, "With Every Breathe [EP]." That first album was released on June 6, 2013. We were so inspired by the love and support that was sent our way and the way our album was received by all those that had the opportunity to hear it. 

So here we are a year later with a desire to take an even bigger step. While we absolutely loved the experience we had of getting in to a studio and recording our first album, we knew in our heart that something was just lacking with a studio album. We realized that we just can't quite bottle up the energy, emotion and experience that is there when we lead worship with and for others in a live setting. There's just nothing like a room full of people pouring out their hearts and lifting up their voices together. That's what we love and that's what we want to capture! So we have decided that for our second album we will get out of the studio and right into the heart of what our ministry is all about to create, Summerhill: Live at Bogg Springs (oh yeah, and we'll have about 1,000 people there to help us!).

This is absolutely a big undertaking and to be quite honest with you; it will not be possible to do it without your support. With your help and your help alone we will be able to make our live album on July 24th, 2014. 

What We Need

So if you’re thinking that recording a live album is more expensive than a studio album then you are exactly correct.  We are setting the goal to make this dream a reality at $10,000. This is a big number to ask for and we would not even consider asking if we did not believe in the incredible support system that we have with our friends, family and fans. 

This $10,000 will help us bring in a great producer and friend from Nashville who will be coming in to oversee the live recording and help us make the best album possible. The travel, set-up, rehearsals, tracking, recording, mixing, mastering, the design work, printing, distributing, promotion and all of the small details that go into making a live album really add up and every dollar we make in this campaign will go directly to this project. But here is the cool thing. We are not simply asking for your support without giving you anything in return. Oh no, we've got something to give you too!


What You Get (Perks!)

PERK OPTION 1:

  • This time around, we are making this extremely simple! Over the months of preparing and planning we kept thinking of a way to make this project more personal. So we decided to not only set a financial goal, but a goal to get more people involved. We are asking for 1,000 people to pre-buy our album for just $10. While our last campaign was a success and we achieved our goal, we had less than 50 backers help us raise all of the financial support. That means a few people invested a lot of money (thanks again!). But this time around we want more people to invest much less! This is a special request to us because we have had the opportunity to lead worship for several thousand people over the past 5 years and hope that through all the relationships we have built along the way, we will meet this goal. We believe that there are 1,000 people out there who will become part of the #SH1of1000! When you donate just $10 to our campaign we will send you an autographed copy of the album when it is released AND we will put your name in the thank you section inside the album artwork. (Help us spread the word by using our custom hashtags #SH1of1000 & #SummerhillGive10)


The next 2 rewards take a big jump in the financial game but are designed more specifically for churches, college ministries and youth ministries to step in and help us so we can turn around and help you!


PERK OPTION 2:

  • For a $1000 contribution to our Indiegogo campaign, Summerhill will come to your town and lead worship for your event!* This includes the whole band (schedules permitting), our full sound system, and our social media support for your event. We will work closely with your organization or church to make sure that the music for the worship service is custom tailored for your event and done at the highest quality. We will also make spending time with your group a top priority. We'll have conversations, sign autographs, take pictures, crack jokes, pray with your group or absolutely anything we can do to minister to the people at your event. We'll also give the leaders tons of free Summerhill merch to hand out (or keep for themselves!). We love being around and serving people and that's what it will be all about. 


PERK OPTION 3:

  • We have a heart for training and equipping worship bands. Because of this desire we have created a unique Music Ministry Clinic where we will spend the day mentoring your worship band. Every Music Ministry Clinic will be customized to fit the needs for your specific group. Have a young youth band who needs help in general? Have an experienced praise band transitioning to a blended or contemporary service? We can help with all of that! For a $1,000 contribution to our IndieGoGo campaign we will come in and serve your music team.*
  • So what would this day with your music team look like?.....
  1. Group Bible Study focused on Worship.
  2. Individual lessons: (acoustic guitar, electric, electric, bass, keys, drums, vocals, harmony, music theory, soundboard 101, mixing the room, monitor mixes, equipment, loops and click tracs, easy worship, pro presenter, etc...)
  3. Group lessons: (how to get the most out of your practices, travel logistics, band communication, band dynamics, creating an atmosphere, bringing it all together, etc...)
  4. One on one work on specific worship songs that your band is currently learning or desire to play.
  5. Bringing those individual parts together in full band practices guided by Summerhill.
  6. Role Models - Sometimes part of being a good band is seeing it lived out. Whether it'sharing a meal, cutting up or sharing and praying together it all builds solidarity. Throughout the day your group will see a loving and transparent Summerhill. 

* Some limitations apply with Perks 2 & 3. Because of the high cost of travel, we are willing to travel up to 250 miles (or approx. 4 hours) from Little Rock to lead worship for your event. If outside that distance, please contact us before donating as we may still be able to make arrangements. If your event would require Summerhill to stay overnight, we also ask that you provide food and lodging (we are not picky on either). If you have any questions or reservations about anything please contact us before donating. Summerhill strives to make our ministry as accomodating as possible, and we will do our best to come and make it happen.


Other Ways to Help

•  Pray for us! We need them big time over these next two months!

•  Follow Us! We are on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram (@summerhillband) and you can check out our website too (www.summerhillband.com). We will post updates on how the #SH1of1000 is going and give some sneak peaks of new music from time to time.


•  Spread the word like crazy! Light up the internet with all the posts, likes, retweets, shares, comments, favorites, forwards, emails and anything else you can do to spread the news on social media....it all helps so, so much. Basically you guys would be the biggest and best promotion team ever assembled (and all it takes is just a couple seconds to hit that button on your computer or phone).


Wrapping It Up....

We are just over a month away from all of this becoming a reality. There is no doubt that we are stepping out in faith on this project. But we believe so strongly in the new music that God has placed on our hearts and the opportunity that we have right in front of us to make this next album even greater than our first. We want Summerhill: Live at Bogg Springs to inspire people to worship Jesus daily through the music. Not because we are anything special but because the God we are singing about truly is!


Love, Summerhill
story_txt:
Our Story
Hey there, we are Summerhill! We are
passionate about Jesus and our heart is to lift Him high through our
music. 
Over the past 5 years we have been so
incredibly blessed with opportunity after opportunity to lead people in worship
through music. For the first few years of our ministry we were singing great
worship songs written by other artists. In 2012, we felt like the next step for our ministry was
to begin writing songs that flowed from our own hearts and experiences and with
the encouraging help of great friends, family and supporters we were able to go
into the studio to record our debut album, "With Every Breathe [EP]."
That first album was released on June 6, 2013. We were so inspired by the love
and support that was sent our way and the way our album was received by all
those that had the opportunity to hear it. 
So here we are a year later with a
desire to take an even bigger step. While we absolutely loved the experience we
had of getting in to a studio and recording our first album, we knew in our
heart that something was just lacking with a studio album. We realized that we
just can't quite bottle up the energy, emotion and experience that is there
when we lead worship with and for others in a live setting. There's just
nothing like a room full of people pouring out their hearts and lifting up
their voices together. That's what we love and that's what we want to capture!
So we have decided that for our second album we will get out of the studio and

story:
Hello World!

  • My name is Kookiat Suetrong, I live in Bangkok, Thailand. I've been working as a computer programmer for more than 20 years. During my career I worked for several companies including Microsoft, Nokia Networks and Diebold.
  • I just founded an open source organization called The Public Software Project which is similar to The Free Software Foundation, Linux Foundation, and Apache Foundation but focus on web application, please visit this page for more information: http://publicsoftwareproject.org


Introducing OpenBI

  • OpenBI is a Business Intelligence system. You don't have to know anything about database or computer programming to build an online interactive dashboard, everyone can do it in just a few clicks.
  • You can prepare your data from spread sheet, upload to the server, add a chart, set the column you want to see and done -- you get an interactive dashboard. Please play the above video to see how to do it.
  • OpenBI is 100% open source, written by standard HTML5. The back-end is server-side JavaScript (Node.js) with MySQL database. If you want to see the source code, please visit this GitHub page:  https://github.com/publicsoftware/OpenBI
  • OpenBI uses crossfilter, an open source technology for exploring large multivariate datasets. Please visit the OpenBI demo page and try to click on the pie charts to see how it works:  http://openbi.publicsoftwareproject.org/document/1

OpenBI is 100% open source and HTML5 open standard


The Rest Of Us

We need your help to hire and expand our team.

  • We have to hire more developers.
  • New domain name and cloud server to host the demo, database, source code, ebook, and video tutorial.
  • We will build these features even if the targets are not met, but without additional funding, it will take us much much longer. Additional funding will also allow us to build a better user interface, more features, better user's guide.
  • With your support, we can make an open source business intelligence software for everyone on our planet.

Changing theme in single click

What You See Is What You Get

Creating online dashboard is not hard, but OpenBI helps you to do in just 5 minutes. You can even print the dashboard to paper or PDF file. It works with any kind of data in spreadsheet CSV format, MySQL and AJAX.
OpenBI supports several type of charts, including:
  • Pie chart
  • Donut chart
  • Row chart
  • Line chart
  • Bar chart
  • Word Cloud
  • and more!

WYSIWYG - Creating interactive dashboard in just a few clicks

Made With Love <3

Please help us by sharing this project. OpenBI is made with love, for the rest of us, on our planet.

story:
NEW CRAZY IVANS ALBUM

We're making a new Crazy Ivans record and we need your help....

Hello friends, we've started this indiegogo campaign to help raise money towards a new Crazy Ivans record for you. It's been a few years since our last release and we have some great music that we want to get out to you.  Unfortunately, with no record label backing us or lucky lotto winnings, we are short of funds to get the album finished.  This is where you come in.  Some of you are our biggest fans and come to every show, some of you have heard our music before but never seen us, some of you are just stumbling upon this through some typo in a Google search.  Regardless of how you found us, this is your chance to be part of something very important to us and you'll get something in return via music and goodies (warm feelings and good vibes as well).

With your support, we're also offering signed CDs, digital downloads, t-shirts, memorabilia, and some other random pieces of swag.

ABOUT US

For the uninitiated, we're a Dallas based Rock band made up of a ragtag group of musicians with a hodgepodge of musical interests.  It all comes together like a Bacon casserole served with awesome sauce and eaten with a golden fork.  We've played with some cool people and done a few cool things, and with this new record, we hope to do a whole lot more.  Find, like, and share us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/TheCrazyIvans

Here's a few videos of us to get a feel of what we're like with a lot less green screen:




What We Need & What You Get

Our Funding goal is $2000.  This will cover the mixing and mastering of the record, as well as getting it prepared for physical and digital distribution

Please take a look at all of the perks that we have running for your kind funding of our project.  We will likely add more perks as we get more creative with what you guys might want.  Please feel free to give some moderately reasonable requests as well (this is our first time doing this).  We'll pack up the whole gang and play Budokan if you'll fund it.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help us out but absolutely cannot afford to part from your hard earned dollar, we understand.

Almost equally as important is to get this out to as many people as possible to help us reach our goal.  Please take a second to share this campaign on your facebook, twitter, forums, Reddit, random people on the street, your mailman,

Thank you all so much for taking the time to look at all of this and fund our goal.  It's been a long time coming for us (we will have birthed a combined 4 children in this band since our last record) and we can't wait to get these songs out to you.

Here's us getting a bit fast and raw for you:

story:
Short Summary

BIRMINGHAM, Alabama -- They're a brand-new band, looking to the past for inspiration.

Lead Belly. Blind Willie McTell. The Rev. Gary Davis. Robert Johnson. The Memphis Jug Band. Blind Blake. The Mississippi Sheiks. 

Say hello to the Steel City Jug Slammers, a group of young musicians playing traditional and homemade instruments. Like juke-joint heroes of the early 1900s, they perform Delta blues and old-time jug music. 

In Birmingham, you might find the Steel City Jug Slammers busking at the fountain in Five Points South, or doing a late-night show at The Nick. They're working hard, on the streets and in the nightclubs, to develop an audience in their hometown. (Next up: an April 5 performance at Matthew's Bar & Grill.)

The Steel City Jug Slammers are, from left, Jacob Mathews, Nick Bate, Corey Medders, Jerrod Atkins and Steven Bate. (Tamika Moore | tmoore@al.com)

"We want to bring this kind of music to Birmingham," says singer-guitarist Jerrod Atkins. "It's everywhere else. Alabama hasn't really witnessed it yet. It's coming back in a big way, and we're going to be part of it."

Compare them to Old Crow Medicine Show or theCarolina Chocolate Drops, and the Steel City Jug Slammers won't argue. They'd just like to get their washboard back -- someone stole it at a recent show -- and book more dates in the Southeast. 

For The Birmingham Sessions, the band played an original tune, "Save My Soul." Four core members of the group -- Atkins, Corey Medders, Nick Bate and Jacob Mathews -- were joined by Steven Bate on mandolin. 

The Birmingham Sessions, an online showcase for local and regional musicians, is produced by The Birmingham News and AL.com. Videos in the series are filmed inside two Airstream trailers at Bottletree Cafe, an Avondale concert venue. 

-Mary Colurso- al.com


What We Need & What You Get


  • We need at least $1000 to get this album pressed professionally.
  • We will offer a copy of our finished product to the first 20 contributors of $25 or more.
  • If we do not meet our goal the funds will still go towards pressing the album. We will be just a step closer!

The Impact


  • So much heart and soul has gone into this project .  We are ready to see it all come together.
  • This is our first go at something like this and couldn't have done it without our fans that have watched us grow along the way!
  • If we can get this pressed we will be the happiest group of young men you've ever seen!

Other Ways You Can Help


  • If you cant contribute just head on over to our Facebook and show some love! That's just as good in our eyes!
  • Just use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hi!  Joshua Cavanaugh here from Jackson, MS.  I am a history teacher by day and a rocker...well, weekend warrior rocker by night with my band Welcome II Rome (WIIR).  I am an independent artist passionate about making music and I am excited to introduce you to a special project I have been working on for awhile.


Through the video narrative for our song, Everlasting Winter, we wish to both honor and encourage our veterans, both combat and non-combat, that they have not been forgotten and to bring to a wider audience, through artistic expression, an awareness of some of the things our veterans may be working through daily.  


I wrote Everlasting Winter at a time when I felt unsure of this world and my place here.  It is a song forged in my experience as a non-veteran and yet, having spoken with friends and family who have served, seems to echo among those bravest among us who have been called to serve our country.  While many of our brothers, sisters, fathers, mothers, sons and daughters have left to fight with complete valor and honor, some have been tragically lost along the way. I know that not all who serve our country carry the physical, mental or emotional scars of conflict, but many of our servicemen and servicewomen have returned from their duties broken physically and emotionally only to find reintegrating back into civilian life has been more challenging than anything they have experienced before. This of course including deployment to the frontlines of our nation’s conflicts.  These men, women and their families deserve our utmost respect for their willing sacrifices to grant us the life of freedom we enjoy because of their duty and we should not let any suffer silently.


Therefore, my band, Welcome II Rome, and I, seek to have a World Release of our Everlasting Winter Music Video on Memorial Day (May 26, 2014) in honor of all the past, present and future brave men and women of our Armed Forces.  


Further, with a compassion for our country’s bravest, WIIR will donate a cumulative total of 10% to Non-Profits who are actively engaged in helping our veterans cope with PTSD and other injuries, including The Wounded Warrior Project, Active Heroes, etc.


Thank you for your interest and hopefully we can all make something special of this video, Everlasting Winter, with your help.


Sincerely,

Joshua Cavanaugh

Welcome II Rome


    ________________________________________


What We Need & What You Get

It is our hope that we can raise at least $4999 from our campaign to help offset some of our costs associated with the production/post-production of our music video, including giving 10% ($500) to those noble organizations helping our veterans.  


Our video production costs include:

  • Pre-Production:  Script Drafting, Locations, etc.
  • Production:  Video and Lighting Equipment, Props and Wardrobe, Hiring Cast & Crew, Craft Services and Travel Expenses
  • Post-Production:  Editing, Color Correction, Visual Effects, etc.


We have opted to setup a flexible funding campaign as we have already begun production on the video, so any funds raised will be a blessing to help with the final production of the video.  We will still honor our 10% giveback to the Non-Profits regardless of the level our campaign reaches.



THE PERKS:

(Each level includes all previously listed perks except for the limited edition props which are subject to availability on a first come first served basis.)


$1 -  Dollar Menu:  Every dollar helps. Your name will be listed in the credits as a contributor on Youtube/Vimeo uploads of the song to the WIIR channel as well as thanked by name on the WIIR Facebook feed.  


$5 - The Five Spot Level:  Free Digital Download of Lead Single “Everlasting Winter” with a Bonus Full Acoustic Version Track.

EVERLASTING WINTER (STUDIO CUT)

EVERLASTING WINTER (FULL ACOUSTIC CUT)


$10 - The Hamilton Level:  Free Digital Download of Joshua’s Bonus Track GOLDEN TICKET


$15 - Fifteen Minutes of Fame Level:  Free HD Digital Download of Music Video for all of your personal devices (Tablets: iPad, Kindle, etc. and Mobile Devices) and a Guitar pic signed by Josh


$25 - Circle of Honor Level:  Include a name of a fallen veteran family or friend in the "In Memoriam" list included at end of the video.  (Must be verified and confirmed.)


$50 - Early Adopter Level:  A USB flash drive containing additional new music and pictures from Joshua Cavanaugh and Welcome II Rome


$75 - Trendsetter Level:  WIIR T-Shirt signed by Joshua


$100 - Ultimate Fan Level:  Receive an autographed copy of the of the upcoming WIIR CD, T-Shirt, and USB flash-drive.


$250 - Bandcamp Level:  Jam with Josh at his practice space or Josh will sing a song for you or on your behalf to someone else (Song of your choice to the person of your choice.  In person within 45 miles of Jackson, MS or via Skype outside that radius.) 


$500 - Propmaster Level:  Claim a Prop from the production accompanied by an autographed High Resolution still from the video of Joshua and the cast (Limited Number of Props Available)

-American Flag

-Football

-Dogtags

-Red Beret

-Plastic Army Men Full Set

-Replica Purple Heart Medallion


$1000 - Summertime Level:  Pool your resources with your friends/family and receive a Live Personal Acoustic performance at your summer party or barbecue with full stage lighting and sound (10 Song Set within 300 miles of Jackson, MS)


$1500 -  Singer/Songwriter Level: Joshua will write an original song with/for you and post it on the WIIR social media sites. (Special Dedication Available) 


$2500 - Rockstar Level:  Signed Acoustic Guitar with WIIR Logo and Lyrics of Everlasting Winter handwritten by Joshua


$5000 -  Executive Producer Level:  Executive Producer Credit and be in Josh's next Music Video (This level includes all previously listed perks with the exception of the limited edition props which are subject to availability on a first come first served basis.)



Other Ways You Can Help

I definitely understand the realities of our current economic times and that some of you may be unable to contribute financially.  

I am simply overjoyed that you have given me a moment out of your busy life to listen to my pitch.  We still want you to feel a part of this project and the WIIR family.  

If you are willing to get the word out and make some noise among your circle of friends/family, we would be extremely grateful for your time and effort and consider you an honorary member of our WIIR family. :)

story:
Mutherpluckin' B

I'm a musician who record my own interpretations of music famous and not-so-famous Nintendo, Sega, C64 and PC games. This is my fourth album, entitled The Mushroom Variety Show, and it packs a combination of brand new tracks and material spanning over the last seven years. More eclectic than ever, this collection is inspired by country as much as 70s rock, and also features a small host of guest musicians.

Part of the album is already available for listening at http://mutherpluckin-b.com and the goal of this campaign is to produce a 40+ minutes long vinyl LP along with the digital version.

The Goals

  • If I reach $1500, The Mushroom Variety Show album will be produced on vinyl LP (40–45 minutes long) with color artwort (250 copies). This will feature at least three tracks not available on the free version of the album.
  • If I reach $1100, I will make a 7" single with full color artwork (250 copies) to go along with the digital version of the album. The single will feature at least one song not on the free version of the album.
  • If I reach less than $1100, depending on how much I get to, the money will go to making Mutherpluckin' B t-shirts and more music.

What You Get

  • If you donate $7 (€5) you will get the full 16-track digital download of The Mushroom Variety Show album (74 min long) with digital artwork. You will get this regardless of how close to the campaign goal I get.
  • Donate $22 (€16) (or more) and you will receive the Mushroom Variety Show on vinyl LP (40+ minutes long) with artwork, plus the full digital version. Only if I reach the $1500 goal.
  • Donate $14 (€10) (or more) and you will receive a 7" single with full artwork, plus the full digital version of the album. Only if I reach the $1100 goal.
  • Donate $14 (€10) (or more) and you will receive a Mutherpluckin' B t-shirt, plus the full digital version of the album. Only if I reach LESS than $1100.


More information about my campaign

The figures are based on quotes from xvinylx.com, through whom I plan to produce the vinyl records. They will be shipped from The Chech Republic to Sweden, and then from Sweden to you. The price levels above reflect the production costs + worldwide shipping. If you have any questions, you're welcome to contact me through my website at http://mutherpluckin-b.com.

If you decide to not donate anything, you are always welcome to my website http://mutherpluckin-b.com where you will find all my music.

Regardless if I meet my goals of this campaign, the album will be made available digitally on my website, both for free (13 track version) and for a low price (the full 16 track version).

story:
Short Summary

Hey guys, it's Michael here! Thanks for taking the time to check out our campaign.  The concept of "Now" was introduced to me a few months ago in the book "The Power of Now" and has really had an impact in my life.  The main idea behind living in the Now is to quiet your mind when you don't need it in order to feel more fully present in each moment and in turn, more alive.  

I started to realize that this idea had seeped into my music and my life in very profound ways, so I decided to start a project that includes my friends, and begin a multi-media campaign to spread the idea of Now to as many people as possible.  We have decided to record an album I have written inspired by this idea. Additionally, we plan to make a music video, a web series documenting how our project is going, and create a number of creative and alternative marketing campaigns in order to introduce the public to our work. 

For me, this project is truly my dreams becoming a reality, and it is also an opportunity for my friends to work in highly specialized fields and get hands on experience in the work they love doing. For me, it is the beginning of my career as a musician, and your help could not be more appreciated.  Making music is the biggest joy in my life, and this project will have 100% of my efforts dedicated to it.  Thank you so much in advance for letting us live our dreams!

What We Need & What You Get

The Impact

As you already know, we are asking for $2750 to put toward this project. Here is a more detailed breakdown of how the money is going to be spent.

Album: $1000

Mixing/Mastering: $300-400

Physical album production: $400-500

Online Distribution/misc. costs: $100-200


Music Video: $1000

Equipment: $800

Transportation/Food for crew: $200


Marketing/General Equipment : $500

Misc Budget: $250

This is mostly to cover the Indiegogo fees, but will also be used toward any miscellaneous costs or expenses we have along the way.

Additional funding:

Any money we raise past the goal amount will go to producing an even better project. We will put additional funding towards higher quality equipment, editing, rewards, and use it to make this project go above and beyond even our expectations.

    Risks & Challenges

    One of the most obvious challenges for this project is raising the funding we need. While we're aware it's a significant amount of money, we're hoping the generosity of our friends, family, and fan base will allow us to match or exceed our funding.

    We are dedicated to making this project as high quality as possible, even if we are unable to raise our goal. Obviously, the more money we raise, the better quality this project will be, but we believe that we can create something really incredible, and we're confident that we can make it happen.

    Other challenges along the way could include things like scheduling conflicts and unexpected expenses, but our core team is dedicated and professional, and we believe that we can face any hardships with positivity and a determination to overcome.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      One of the biggest things we're asking is to spread the word, even if you are unable to donate to our project. We plan to have the music video and the album available to stream for free once the project is completed, and while any financial contribution would be ideal, the most important thing is spreading our message and our music. So please share this project with your friends and family, and help us teach everyone about the power of Now!
